 Ella se ha dedicado toda su vida a la Costuraría, sin embargo hasta hace poco pudo independizarse y crear su propio negocio. Es por esa razón  que ella necesita un préstamo de ₡500000 (Quinientos  mil colones) para la compra de materiales y diferentes tipos de telas para su trabajo.  Ella quiere dar una mayor variedad de servicios, para que su negocio siga creciendo. Una de sus metas principales es ir renovando su equipo de trabajo.
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Elizabeth H. V. is a resident of Canalete de Alajuela, she is an enterprising woman and owner of “Creaciones Mely”, a dressmaking business.
 She has spent all her life as a seamstress, however it was not until recently that she was able to become independent and start up her own business. This is why she needs a loan for ₡500000 (Five hundred thousand colones) in order to purchase materials and different types of fabrics for her work.  She wants to offer a wider variety of services, so that her business continues to grow. One of her main objectives is to update her work equipment.
She is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Buy materials and fabrics

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es: La Sra. San Juanita, es una señora que le gusta mucho estar siempre al tanto de su casa, ella a avanzando cada vez mas en el mejoramiento de su vivienda, y ahora su deseo es  instalar protecciones a su domicilio, ya que ahí vive con su hija y una nieta, su miedo es que cuando ella este ocupada, la nieta salga al patio que da a la calle y como pasan muchos automóviles por esa calle ya que es muy transitada ella teme que puedan atropellar a su nieta, por este  motivo esta utilizando este crédito para poner la protección del frente de la casa que además de proteger a su familia protegerá la vivienda y cuando ellas decidan salir fuera saldrán sin preocupación.
texts.en:
San Juanita is a woman who enjoys watching after her house very much.  She has progressed a little more each time with home improvement and her wish now is to install security devices on her home because she lives there with her daughter and granddaughter.  

Her fear is that when she’s busy her granddaughter might go out into the yard that leads to the street and, because many cars go by on that street because it has a lot of traffic, she fears her granddaughter could be run over.  

Because of this she is using this loan to install protective devices on the front of the house which, besides protecting the family, will also make it possible for them to leave the house unattended worry free.

loans.use: To install security devices on her house.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine M. is 34 years old, married, and has five children. Christine is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company. She needs the loan to purchase more clothing to sell at her market stall. She has been in business for four years and has two employee in her shop. With her additional profits, Christine will buy a plot of land, build her own house, pay school fees for her children, and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single man living with his parents and one sibling. He is from Lebanon. He has worked as freelance textiles trader since 2003. He has worked in this domain for 10 years.  He sells his products to various clothing factories and tailoring shops. As per the majority of the Lebanese guys, he helps his family with the household.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional textiles in order to increase his sales and his income. He has high hopes for the future of his business and looks forward to open his own clothing store.

loans.use: to purchase additional textiles

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is also a very caring mother who is bringing up her children very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her son wants to improve his mobile phone selling business. He has a shop in the market where he sells new and used mobile phones and mobile phone accessories. Through his shop, he offers mobile phones in different price ranges, which helps him target every kind of client. With the loan, he will buy mobile phones and mobile accessories to put in his shop to sell and earn good profits. He has been doing this business for the past six years and Shahnaz is hopeful that a loan will help him do his business better. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.  

Shahnaz lives in Kasur, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its leather industry. She has been living there in a small two-room home in the area of Pakka Qilah for the past 10 years. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and mobile accessories to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda, a 38-year-old married mother of six children, operates a business selling seaweed. Her husband is a seaweed farmer, so she sells his harvest and  also buys from other farmers. In this business for two years, Hilda earns about 4000 PHP per month. She is now requesting a loan of 6000 to buy more seaweed to resell.  In the future, she wants her business to be stable.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed to resell.

loans.name: Leonille

texts.en:
Leonille is 56 years old. She has three children, the youngest of whom is 13 years old. The eldest finished high school and the youngest is currently in school. The other was not able to continue school. 

Leonille sells banana juice and sorghum, working with her husband. She has operated this business since 1975. She is requesting a loan to buy more banana juice and sorghum in order to make more profits. She plans to reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy banana juice.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with a 26-year-old child. She is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She helps her husband grow rice and corn. They own a cow that is very useful in tilling the land. While her husband mainly manages the farm, she focuses on keeping her piggery clean and the pigs healthy. Rosemarie earns about 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. 

This loan will be used to purchase piglets and feed. In the future, she hopes to be rich and expand her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Las Malvinas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Susana  es casada, tiene 3 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Las Malvinas” grupo  conformado por 13  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Susana   trabaja desD. hace 8 años en la venta D. comida este trabajo  surge a raíz D. que a su esposo ganaba sueldo mínimo y no podía cubrir los  gastos básicos,  alimentación,  educación y pago D. servicios,  es así que Susana   pone su puesto D. comida, hoy en día tiene muchos clientes y eso le genera buena ganancia y también desD. hace tres años Susana junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta D. zapato y prendas D. vestir,  y las prendas y zapatos los venD. en provincia. Susana  trabajo muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos , sus hijos van a colegios privado,  y sobre todo  su familia tiene una mejor calidad D. vida  ,  con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería prendas D. vestir y zapatos . Sabemos que Susana cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Susana is married and has three children.  She is a member of the “Las Malvinas” communal bank which has 13 members dedicated to various commercial activities.

Susana has worked for 8 years selling food.  This business arose because her husband earned minimum wage and it was not enough to cover basic needs, food, schooling and utility payments.  Therefore, Susana set up her food stand and today she has many customers which generate good profits.  Three years ago she and her husband also started selling articles of clothing and shoes.  They sell these out in the countrysiD..  

Susana worked very hard to move her family ahead and thanks to her effort and dedication she’s attained improved income; her children attend private schools and, above all, the family has a better quality of life.

With the thought in mind of continuing to grow she has asked for a new loan to buy clothing and shoes.  We know that Susana will meet her goals with much work and effort and that Edaprospo loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing (clothes and shoes).

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with four children.  All of them go to school. She doesn't take care of  additional family members.  She sells vegetables at the market and works seven days a week.  She has been in the business for the last six years.

She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of tomatoes and onions.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of boxes of tomatoes from the villages.  Margaret aspires to grow vegetables herself.  She resides in a rented house and does not have access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира проживает в Кулябском районе. Она замужем. У неё один ребёнок. Она имеет среднее образование. Более 5 лет Замира занимается шитьём женских национальных платьев. Она берет кредит для покупки разных видом тканей, чтобы сшить и продать их.
texts.en: Zamira lives in the region of Kulob. She is married and has one child. She has secondary education. Zamira has been sewing traditional national women's dresses for more than five years. She is taking out the loan to buy different kinds of fabrics to make and sell dresses.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fabrics

loans.name: Esther Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esther está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo Arelis de los Ángeles quien vende cosméticos y ropa desde hace cuatro años. Ella vende aproximadamente 3,300 cordobas semanal.

Las otras integrantes son María Esperanza quien realiza enchiladas y tajaditas y Walter José tiene un taller artesanal de calzado.
texts.en:
The “Esther” group is composed of three hard working, enterprising people.  Arelis de los Ángeles who has sold Cosmetics and clothes for the last four years is the group coordinator.  She sells about 3300 cordobas worth weekly.

The other members are María Esperanza, who sells enchiladas and ‘tajaditas’ (fried plantain) and Walter José who has an artisanal shoe shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 55 years old and is married with three children, all of whom live separately from her. Her occupation is selling different types of bread in the local market of her city, Calca. Delia wakes up early each morning to make her bread fresh daily at a local place where she rents an oven. 

She is asking for a $1,200 loan mainly to help pay for the rent on her oven but also to buy ingredients such as wheat, flour, and sugar. Delia is a hardworking woman and is committed to making the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for the rent on her oven and to buy ingredients such as wheat, flour, and sugar to make bread

loans.name: Atagai

texts.en:
Atagai, age 24, provides dressmaking services to local community members. She has one year of experience in this business. 

Atagai needs a loan in the amount of WST $1,000 to purchase a new sewing machine. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Atagai and her husband have one child.

Atagai joined SPBD earlier this year in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Atagai's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business

loans.name: Orilla Del Itata Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Orilla del Itata” lo conforman 17 emprendedoras que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran preparación de comida rápida, artesanía en madera y greda, preparación de tortillas, venta de ropa usada y nueva en una feria libre y repostería. Todas ellas pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Ruth integrante del banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en el segundo puesto de derecha a izquierda, vistiendo una chaqueta color café, quien además tiene su pulgar hacia arriba. Se dedica a confeccionar disfraces desde hace 3 años. Comenzó con 20 disfraces ya hora cuenta con 200 disfraces. Ella compra géneros y moldes para luego confeccionar, arrendar o vender.
Durante los meses comprendidos de agosto a diciembre se dedica a confeccionar disfraces, ya que durante el resto de los meses los pedidos tienden a disminuir. Por lo que se dedica a reparar ropa y realizar algunas costuras de manera particular.
Ruth trabaja desde su misma casa, ahí confecciona y vende. Además comenta que cuenta con hartos clientes, sobre todo adolescentes.
Su mercadería la compra en las ciudades de Concepción y Santiago. 
Con el crédito comprará géneros, broderi, telas, cintas, cierres, adornos, tul y raso. 
Sus metas son tener un local establecido en el cual pueda vender sus disfraces, cotillón para fiestas. Además le gustaría comprar una máquina de coser overlock, ya que por ahora solo cuenta con una máquina de coser costura recta. 
Ruth vive junto a su madre, sus 4 hijos de 21, 19, 11 y 8 años de edad y un nieto de 2 años. 
Sus sueños a nivel personal son estudiar diseño de vestuario y especializarse en la confección de vestidos de novia. 
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben a que Ruth es el único ingreso económico familiar, además le ha permitido tener una flexibilidad horaria, para criar a sus hijos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios otorgados por Fondo esperanza, ya que ha podido invertir en su negocio. Comenta que conoce hace bastante tiempo a los demás integrantes del grupo del banco comunal y que tienen una muy buena relación y compromiso entre ellos. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Orilla del Itata” (Shore of the Itata) and it has 17 members who are involved in a variety of lines of work among which are: fast food making, wood and clay crafts, tortilla making, used and new clothes sales in a free market and pastry making.  All of them are from the city of Chillán.

Ruth is a member of the communal bank.  In the photo she’s seated in the second spot from right to left wearing a brown jacket and pointing her thumb up.  She has been making costumes for the last three years.  She started out with 20 costumes and now she has 200.  She buys patterns and designs to make them and then rent or sell them.

During the months between August and December she makes costumes because the other months orders tend to decrease so then she works doing clothing repairs and making some individual articles of clothing.  Ruth works at home; she sews and sells there.  She also comments that she has many customers especially teenagers.  She buys her merchandise in the cities of Concepción and Santiago.

She will use the loan to buy patterns, lace, fabric, ribbon, zippers, decorations, tulle and satin.  Her goals are to have an established locale where she can sell her costumes and party supplies.  Besides, she’d like to buy an overlock sewing machine because she currently only has a straight stitch sewing machine.

Ruth lives with her mother and her four children who are 21, 19, 11 and 8 years old and with a 2-year-old grandson.  Her dreams on a personal level are to study clothing design specializing in wedding gowns.

Her motivation to stay in business is that Ruth is the only source of family income.  Besides, it’s allowed her flexibility in her schedule to be able to raise her children.

She is very happy and grateful for services rendered by Fondo Esperanza because she’s been able to invest in her business.  She comments that she’s known the other group members for quite some time and they have a very good cooperative relationship among them.

Chillán is a commune in south-central Chile.  Its name means “Seat of the Sun” in Mapudungun, the indigenous language of the Mapuche people.  Chillán is known as the “Cradle of the Nation” or “Land of Artists” due to the outstanding people in Chile’s history that have been born here like, for example, the well known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy costume making supplies.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child.
 
Erick has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Erick has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Erick hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is 45 years old.  She has passed the 10th standard in school. Through her education, she got a clerk's post in a company. She serves them by working 8 hours a day. She also owns & operates a sewing business at her home to supplement the income for her family.  Her husband has started a tailoring business. He sews men's clothes in particular and earns reasonably good income.  
Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, because she wants to buy a new sewing machine and hire an assistant to expand her sewing business. A new machine will allow her to take more orders and finish them on time to increase her profits. 
She is very expert in her business and very confident that an investment will be beneficial for her.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Yakelin

texts.es:
Yakelin es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un  hijo  Ella cuenta con estudios de educación superior.
Se dedica a la venta de comidas al paso en el mercado central de Puno, su esposo la ayuda con la economía realizando servicio de taxi.  Desde hace tres años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo anterior fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de un carrito para la venta de comida al paso (salchipapas).
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará llantas e invertirá en el mantenimiento de su carro para que su esposo pueda continuar con el servicio de taxi y así permitir el ingreso de dinero diario.
La señora desea tener otro carro y tener un restaurante donde pueda vender más productos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Yakelin is a member of the communal bank "Bellavista". It is located in the district of Puno, province and department of Puno. She is 27 years old and she is married common-law. She has one son. She has a post-secondary education.

She sells fast foods in the central market in Puno. Her husband contributes to their finances by providing taxi services. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) movement for the past three years. Her previous loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles. The funds were used to purchase a fast-food card (salchipapas - a traditional dish consisting of french fries and sausages). 

With this new loan, amounting to S/. 1,500 nuevos soles, she will purchase tires and she will invest in the maintenance repairs of her husband’s car. This will enable him to continue providing taxi services and it will permit him to continue to earn a daily income.

She wants to have another car and she wants to have a restaurant from where to sell more products. What she enjoys about the communal bank is the easy loan process.

loans.use: to purchase tires and to invest in the maintenance repairs of her car.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Alfonsa is 77 years old; she is a widow with six kids and resides at Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. To make a living, Alfonsa raises a garden, and she earns 9,000 Philippines pesos (Php) monthly with this work. 

Alfonsa requested a loan of 12,000 Php to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She's been member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Alfonsa plan to improve their house to live in convenience.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 45 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in Uganda. She is single and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Rose has been working hard to manage her business which sells timber. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more wood, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to build an estate. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more wood.

loans.name: Laddie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Laddie works hard to support her family. She buys and sells vegetables in Bais in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Laddie has been sustaining her business with the help of her past fifteen loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell.

Laddie hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Soteria

texts.en:
Soteria is a 21-year-old woman living in the town of Vailoa Palauli. She is married and does not have any chlidren. To make a living, Soteria owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Soteria has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately WST 800 a month from these activities.

In 2011, Soteria joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Soteria is requesting a loan of WST 1,000, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be her first loan from SPBD. Soteria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 30-year-old married woman with six children. Three of them are in school. She has had a business of selling tea in Yei, South Sudan for five years. Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for sale.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Leonisa has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Leonisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Leonisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 60-year-old widower with three children. He has been in the mixed crop farming business for the past 3 years with a monthly income of about Kes 5,600 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan of Kes 15,000 with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Peter will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children.

 His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig raising which will help him diversify his income and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Nonvitcha 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVITCHA 2 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Hélène est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Hélène est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Hélène a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Hélène est mariée à un certain Dénis. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Hélène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Hélène vend depuis sept ans, des tissus, des sacs de riz par le système de distribution. De façon secondaire, Hélène vend des jus de citron et du sucre. Hélène s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaires et son revenu, Hélène sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVITCHA 2, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The group NONVITCHA 2 is composed of three people who live in the same area. This is the third time that the group is asking for financial support from Alidé, in order to increase the level of their business activities. The representative of the group, named Hélène, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Hélène is thirty-eight years old and lives in Benin. Hélène stopped attending school at the secondary level. Hélène is married to someone named Dénis. The couple has two children, both in school and in their care. Hélène lives together with her husband and children. The couple provides together for the various household expenses. In order to provide for the various expenses of the family, Hélène has sold fabrics and bags of rice through a distribution system for seven years. Additionally, she sells lemon juice and sugar. Hélène stocks up in a market in Benin. In seeking her clients' satisfaction and to increase her turnover and revenue, Hélène is asking for, together with the other members of the group NONVITCHA 2, a third loan from Alidé. The first two loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and bags of rice.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Para Humberto contar con el apoyo de un crédito es un gran apoyo, pues lo ayuda a solventar mejor sus gastos y cultivar a tiempo, él cuenta que gracias a los créditos le ha ido muy bien pues varios cambios ha visto, porque ahora ya cultiva con más frecuencia y su  cultivo ha incrementado, por esa razón agradece a los inversionistas que confíen en él.
Humberto con el afán de cultivar en el próximo mes ha decidido solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de semillas, he insumos agrícolas, con esta nueva inversión espera obtener una buena cosecha y seguir prosperando para el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de semillas he insumos agrícolas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
This young man is a very kind and a responsible person. 
He is 48 year old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region , settled in Fizuli region Behmenli village. He is married and has 2 children. 
Having borrowed $400 he repaired his gas station.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy new apparatus.
He has run this business for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy new apparatus

loans.name: Uputaua

texts.en: Uputaua is married and has two children.  She lives with her children and husband in a small Samoan village.  She joined SPBD because she is focused on her family’s future and knows that her husband’s income alone cannot provide a future of education and opportunity for their children.  With her first loan from SPBD she set up a flea market business selling shoes, clothes and perfume.  The business income is having a really positive impact on her family and she is anxious to expand the business.  With additional loan funds, she would like to expand the business by selling more merchandise (e.g. personal care items), food and drinks.  She dreams of opening up a full-scale restaurant. Given the success of her initial foray into entrepreneurship, SPBD feels confident that she is capable of realizing her dream.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk to resell at her flea market stall

loans.name: Al

texts.en: Al T. is a 34 year old man. He is married and has 3 children. T. is an artisan who manufactures small ice cream and fresh juice plastic bags. He sells his products to ice cream and fresh juice producers. T. lives with his family in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. His artisan workshop is located in the Yopougon open market. He started this work when he was 11 and has now gained a lot of experience. T.’s children all go to school and he pays the education fees from his artisan activities. T. wants to purchase new modern equipment that costs about US$3500. He has saved about US$2000. This equipment will help T. to increase production and improve his performance and financial strength. T. is ambitious and has been a good performer since he joined AE&I in March 2006.

loans.use: To acquire modern ice cream bag processing equipment

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a grown daughter. They live in Primorsk. Tatyana runs a small retail business selling food items, like baked goods, beverages and snacks. Her business is located in the local vending pavilion called “Looch” (“Ray”). It’s a favorable location as there are no other markets in this area of Primorsk. Tatyana loves people, she works hard to meet the demands of her customers  by offering a wide variety of groceries. Presently, her turnover capital is about $4000. Monthly profits amount to about $1500. 

Tatyana would like to borrow $1200 to increase the assortment of her inventory, reconstruct her vending facility and add a few more vending stalls to her pavilion. She knows that success doesn’t come easy. However, she willingly embraces all the difficulties and challenges that come along the way. We believe Tatyana’s ability to think creatively and identify opportunities in her environment will help her succeed and repay the current loan.

loans.use: To reconstruct his vending facility and increase stock

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en: Mrs. Chhum S., 28, is married with 2 school-aged children and lives in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. To provide for her family, Mrs. Chhum S. works on her plot of farmland growing rice crops, while her husband works in construction, earning together around $3 per day on average. This couple is requesting a loan of $500 to replace their old, ruined grinding mill so that they won’t only grind their family crops but also can make additional profits when the mill is needed by their neighbors.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill to replace her old and ruined one.

loans.name: Caroline Ah

texts.en:
Caroline Ah P. was one of the first clients of our loan program, but has been out of work for the last few months because of an injury to her arm. She has three children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is an excellent and very popular carpenter, and has been the family's sole means of support since Caroline's injury.

Now that she has recovered, Caroline has applied for a loan to start an elei (a traditional Samoan fabric) printing business. She will work on her elei for six days a week and take her goods to market each Saturday, where she will sell them to people who own retail shops and have stalls in the local flea market. Caroline is excited to be doing this, now that she has recovered from her illness and making a new start.

loans.use: To buy materials for her elei printing business

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti, 22, has a waste materials business, earning USD5 a day, while her husband, Kosasih, does not work anymore. The family depends on Siti's business. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of USD100 to expand her business. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 55-year-old car mechanic. He lives in the Beirut suburbs with his family. This is the third time Ali is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. He needs US$ 1000 to help him buy the necessary materiA. to sustain his business so he can pay his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To buy materials for his little auto repair business

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en: Bibiana is a single mother of a twenty-year-old daughter who goes to the university. To make a living and continue supporting her daughter, Bibiana sells underwear to men and women of the Doña Ana community of San Cristobal. She has been running this business for more than ten years. Bibiana also has a stall which she sets in a public place, and the passers-by visit it to purchase the fruits and vegetables she’s selling. Bibiana explains that she has to face a hard competition in the area, but she expects that her new underwear patterns and styles will help her attract more people in the market and increase her revenue. Bibiana wants to maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To add new styles of underwear to her store in order to attract new clients.

location.town: Doña Ana community of San Cristobal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 7 bales of second-hand shoes

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a 32 year old mother of nine children. She lives in one of the slums of Kisumu in Kenya and runs a community pharmacy in the area. She started her pharmacy in 2001 and the community knows her personally from her seven years of good work. Dina was trained by KMET as a community health worker and has also been providing home-based care services for people living with HIV/AIDS for these past seven years.

She sells her drugs at lower prices than her competitors and at times gives free drugs to clients who cannot afford them. Her highest selling products are painkillers, antimalarials, family planning drugs, allergy medications, drugs to treat ulcers, worms and skin infections, and various syrups for children to treat malaria and upper respiratory infections. Dina is applying for her fifth loan of $700 to further expand her pharmacy.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand her community pharmacy.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
In the district of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, Mr. José Francisco Hernández S. is the father of one son, for whom he has to take care of and provide daily sustenance. He has dedicated himself to the agriculture and livestock industry since he was very young and has acquired experience and in this way is able to maintain his family.

Today this gentleman needs to promptly acquire the economic resources to buy cows with the objective of raising them in his farm where he has arduously cultivated vegetables. This has been the motive for which Mr. José Francisco has come to Ceprodel to obtain the loan necessary for the purchase so that he can continue caring for his humble family that really needs his support.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega el señor José Francisco Hernández S. es padre de un niño el cual debe de mantener y proporcionarle el sustento diario. Se dedica al negocio agropecuario desde que era muy jovencito, así ha venido adquiriendo experiencia y de esta manera es como mantiene su núcleo familiar.

Hoy en día la necesidad que este caballero atraviesa es la pronta adquisición del recurso económico para la compra de vacas con el objetivo de criarlas en su finca donde muy arduamente realiza sus cultivos de hortalizas. Este ha sido un motivo por el cual el señor José Francisco ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra y de esta manera continuar con el mantenimiento de su humilde familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase cows

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa sells chuño (freeze-dried potato), soaked corn and wheat and she commercializes her products walking around the markets in the south area of the City of the Peace. Her house is located in the area of Irpavi Vergel in the city of La Paz. This is the first time that she is requesting a loan with Impro. The loan will be use to increase her working capital and to buy more Chuño, peeled corn and wheat, that are her main products. The loan will help her improve her conditions of life since her income will increase with the sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Felipa se dedica a la venta de chuño , maiz y trigo remojado y comercializa su producto ambulando por lo mercados de la zona sur de la Ciudad de la Paz. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Irpavi Vergel de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. El crédito será destinado para aumentar su capital de Trabajo y comprar más Chuño, maiz pelado y Trigo, que son sus principales productos. El crédito le ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida ya que aumentará sus ingresos en sus ventas.

loans.use: Buy chuño (freeze-dried potato), peeled corn and wheat.

loans.name: Lucienne Founke

texts.fr:
Born around 1971 in Kétou in the Plateau department of southeastern Benin, Ms. Lucienne Founke O. is married to Roger Singbo and has 4 children who are all in school. Ms. O. lives in Lokokoukoumé, one of the neighborhoods in the city of Cotonou, where she sells various types of fruit such as bananas, oranges, pineapples, and other seasonal fruits. She buys her stock in the most remote villages of Benin, where fruit is relatively less expensive. Her current stock does not allow her to keep up with customer demand. In order to meet this ever-growing demand, she is requesting this loan so she can improve her business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Née vers les années 1971 à Kétou dans le département du Plateau au Sud-est du Bénin, dame O. Lucienne Founke est mariée à SINGBO Roger et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Dame O. Lucienne Founke est domiciliée à Lokokoukoumè un des quartiers de la ville de Cotonou où elle exerce son activité de vente de diverses sortes de fruits tels que les bananes, les oranges, l'ananas et autres fruits de saison. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villages les plus reculés du Bénin où les fruits sont relativement moins chers. Son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de satisfaire entièrement la demande de sa clientèle. Pour faire face à cette demande de plus en plus grandissante, elle demande ce crédit afin de mieux se positionner sur le marché de vente de fruits saisonniers.

loans.use: Purchase of three baskets of mangos and a pile of pineapples

loans.name: Magatte

texts.fr: Magatte N. est une femme agée de 59 ans. Elle habite à Bambey au quartier DVF, malgré son age , elle s'adonne au commerce de bijoux et de tissus depuis quatre ans.Elle tire des revenus subtentiels sur ce commerce. Avec les fetes qui s'approchent, elle veut renforcer son stock et  sollicite ce pret à cet effet.
texts.en:
Magatte N. is 59 years old. She lives in the DVF neighborhood of Bambey and, despite her age, she has devoted herself to the sale of jewelry and fabrics for four years. She generates a great deal of revenue in this business. She is requesting this loan to strengthen her supply for the upcoming holiday.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jewelry and fabric sales

loans.name: Vailaasia

texts.en: Vailaasia M., 30, is married with three children.  She has three years of experience in the food business, making pancakes. She sells to the general public in her village five days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).  SPBD loans are Vailaasia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Vai is requesting a loan for the first time and wishes to start her own pancake business.

loans.use: Purchase sack of sugar, flour, cooking oil, yeast and frying pan.

loans.name: Yoy

texts.en:
Mrs.Yoy K. was born in 1969 and lives in Andoung Samreth Village in Takeo Province. She is a widow and the mother of one child who is attending the local school. 

She is a pig breeder, and in her business she faces an obstacle because she does not make much money to earn her living and support her business. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs.Yoy K. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food and five pigs. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy pig food and five pigs.

loans.name: Jazmina De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Sra. Jazmina tiene 31 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Sabana grande, es madre soltera y con un hijo de 8 años de edad, que lo tiene estudiando en la escuela del barrio, su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos desde hace siete años esta en las ventas, el cual inicio con dinero que presto en Afodenic para aumentar las ventas pues vendía poco, lo cual logro aumentar su inventario y captar mas clientes. Con esta solicitud seria la tercera, la cual va invertir en comprar ropa, camisas escolares. A largo plazo es adquirir más clientes, vender otros productos y ayudar a su hijo con los estudios.
texts.en:
Jazmina is 31 years old and lives in the “Sabana Grande” neighborhood of Managua. She is a single mother to an 8-year-old son who attends school in the neighborhood. For seven years she has sold clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. She began her business with a loan from Afodenic which enabled her to increase her inventory and attract more customers. Prior to her initial loan, she had sold very little. This will be her third loan, and she intends to invest it in clothing and school uniforms. In the long term, she wants to expand her customer base, sell more products, and help her son with his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes for children and adults

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Señora María de 41 años de edad está felizmente casada hace 20 años con el Señor Esteban Martínez de  47 años. El matrimonio tiene dos hijos, de los cuales uno  de ellos tiene un taller de motos en el cual le va muy bien y ayuda con los gastos de la casa a sus padres. 
 Doña María se encuentra al frente de una Despensa  en el cual se inició hace 2 años con un ahorro que contaba  Actualmente ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada.  Como sueño personal desea ampliar su negocio y poder así ofrecer más variedades de productos  a su clientela.
La clienta solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías varias como frutas, pan dulces, sidra ya que en estas fiestas de fin de año posee gran demanda de estos productos. También hortalizas y carne.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old. She’s been happily married to Esteban Martínez of 47 for 20 years. They have two children. One of them owns a successful motor shop and helps his parents with the home expenses. María works at the grocery shop she opened 2 years ago using her savings. Today she has a vast clientele. Her dream is to enhance her business so she can offer a larger variety of products to her customers. María is requesting for a loan to purchase miscellaneous products such as fruit, pantone, cider and other items for sale that are usually on demand during the end of the year festivities. She will also purchase vegetables and meat.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase fruit, meat, cider, panetone, etc...

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. is 33 years old and a divorced woman with two children. Currently both her kids are in school. Gladys has been selling frozen foods like chicken, pork, mutton, fish, etc. in the local market of Apatrapa in the Kumasi for a year now. Through hard work and determination, Gladys is doing well in providing for the basic needs of her kids especially their education. Sometimes getting money to pay her kids' education fees becomes a challenge for her. As a single parent, she is doing all her possible best to cater for her kids through the income from the business she runs.

Gladys does not have adequate funds to support her business. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices in the marketplace. With the loan, she wants to purchase more cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, pork, and sausages to enable her to raise enough income to expand her sales. She would be grateful for your support.

Gladys belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame naye’ which means "Good living". She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, and smoked fish, etc.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan  es socio del Bancomunal Maria de al Paz. 
Juan es conviviente, tiene 41 años, tiene un hijo de 13 años que estudia en la escuela particular. 
Juan estudia administración de empresas y decidió poner un negocio, pero los negocios que emprendía le iban mal, le estafaban, sufrió asaltos, pero salió adelante gracias al apoyo de su familia, con la liquidación que recibió en  la empresa donde trabajaba. Puso  otro negocio;  El negocio de Juan desde hace cinco años es la venta de licor, tiene una  tienda se llama  “YEMBA –YEMBA”
Juan, ha pasado por varios negocios  y él más rentable ha sido la venta de cerveza y gaseosas.
Desde que esta en Finca, puede mantener un stock de mercadería, en el bancomunal aprendió la unidad que hay entre las socias.
Juan necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para comprar cerveza, gaseosa. 
El sueño de Juan es que su hijo sea un profesional, abrir  en otros distritos sucursales  de su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan is a member of the communal bank Maria de la Paz. He is 41 years old and lives with his common law wife. He has a 13 year old son who studies in public school. Juan is studying business administration and decided to open a business but the businesses he started did not go well for him as he was defrauded and assaulted. However, he managed to succeed with the support of his family and with a settlement he received from the company he worked for. He started another business five years ago selling liquor. The name of his store is "Yemba - Yemba." Juan has had several businesses and the most profitable one has been the sale of beer and soft drinks. Since he has been in FINCA, Juan has been able to maintain a stock of merchandise. In the communal bank he has learned of the unity between members. Juan needs a loan in the amount of 2000 soles to purchase beer and soft drinks. Juan's dream is for his son to become a professional and to open chains of his business in other districts.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer and soft drinks for his store.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina I., 43, is married with three children. She has one year of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the public three days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $145.  SPBD loans are Sina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil and cooking utensils for her pancake business.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, cooking oil and cooking utensils

loans.name: Margarita Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Margarita Francisca G. L. tiene 36 años, vive en el caserío de San Luis, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio solo primaria completa debido a que su padre no la quiso apoyar para seguir estudiando y se quedo en casa ayudando a su madre a cuidar a sus hermanos, tiene 05 hijos de los cuales 03 dependen de ella económicamente. 
Margarita se dedica a la compra- venta de animales hace ya 14 años, al comienzo vendía verduras, negocio que abandono ya que no le dejaba muchas ganancias, ahora  se dedica a la compra-venta de reces, cerdos y huachos, así también en tiempos de cosecha a la compra-venta de cereales y papa, su negocio se desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, lo invirtió en la compra de verduras para la venta.
Con el crédito de 2500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de un toro. 
Margarita sueña con comprarse un taxi.
Ella pertenece al vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Señora Margarita Francisca G. L. is 36 and lives in the town of San Luis, in the district of Salpo, in the province of Otuzco, in the state of La Libertad, Peru. She only studied through elementary school because her father didn't want to support her education any futher. She stayed at home helping her mother take care of her brothers and sisters. She has five children, three of whom depend on her economically. Margarita has bought and sold animals for 14 years. She started off by selling vegetables, but she abandoned this business because she didn't earn a lot of profits. Now she buys and sells cows, pigs, and guinea pigs. At harvest time she also buys and sells cereal and potatoes. She has her business at her home. With her first credit of 300 soles, which she received from the communal bank "Mujeres Trabajadoras" (Hard-Working Women), she invested in the purchase of vegetables to sell. With this credit of 2,500 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of a bull. Margarita dreams about buying a taxi. She belongs to the "vaso de leche" program (glass of milk- a nutritional program in Peru) in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo R. is 53 years old and lives in Rizal, Quirino, Isabela.  He has two children: Aldritz and Bernadette.  Aldritz is 24 years old, unable to finish his primary education because of difficulty in speaking and he now helps him in their farm; Benadette, 22 years old, finished a one-year course in criminology, but is still unemployed.  

Arturo works as a tricycle driver in their village.  He gives at least PHP 200.00 per day to the tricycle owner as his boundary and the rest of his income is for his family.  Aside from working as a lease tricycle driver, Arturo is also busy on his farm where he plants and sells vegetables for extra income.  With this, he wants to borrow a loan of PHP 8,000.00 that he will use in cultivating his vegetables.  He is hoping that through his business, he can provide a better life for his family and hopefully he can have his own motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: Business capital to cultivate his vegetables

loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Kunthy P., 34, and her husband, Mr. Samorn Seng, 35, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1996 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Three of the children attend school.
 
Kunthy has been selling fish since 1996. Her husband assists his wife in the fish-selling business. He is also a silk weaver. They hope to support their children's further education. Kunthy is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike to carry fish that she has for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Sut's Group

texts.en:
There are two people requesting this small loan, all residents of the City of Phnom Penh. The leader, Mrs. Sut S., is a 42-year-old, married woman and is the mother of three children, all of whom are single and live in the family home. Sut S. and her husband own a grocery store out of their home where they sell grocery items to the neighbors who live near their house in the village. They can earn approximately $5 a day to buy foods for their family's eating.

Recently, the family has sold all their inventory from the store and due to the lack of money to continue running the business, Sut S. has decided to seek a loan to purchase additional grocery inventory to sell. The other borrower who has joined the loan, Mrs. Ouch S., is a good homemaker who is applying for a loan in order to buy a motorcycle for her husband to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Doh Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is married to two wives and has seven children. His greatest wish is to see his children become responsible citizens in the future, so he toils relentlessly to make this wish a reality. He joined GHAPE in 2007 and received his first loan of 40,000FCFA ($40) which he invested in pig farming. Realizing that pig farming is a lucrative business, there is need for expansion.

If given this new loan, Patrick plans to expand his pig farm by buying four piglets, pig feed and materials to repair the pig house. The profit he gets from the loan will be used to educate his children and repair his house.  

About GHAPE
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.

loans.use: Four Piglets and Materials for Pig Sty Repairs

loans.name: Ericka Damaris

texts.es:
la sra. Ericka Damaris H. se dedica a la sastreria y tambien vende recargas para llamadas de celulares de dos compañias telefonicas, ella tiene mas de 4 años de realizar este tipo de actividad, es madre de familia, tiene 3 hijos, con los ingresos que le genera este negocio le permite suplir con algunos gastos del hogar y tambien le ayuda a su esposo con varios gastos del hogar.
ella tiene pensado con las ganancias que obtenga poder hacerle mejoras a su casa de habitacion, este es uno de sus mas preciados sueños el poder terminar de construir su casa como ella desea.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ericka Damaris H. is a tailor and she also sells top ups for mobile phones from two telephone companies. She has been doing this for more than 4 years. She is a mother of 3 and with the income from this business she helps out with some family expenses and she also supports her husband with several expenses for the home.

With the earnings she will be able to make improvements to her house as it is her most precious dream to build her house according to her wish.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material, thread, moldings and top ups for mobile phones.

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en:
Khamis M. is 28 years old and married to a builder. She has three children who are currently in school. Khamis has a business selling clothes and shoes and is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase sewing machines.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy K. sells bread, oranges, mineral water, etc., at Atabadi near Elmina. Mercy has a senior high school education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Mercy has been selling bread, oranges and mineral water since 1990. She is responsible for paying her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more bread, oranges and mineral water to increase sales and expand the business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy bread, oranges and mineral water to increase sales and expand the business

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is a member of the Mlandege borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 33 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1child.Her child is aged 13 years.
 
Suzana started her own pharmacy business selling medicine 7 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is suzana first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more medicine.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Suzana hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more medicine

loans.name: Abdusalim

texts.en:
Abdusalim  G. is 21 years old. He is married but has no children yet. He arduously dedicates himself to the livestock business. When Abdusalim recognized the need to invest in his work, he decided to construct a place to keep his animals and for this he requires certain construction materials. He has sought the help of IMON believing that his loan request will be granted and with this he will be able to move forward in his work. With the loan Abdusalim will purchase young cattle and construction materials for improving his cattle-shed.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle and construction materials for improving his cattle-shed

loans.name: Maebell

texts.en:
Maebel E., 23 years old is a young farmer in Veruela Agusan Del Sur. She said, when she got pregnat of her eldest child, her husband started tilling rice field to be able produce income to buy food, clothing and other needs.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use he loan to fund her farm and obtrain abundant harvest for her family.

She said that she likes the CEVI services because it has a avery low interest rate which is 2% a month.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said A. is 30 years old and a married father of two children. His wife, Susan Okora, is 26 years old and is a business lady. Said operates a store in Shanzu, Mombasa, where he sells clothes and shoes. His business is eight years old and is a success.

Said is accessing his first loan from KADET and he plans to use it to purchase more shoes and clothes for his store. Currently, Said's major customers are residents of the beach town of Shanzu. Said hopes to expand his business by opening a chain of stores in the future and to diversify his source of income by venturing into the car-rental market.  

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase his stock in clothes and shoes

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 34 years old, and she is married to Dennis F. who is a lawyer. They have been blessed with a loving son, John Mark, three years old. Her family is happily living in their village. Eden is managing a general merchandise store at the public market of Magsaysay Saguday Quirino. She is thankful because her business is improving but still she would like to expand and offer more of the merchandise she sells. She manage it for the future welfare of their only son.

Eden would like to buy additional merchandise but her capital is not enough and that’s the reason why she would like to take out a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 she would be thankful if her request for a loan is granted.

Eden said that through her “sacrifices and perseverance” she is able to improve her business.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Akoma Group

texts.en:
Ama is 35 years old, married and the mother of four children. Three are currently in school and her last-born is still breastfeeding. She is a food vendor and serves food like waakye. Waakye is prepared from local rice grains and mixed with beans. Many Ghanaians enjoy it as it has local taste and standard. She says demand for food is on the higher side but she does not have adequate funds for expansion. She has been in food production for two years now, which helps in taking care of the family. She wants to use the loan to buy meat, rice and vegetables to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her children's educational needs. She would be grateful for the assistance. 

She is the leader of a trust bank group called "Akoma," which means heart. She is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph. The members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, beans, meat, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Lilian Awour

texts.en:
Lilian makes and sells dresses. She also stocks and sells materials for making clothes. She started her buiness a year ago and the business is doing well.  She has one employee; her main problem is the rainy season, during which sales are unpredictable.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a sewing machine and more materials for making clothes. She wants to capitalise on the festive season, during which demand for dresses is at its peak. She intends to open a new shop and would like to have a brighter future for her family. Lilian is married with one son and describes herself as a hardworking, optimistic, responsible and caring mother.

loans.use: purchasing a sewing machine and materials for making clothes

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley A. is from the village of Casusan. She is 46 years old. Shirley is married and has 3 school-aged children.  Shirley owns & operates a flower business, selling orchids & other flowers to the local community. Shirley has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2004, Shirley joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirley is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be her 12th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel D. has been in the variety store business for six years. Married to Oscar D., they have six children. Four of them are already working, one is studying in college and one is in elementary school. Her husband works as a cook in a restaurant. She and her family are living in Caloocan City, Metro Manila.

Being a member of Center for Community Transformation* for the past two years, Isabel has already received six loans, with her latest loan amount being PHP 12,000, because of her good attendance at weekly fellowship meetings and her regular payment of dues. She wants to further expand her business this Christmas season by applying for a PHP 14,000 loan and using it as added capital to buy more stock like soft drinks, instant noodles, assorted snacks and other products for her variety store business.

She hopes that both her own and her husband’s hard work will someday pay off with a stable source of income from their expanding business, benefiting not only them but also their children as they each start families of their own.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her variety store business

loans.name: 01-Dong Hai Group

texts.en: Yen T. P. is a 64-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Yen is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 01-Dong Hai. Yen is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Yen operates a family member's service-based business venture. The main source of income for the business comes from providing photography services to local community members. Yen has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 Vietnamese Dong a month from these activities. In 2007, Yen joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Yen from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Yen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. T. T. Cat is a 62-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her general store. 2. N. T. Hop is a 28-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food. 3. L. T. Ha is a 27-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her clothing business. 4. L. T. Giao is a 60-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her service-based business. 5. T. T. Tam is a 47-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food. 6. D. T. Thanh is a 27-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her general store. 7. H. T. Tam is a 38-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food. 8. L. T. Huong is a 33-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business of raising livestock. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Yen T. P. (41) là 64 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Yen là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 01-Dong Hai (16-16-01). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ chụp hình cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Yen thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Yen kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2007, Yen đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Yen đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. T. T. Cat (21) là 62 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 2. N. T. Hop (13) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 3. L. T. Ha (35) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. 4. L. T. Giao (1) là 60 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 5. T. T. Tam (14) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 6. D. T. Thanh (6) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 7. H. T. Tam (26) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 8. L. T. Huong (46) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia S. is currently in the business of baking cakes to sell and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour, milk, sugar etc for baking more cakes.  Lucia is 33 years old and widowed. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bakery.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more ingredients

loans.name: France

texts.es:
La señora Fance es socia del Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió superior completo, se dedica a la compra y venta de cosméticos. Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de golosinas.

France nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar labiales, cremas, perfumes, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es dar una buena calidad de servicio a sus clientes. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los temas educativos y la unión entre compañeras
texts.en:
Señora Fance has been a member of the Communal Bank "Cristo Blanco" for three years. She lives in the district of Juliaca, province of San Román, and the department of Puno. She is 33 years old, a single mother of one child. She is studying, and she works buying and selling cosmetics. She also works selling sweets. Fance tells us that the first loan she asked for from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for 300 Soles, which helped her augment her capital. She is going to ask for a loan for 700 soles, with which she will be able to buy lipsticks, creams, perfume, etc. Her dream for the future is to be able to give good quality of service to her clients. What she likes best about her communal bank is its education themes and the union between its partners.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lipstick, cream, perfume, etc

loans.name: Runyerere Bakyara Tukwatanise Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
K. Grace, whose photo appears at the top left, is the leader of the lending group (she also appears in the group photo). She is 30 years old and a very hard working married lady with 5 children between 3 and 15 years of age.  All the children are in school.

She has a business selling old clothing from Runyerere trading centre from which she is able to make 17,500 Ugandan Shillings as profit every week. She says that her biggest expense is her children’s school fees.  She hopes to expand her business further by having a bigger stock of clothing so that she could save more. She knows how to handle her customers well and she needs a loan to be able to buy more used clothing for resale so that her business expands.

loans.use: Buying more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a 34-year-old hardworking man who has been running a retail shop for three years, assisted by one employee.  His wife is a tailor and they are blessed with two children. Simon saves his money weekly with Faulu Kenya, and he now hopes to take a loan of Kes.10,000 in order to add a stock of handkerchiefs, belts and slippers to his store.  He sees himself having a well-stocked shop in a few years' time, and also aspires to owning a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: To add stocks of handerchiefs, slippers and keyholders to his store

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Silvia Elena M. A. es comerciante del Mercado Central desde hace cuatro años tiene un puesto de venta de ropa.
