Es casada tiene tres hijos dos de ellos en edad escolar cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, su negocio lo inicio con un capital de C$ 3,000.00 aporte de su esposo  con poco inventario ahora su negocio esta surtido antes ella era ama de casa pero con la situación en la que hemos venido atravesando decidio poner su propio negocio y depender de ella  no solo de su esposo ya que son tres niños los que hay que mantener.
La Señora M. A. tiene 1 año de trabajar con ceprodel en los cuales los financiamientos obtenidos por nosotros le han servido de mucho ya que su inventario ha incrementado ha podido sacar adelante a sus niños se esfuerza por ellos y para ellos trabaja diario si no habre el negocio busca como colocar la mercadería en otros tramos dejándola al crédito y cobrando diario.
texts.en:
Silvia Elena M. A. has been a merchant in the central market for four years. She has a stall where she sells clothes. She is married, and she has three children. Two of the children are school age. She has her husband’s support. She started her business with C$3,000.00 from her husband, and she had little inventory. Now her business is stocked. Previously she was a housewife. But, due to the situation they have been going through, she decided to set up her own business. That way they can depend upon her, not just her husband. There are three children to support. Mrs. M. A. has been working with Ceprodel for one year. During that time the loans from us have helped her a lot. She has increased her inventory, and she has been able to get her children ahead. Her efforts are for them. She works for them everyday. If the business does not open, she looks to place her merchandise in other retails spaces. She leaves it on credit, and collects daily.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel B. is from the village of San isidro Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns and operates a business venture running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of her business' income comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month through these activities.

In 2008, Raquel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Raquel has now requested a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Raquel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this loan to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Adilia

texts.es:
Doña Maria Adilia es una mujer emprendedora de 50 años de edad, desde joven aprendió costura en donde ha logrado una experiencia y ha sido una fuente de entrada para apoyar a sus siete hijos que junto con su esposo han trabajado mucho. Su esposo trabaja de albañil un trabajo agotador pero le pagan bien. Hoy en día solo tiene a cargo dos hijos que están cursando estudios, los otros viven independientes. Un tiempo trabajo en cocina ya que solo la costura no le daba, pero el restaurante cerró y siguió con  la costura es un trabajo en donde le permite hacer sus oficios de la casa y ver por su familia.
Con este préstamo comprara tela variada,  botones, bordados, ziper para hacer los vestidos y encargos. Entre sus planes es comprar una maquina eléctrica en donde pueda trabajar con mas rapidez, mejor calidad. Asi como lograr hacer mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Adilia is an enterprising woman who is 50 years old. She learned to sew as a young woman. As she gained experience, Maria’s skill became a source of income with which she could support her seven children. She and her husband have worked very hard. His work as a mason is exhausting, but it pays well. Today, only two of her children live with her since they are currently in school. The others live independently. At one time she worked at a restaurant kitchen when her sewing business did not generate enough income, but the establishment closed down, so she resumed sewing while attending to her household chores and caring for her family.

With this loan, Maria will buy various fabrics, buttons, fringe, and zippers for making dresses to complete her orders. Her plans include buying an electric sewing machine so that she can work faster and produce better quality. She also wants to make improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, buttons, zippers, and other materials for making dresses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth O. is from the town of Talibon. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Bernadeth owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Bernadeth has been engaged in her business for over 8 years now.

In 2008, Bernadeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bernadeth has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Bernadeth is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Bernadeth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her family's living conditions. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Luzvisminda

texts.en:
Luzvisminda R. is a married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures :a General Store and Frozen foods sales. She lives in Gomez Street, La Castellana, Negros Occidental  with her husband and their 4 children who are 28, 30, 32 and 33 years of age.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her General store and Frozen foods businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php6,000.

Luzvisminda is now borrowing Php15,000 so that she can expand her businesses. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Luzviminda aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Hot

texts.en:
Mrs. Hot Y. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living as well as raises a few pigs, and typically generates an income of $2 per day. Her husband operates a taxi service and fishes as well.

This couple has been married for years and has four children. One of the children is married and three are teenagers going to school or work.

Hot Y. finds it hard traveling anywhere because she doesn’t have her own vehicle. She has dreamed of having a vehicle for a long time but she doesn’t have the money to buy one. So, she has decided to seek a Kiva loan to be used to buy an old motorbike to provide transportation for her family. She will also use this motorcycle to transport her mature crops to the market.

loans.use: To buy an old motorbike for family transportation and to take her crops to the market

loans.name: Mrs. Srean Phin Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Tuol Sang Ka village, Takeo province consists of eighteen people who are made up a village bank loan. Mrs. Srean P. is a village bank president who was born in 1981, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for varied goals. She is a farmer who owns one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family living. Now she has a problem because her field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Srean P. is asK. for a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Phroeurn Souy, is a horse cart diver. She is a mother of a child who is six years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kerlys Karina

texts.es:
Kerlys de 26 años, tiene un taller de costura/confección y vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas).  

Comenzó a trabajar en un colegio pero como quería independizarse y pasar mas tiempo con sus dos hijos decidió ubicar en su casa un taller de costura y confección, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su taller. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder continuar con su trabajo necesita comprar hilos, telas y herramientas para su taller de costura, en el futuro quiere tener su propia marca de ropa y distribuir ropa al por mayor a almacenes.
texts.en:
Kerlys, 26 years old, has a sewing shop and lives in Orquideas de Guayaquil (urban area named "orchids" because there were many such flowers there at the time of its discovery). She started working in a school but wanted to work independently and spend more time with her two children. She decided to build a sewing shop in her house, little by little she was able to. She now works from 8am to 4pm every day. In order to continue working she needs to buy thread, fabric and tools for her shop. In the future she want to have her own clothing brand and distribute clothing wholesale to stores.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric, thread

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: El señor Rolando José es divorciado y actualmente tiene una hija menor de edad. El señor se dedica a la carpintería, como la elaboración de artículos de madera  entre lo que sobresalen sillas, roperos, cómodas. El señor inicio con este negocio desde hace 10 años, esto con el propósito de tener su propio negocio, y así poder obtener ganancias para brindar la manutención a su hija, este local está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Sus clientes generalmente llegan al taller a solicitarle la elaboración de los artículos. El señor está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de invertir en la compra de inventario, ya que actualmente posee bastantes pedidos. Por supuesto, el problema que enfrenta su negocio es que a veces no tiene dinero para invertir en el mismo,  por lo que este préstamo le ayudara a comprar más material. Su meta por el momento es ampliar más el negocio hacia otros mercados del país y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rolando José is divorced and has a minor daughter. He is a carpenter. He makes wood items among which chairs, wardrobes and bureaus are the outstanding ones. He started his business 10 years ago wanting to have his own business to earn income for his daughter’s support. The shop is located in his home. His customers usually come by the shop to ask him to make some article or other. He is asking for funds to buy new stock inventory because he currently has quite a few standing orders. Of course, the problem he faces is that he sometimes doesn’t have money available to buy supplies so the loan will help him with this. His goal for the moment is to expand his business towards other markets in the country thus obtaining greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carpentry stock and supplies.

loans.name: Karla Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Karla se encuentra conformado por Karla de los Angeles S. V., Martha Alejandra V. C. y Magaly Rosana B. V., tres féminas con distintas actividades económicas y con la meta de llevar el sustento a sus respectivos hogares. Karla, quien es la coordinadora del grupo, tiene un salón de belleza en su casa de habitación, además atiende a domicilio dentro de la comunidad, ella utilizará el dinero para hacer mejoras a su negocio. Magaly tiene una panadería en su hogar y en cambio Martha se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería, en especial la venta de granos básicos y productos derivados de la res.
texts.en:
The Karla communal bank’s members are: Karla de los Ángeles S. Vásquez, Martha Alejandra Vásquez C. and Magaly Rosana B. Vásquez, three women with different economic activities but the common goal to provide sustenance to their homes. Karla, who is the group Coordinator, has a beauty salon installed in her home; she also provides in home services in her community. She will use the funds to make improvements to her salon. Magaly has a bakery in her house and Martha is a farmer and raises cattle, especially she sells basic grains and products derived from beef.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to her beauty salon.

loans.name: Fioklou Alex

texts.fr: en 2000, ce monsieur a ouvert son propre bar qu'il a appelé " BAR ASTORIA", son bar se situe à proximité de sa maison. les weekend, le bar est très animé ce qui lui permet de réaliser de bons chiffre d'affaire. il doit s'approvisionner pour satisfaire ses clients, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 24 bouteilles de flag, 17 bouteilles de guiness, 24 bouteilles de castel, 20 bouteilles de sucrerie.
texts.en:
In 2000, this gentleman opened his own bar that he called "BAR ASTORIA". It is located near his house. On weekends, the bar is very busy, and this enables him to have good sales. He must stock up again on supplies in order to satisfy his customers. He is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying 24 bottles of Flag, 17 bottles of Guinness, 24 bottles of Castel, and 20 bottles of soft-drinks.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beverages

loans.name: Domitila Filadelfia

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

La señora Domitila tiene 64 años y esta casada hace muchos años,  de esta relación tuvo 5 hijos aunque uno de ellos falleció, nos cuenta con tristeza que el dolor más grande que tuvo fue perder a su hijo. Su esposo es agricultor.

Es un ama de casa que se da tiempo para dedicarse a la compra y venta de leche, además tiene una pequeña granja de pollos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am que recibe la leche cerca de su casa, mas tarde  se dedica  junto con su esposo a entregarla por todo el sector, en cuanto a los pollos los tiene por espacio de dos meses luego los pela y los entrega en tiendas o los vende por libras a personas de la localidad.

Ella es fundadora del banco comunal y le gusta porque las cuotas son fáciles de cumplir siempre y cuando se trabaje con responsabilidad. Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pollos para la cría y para pagar la leche que es un pago semanal.
 
Su sueño es tener una granja grande de pollos para vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Ilusion” (New Illusion) communal bank meets every two weeks in Cadí, Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo, a place renowned for its hard working people who are farmers and cattlemen.

Domitila, 64, has been married for many years.  She had five children but one died.  She tells us with much sadness that losing her child was the greatest pain she’s ever experienced.  Her husband’s a farmer.

She is a housewife but uses some of her time to be a milk merchant.  She also has a small chicken farm.  She works daily from 6am to receive the milk that’s delivered to her house.  Later she and her husband distribute it throughout the sector.  As for the chickens, she keeps them for a period of time of two months and then she plucks them and sells them to local stores or by the pound to local residents.

She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the installments are easy to pay as long as one works with responsibility. 

She will use this loan to buy chickens to raise and to pay for the milk which is a weekly expense.

Her dream is to have a large chicken farm in order to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To pay for the milk and to buy chickens.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida V. is from the village of Maribucao, Gingoog City. She is 32 years old. Loida is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and snack foods in the local community. She is also engaging in buying and selling coconuts. Loida has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Loida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and as working capital. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell and as working capital

loans.name: Hazel Jean

texts.en:
Hazel Jean A. is from the village of Puerta, Lurugan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Hazel Jean is married. To make a living, Hazel Jean owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods, canned goods & instant noodles in the local community. Hazel Jean has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Hazel Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hazel Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products for sale. Hazel Jean is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Hazel Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine to expand the business.

loans.name: Elma's Group

texts.en:
Elma A. lives in the city of Talic, Oroquieta City. She is 57 years old and leads a two-member group loan made up of members of GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this group is Tanglad.

Elma is married, has two school-aged children and earns a living by making and selling food. She has been in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from her work.

In 2010, Elma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan, her first, for 5,000 PHP to buy ingredients to make products to make more food items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to continue expanding it. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to make food items to sell

loans.name: Benedeta  Mutindi

texts.en:
For the last five years Benedeta has been selling cereals in Ndunyu Njeru town.She is 47 years old and is married to Justus Nganga. 

She was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. This will be her third loan and she has no history with any other MFI. She paid her previous loan of Kshs. 20,000 in full and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to boost her stock and also buy fertilizers, seedlings and cater for farm labour that she operates besides her cereal shop.

In the future, Benedeta hopes to open a whole store for cereals.

loans.use: To boost her stock and also buy fertilizers, seedlings and cater for farm labour that she operates besides her cereal shop.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes H. lives in Gyumri City, one of the oldest and most beautiful cities of Armenia that was affected by a devastating and destructive earthquake in 1987. The people of Gyumri have been largely affected by the earthquake and most are still struggling to survive.

Hovhannes has extensive experience in trading in unmounted construction materials. He buys the small, old, dilapidated huts that were given to earthquake survivors as temporary housing after the earthquake. His customers are happy to sell those huts to him, following their move to a new apartment. 

Hovhannes has applied for the loan to be able to increase his working capital.

loans.use: increasing his working capital

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma is married to M. S. and operates a sewing business to share the financial burden with her husband. She started this business three years ago because her husband was not able to meet the basic needs of the family alone. Her husband is a private entrepreneur who sells fruit from his four-wheeled cart, visiting different areas of the community. Najma helps him by arranging the fruit on his cart early in the morning. She has given birth to two daughters and a son. Her daughters are studying while her son is 10 years old and stays at home. Najma lives in a small residential area of Multan known as Kher abad. Multan is a big city in Pakistan known for its shrines and hot weather. She has lived there in a two-room brick house for the past 15 years.

Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new sewing machine which will help her finish orders on time and produce quality work. She is very hopeful that the investment will bring good results for her business and improve her profits. This is her first loan application to Asasah and she hopes it will result in a long-term relationship.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mpara Church Leaders Group

texts.en: Violet is a member of Mpara Church leaders group where each member guarantees the other to access credit. She lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda and her family dream is to build a permanent house. For three years she has been in the retail  trade and with the profits she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Violet intends to use the loan to buy cooking oil, salt, and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: Purchasing cooking oil, salt, and cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Lucia Wilma

texts.es: La señora Lucia, es cliente antigua de la institución, ella se dedica a la venta de leche natural, ya que tiene dos vacas que le proporcionan ese producto, ella reparte por la zona a los vecinos quienes le compran leche fresca, es una cliente joven tiene una hija pequeña, el esposo trabaja de chofer en radiotaxi, juntos colaboran con los gastos del hogar, con el dinero del credito compraran forraje para la alimentacion de sus vacas, también se dedica por las noches a estudiar, ya que desea superarse, y es uno de sus deseos poder terminar sus estudios, es muy trabajadora y responsable, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Lucia is a long-time client of the organization. She works selling natural milk from the two cows she owns. She travels around the area selling her fresh milk to her neighbors. She is a young woman with a small child. Her husband works as a taxi driver, and together they cover their household expenses. She will use the loan money to buy feed for her cows. In the evenings she is continuing her education because she wants to improve her life. Completing her education is one of her dreams. She is very hard-working and responsible, and she is thankful for the support this organization has offered her.

loans.use: Purchase of feed for dairy cows

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOQ ALLPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Gabriela; La socia tiene 50 años de edad, la socia  es casada,  tiene 3 hijos,  la socia trabaja en la universidad, ella trabaja en la parte administrativa, la socia es miembro del banco comunal desde los inicios y ella en esta oportunidad desea el crédito para invertir en su vivienda. La socia desea mejorar su vivienda, ella comprara algunos muebles para la casa.  La socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la vivienda y poder mejorarla poco a apoco.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Maria Gabriela belongs to the "Mosoq Allpa" community bank in the district of Huanchac, province of Cusco, Peru. She is 50 years old, married and has three children. She works in the administrative department at a university. Maria Gabriela has been a member of the community bank since its inception and at this time she is requesting the loan to invest in her home. She wants to make improvements to her home by purchasing some furniture items. Maria Gabriela wants to invest in her home so she can be able to make improvements to it little by little. She feels happy that the loan has been approved and promises to make her payments in the established period.

loans.use: Purchase furniture for her home

loans.name: Cholpon's Group

texts.ru:
Успех животноводства в Кыргызстане имеет несколько причин: наличие в стране естественных высокогорных пастбищ, отсутствие других сфер занятости в высокогорных районах и историческая традиция народа. 

Чолпон Суеркулова, 41, лидер этой группы. Недавно наша клиентка развелась и осталась с тремя дочерьми на воспитание. Проработав много лет в сфере медицины и посвятив все это время работе в больнице, Чолпон была вынуждена покинуть место работы так как новорожденный ребенок нуждался в постоянном уходе. Потратив отпускные и зарплату в 10 000 сомов на покупку трех голов мелкорогатого скота, Чолпон принялась осваивать новую профессию, разведение мелкорогатого скота. Имея всего лишь год опыта за плечами Чолпон неплохо освоилась в новом деле и имеет стабильную месячную прибыль в 5 000 сомов. Чолпон объясняет это устойчивым, даже постоянно растущим спросом на животноводческую продукцию в регионе и в целом мире. На данный момент
 Чолпон хочет построить наилучшие условия для своих дочерей. Цель кредита заключается в покупке мебели для дома. В этом году старшая дочь готовится к университетской жизни, и Чолпон надеется обеспечить ей достойное образование.

        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
texts.en:
The success of animal husbandry in Kyrgyzstan stems from several sources:  the presence in the country of natural high-mountain pastures, the absence of other types of employment in mountainous areas, and the people’s history and tradition.

Cholpon S., 41, is the leader of this group. Recently, our client divorced and was left with three daughters to raise.  She has worked for many years in field of medicine and devoted all this time to working in a hospital.  Cholpon had to leave her work since her newborn baby requires constant care.  She spent her savings and salary (10,000 som) to buy three head of livestock.  Cholpon has begun to master a new trade: raising livestock.  After only one year of experience, Cholpon has not had trouble becoming accustomed to her new business.  She has a stable monthly income of 5,000 som. Cholpon explains that there is a steadily-growing demand for livestock production in that region and in the whole world. Cholpon wants to provide the best possible conditions for her daughters.  She is taking out a loan to purchase furniture for their house. This year, her oldest daughter is preparing to enter the university, and Cholpon hopes to provide her a solid foundation.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Badenya sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 35 ans et 5 enfants par femme. Elles habitent le village de Zambougou, dans la commune rurale de Sanando, région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de parenté. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de poissons séchés, de tomates fraîches, d’habits, de la friperie et de la bouillie. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont adhéré à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Sagnini  Traoré a une grande réputation dans le village de Zambougou pour sa vente de bouillie et elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 4 sacs de grains de mil en gros dans la foire de Konodimini. 
Pour faire de la bouillie, on décortique les grains,  les débarrasse du son, les laves, les broie au moulin pour avoir de la semoule qui est ensuite préparée au feu pour obtenir de la bouillie. A la différence des autres vendeuses de bouillie, elle l’agrémente avec du lait caillé et du sucre.  
La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et en ambulant dans le village à une clientèle composée de femmes, d’hommes et d’enfants. 
Madame Sagnini  Traoré espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. Madame Sagnini  Traoré a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Badenya group are mostly married and live in monogamous families. They are 35 years old on average and have five children each.  They live in the village of Zambougou, in the rural municipality of Sanando, in the Ségou region (fourth largest administrative region of Mali) and met through family and friends. The group's members sell dried fish, fresh tomatoes, garments, second hand clothes, and gruel. The women joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance association with the aim of boosting their business capital, and are now on their third loan. Madam Sagnini Traoré has built a reputation in the Zambougou village for selling gruel, and aims to use her loan to purchase four bags of millet wholesale at the Konodimini market. 
To make gruel, she must first husk the seeds, wash them, crush them with a mill until they form semolina which she then heats to make gruel. She differentiates herself from other gruel vendors by adding curdled milk and sugar. She takes cash and credit sales from home or via door-to-door sales around the village. Her customer base is made up of men, women and children. Madam Sagnini Traoré aims to use the loan to generate an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA which will be used to reinvest in the business and to see to her family's needs. She would like to boost the scale of her business through her work with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: To purchase millet

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora es soltera, tiene 56 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, en el Barrio Villa Paso, tiene casa propia, donde posee las condiciones básicas para desarrollar sus actividades dentro del seno familiar y movilidad propia (moto).
Ella se dedica a la venta de mercaderías de primera necesidad como gaseosas y víveres. Desarrolla esta actividad desde hace como 4 años, posee la infraestructura necesaria para el correcto desarrollo por lo que su local es muy reconocido y visitado por los vecinos ya, además es una señora muy amable.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de víveres y agradece  la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo.
texts.en:
The lady is single and 56 years old.  She lives in the city of Pilar’s Villa Paso neighborhood.  She owns her house which has the basic conditions necessary for her to carry out activities within the family nucleus; she also has her own vehicle (motorcycle).

She sells groceries and soft drinks.  She’s been in this line of work for about 4 years.  She has the required infrastructure for correct development so her store is very well known and patronized by her neighbors; besides, she’s a very kind woman.

She is asking for the loan to buy groceries and thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the support.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita A. is in the business of selling green vegetables. She is 20 years old, married and has two children, one of whom goes to school. 

Rita borrowed a loan to stock more green vegetables to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto, 39 years old, is married to a housewife and blessed with four children. They harmoniously reside at Disimuray Cauayan City, Isabela, Philippines. He has been growing corn for almost 20 years. He earns PHP 23,000 at the last cropping. He is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase farm inputs. He is determined to work hard to supplement his family's daily needs. He hopes that Kiva will continue to give him financial assistance to improve their status in life.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 30 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are in school. To make a living, she does mixed farming. She has been in this line of work for more than eight years and earns about 15,000 Kenya shillings a month. She has been a good client of KADET and is applying for her second loan, which she will use to buy farm supplies. This will allow her to grow a variety of crops and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Rayo De Luz 4 Group

texts.en:
Cristina is the coordinator of her group, Rayo D. Luz 4 (Ray of Light), located in the rural area surrounding La Romana. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children and their father. Cristina and the other members are dedicated to operating businesses, like selling clothes, shoes, food and so on. She operates a variety store, where she sells different products at her house from a small stand she maD.. 

Cristina is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing cosmetics, beauty products, shoes, accessories, jewelry, clothes and other products. She enjoys being at home with her family and attending Church.

She started her business almost one year ago with her first loan from Esperanza. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, beauty products, shoes, accessories, jewelry, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina de 25 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su menor hijo de 6 años de edad en una casa alquilada ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Dina  nunca olvidará aquellas tardes de su juventud, en las que observaba a sus abuelos a remover la tierra y a la vez poner las  semillas de cacao. Es por ello que de ahí en adelante apostó por la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao, para así sacarle el jugo al legado de sus abuelos. Esto lo realizaba en su parcela, introduciendo nuevas técnicas de cultivo, y con el apoyo de su familia, además contaba con peones que contrataba para la temporada de cosecha. Actualmente el cacao tiene mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional, es por ello que se siente satisfecha por las ganancias que recibe al vender su producto en Centros de Acopio de su localidad. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.000 mil nuevos soles ella contratará peones para que le ayuden a limpiar su parcela de cacao.
texts.en:
25 year-old Dina is a single mother who lives with her 6 year-old son, in a rental house, in Pichari district.  Dina will never forget the afternoons of her youth when she watched her grandparents turn over the soil and plant cacao seeds.  This is why she chose to work in farming, specifically growing cacao, in order to make the most of her grandparents' legacy.  She does this work on her own plot of land, introducing new growing techniques and with the support of her family.  She also hires laborers during the harvest season.

Cacao is currently in great demand both at a national and international level.  For this reason, Dina feels satisfied with the profits that she makes when she sells her product to the middlemen in her town.  This will be her second loan from MFP and she pledges to be punctual in making her repayments.

Dina will use these 2,000 Peruvian soles to hire laborers to help her weed her cacao plantings.

loans.use: to hire laborers to weed her cacao plantings

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mrs. Phy 22-year-old married woman who has been fishing for most of her life. She and her husband have many kinds of fishing tools. 

This couple wakes up every morning, drives their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fishes. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market and sell to their regular customers.

Mrs. Phy and her husband support their three children who are enrolled in school. This coming fishing season, the lakes will be full of fish, but the family is lacking tools to fish with. Hence, Mrs. Phy is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase additional fishing equipment: nets and a new boat. Mrs. Phy currently lives in the province of Siem Reap.

loans.use: to buy nets and a new boat.

loans.name: Sovanna

texts.en: Sovanna, 41 years old, is a fish paste seller. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Their income is $7 per day. She has five children. Three of the children are studying and two more are working as MPAs with $2 income per day. Every month she has to spend $90 on food, $7 on electricity, $20 on school fees, and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work. She wants to repair her house when she has enough money, and extend her career by making more fish paste to sell. For her children, she will help them to study and at least finish secondary school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 47 years old and married with two children ages 13 and 23. She has been practicing livestock farming for 13 years. She also runs a food stall to earn extra income. Nancy was previously tailoring to earn a living.

She joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that she could access business loans easily. Nancy has requested 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy rabbits and animal feed. She hopes to own a ranch in the future.

loans.use: to buy rabbits and animal feed

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang, age 62, is a food vendor. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. Together, their income is $5 per day. They have three grown children, ages 19, 20, and 23. All of them are working in a factory at a wage of $8 per day. 

Every month, Heang has to spend $118 on food, $10 on electricity, and $20 on other expenses. 

Heang would like to request a loan in the amount of $400 in order to buy a fishing boat for her husband that can be used during the rainy season. This will allow the family to earn an additional income.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat for her husband that can be used during the rainy season

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en:
To earn additional income, Angelito plants, harvests, and sells corn. He is 43 years old and has three school-aged children. He and his family live in a village where their primary income comes from planting and harvesting rice. Angelito strives to improve their standard of living and to continue sending their children to school. He wants his children to become professionals some day. Despite hardships and difficulties, they are working hard to earn an income in order to meet their basic necessities and to finance the education of their children.

Angelito hopes to increase his income by improving his yield in corn production. Due to lack of capital, he is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy corn seed, fertilizers, and pesticides, and to pay for labor required in corn production. He believes that the loan will help him to increase his yields. He hopes that, some day, he will become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizers, and pesticides, and to pay labor required in corn production

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 33 años, es un hombre sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su hijo Jharol de 03 años y lo que más desea es brindarle un mejor futuro y para ello esta dispuesto a trabajar muy duro. Gracias al apoyo de su madre, quien se encarga del cuidado de su hijo por las mañanas, trata de aprovechar al máximo en trabajar sus cultivos para luego ocuparse en las noches y brindarle todo el cariño a su querido hijo. Aún recuerda su infancia cuando sus padres le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, el se fue encargando de las tierras de ellos, ya que sus hermanos mayores decidieron dedicarse a otras actividades. Ahora tiene extensas tierras de cultivo, de las cuales cosecha cacao y raíces de barbasco, para luego venderlos en las ciudades de Santa Rosa y San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es su único fuente de ingreso y lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad. Mas adelante desea acopiar productos y poder traspasar a distintas empresas colectoras de cacao y café. Este será su segundo crédito y esta muy contento de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de todos ustedes, ya que así se sentirá seguro seguir progresando. Con el crédito solicitado comprara varios sacos de abono para fertilizar y mejorar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Edgar is a native of the city of Santa Rosa. He is 33 years old and a humble and hardworking gentleman. Edgar lives at the home of his parents with his three-year-old son Jharol for whom he wants to provide the best future. For this reason, he is willing to work very hard. Thanks to help from his mother, who takes care of his son in the mornings, Edgar is able to make the most out of his work in the fields. In the evenings, he is able to give his beloved son all the love and attention. Edgar still remembers his childhood when his parents taught him everything he needed to know about farming. As time passed, he was left in charge of their land on which he grows cacao and varieties of barbasco, which he eventually sells in the cities of Santa Rosa and San Francisco. What he enjoys most about his work is cultivating the land since this is his only source of income. Edgar has been farming for 15 years. Later on he wants to harvest his products and then transport them to different cacao and coffee collection companies.

This will be his second loan. Edgar is very pleased to know that he has everyone’s support once again. He already feels confident that he can continue progressing. The loan he requested will be used to buy several sacks of compost so that he can fertilize and improve his land.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of compost.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Madame Maimouna habite au Sénégal dans l’une de ses  communautés. Elle s’active depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce et la vente de charbon  de bois, et divers autres produits saisonniers comme la mangue, les cacahuètes  et le pain de singe. Elle a choisi son activité par opportunité.  Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2009. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de charbon de bois a revendre. Son objectif est d’accroitre  son activité de  commerce de charbon de bois pour mieux améliorer ses revenus.
texts.en:
Madame Maimouna lives in a community in Sénégal. She has been working selling charcoal for more than 10 years. She also sells various seasonal commodities such as mangoes, peanuts, and monkey bread (baobab fruit). She just happened upon this business opportunity. She has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC since November 2009. 

She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to use to buy more charcoal for resale. Her goal is to grow her charcoal sales business so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Silvia  Alicia

texts.es: La Sra. Silvia y su apreciable esposo tienen una tienda de abarrotes la  cual  abren  todos  los  día  desde  muy  temprana  hora , este  negocio  les  a  permitido  salir  adelante  día  con día,  el  proyecto  que  requieren  realizar  es la  compra  de mercancía  para  tener  disponible al instante los   productos  que   venden    ya  que se  preocupan por  brindarle  a sus  clientes  el excelente  servicio  que   los  a  caracterizado.
texts.en:
Señora Silvia and her respectable husband have a grocery store, which is open every day from an early hour. This business has allowed them to move ahead in life on a daily basis.

The project they want to work on is buying merchandise so that they have their products available right away, and they can focus on providing their customers with the excellent service that they are known for.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Patricia Julia

texts.es:
Patricia es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, está separada de su esposo y tiene tres  hijos a su cargo.  Cuenta con estudios superiores.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, su préstamo anterior fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de anticuchos (comida típica de la región).
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevo soles, comprará tres sacos de papa, y carne para la preparación de los anticuchos, la señora cuenta que los vende los días jueves, viernes y sábados  por las noches.  En el negocio le ayuda su hija.
La señora desea tener su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la responsabilidad y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the communal bank "Bellavista" which is located in the district of Puno, in the province and department of Puno. She is 31  years old, separated from her husband and has 3 children in her care. She has higher education. 

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the last year. Her last loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles (PEN), money she invested in her business which is selling anticuchos (a traditional food of the region) (a type of kebab).

With this new loan of S/. 800.00 nuevos soles (PEN) she will buy 3 sacks of potatoes and meat to make the anticuchos. The lady tells us that she sells them on Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays at night time. Her daughter helps her with the business. 

The lady wants to have a house and her children to grow up to be professionals.

What she likes about the communal bank is their responsibility and timeliness.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of potatoes and meat.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married lady. She has five children who depend on her. She has been in farming for a period of six years.

She knew about KADET LTD through other women registered in her area of residence. This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She paid the previous loan successfully and without complication. She wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizer, and to hire manpower to aid in the farm. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizer, and to hire manpower.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Nulu has been working hard to manage his small stationery store, which sells books, pens, pencils and wash basins. 

To help expand his business, Nulu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase new and different stationery items, and it will help Nulu to generate greater profits and pay for his children's school fees. Nulu hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big stationery shop. 

Nulu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nulu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase new and different stationery items.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvinida is 52 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. She is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol.  Bienvinida grows rice crops to sell. She also buys and sells vegetables.

Bienvinida has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Bienvinida hopes to have an abundant harvest. She hopes to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Eladio es un señor de 51 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

Tiene el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposa le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte y que los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Eladio es un micro crédito de ¢596,000(quinientos noventa y seis mil colones), para compra de terneros, para mejorar su negocio y asistencia posible a su proyecto.

Don Eladio es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Eladio, 51, lives with his wife and children in a community called Osa, located in Caña Blancal in the province of Puntarenas.  This community is notable for being an area that receives a lot of visitors, due to its beaches.  The main economic activities here are tourism and agriculture.

Eladio has the support and help of his wife, and this makes it easier for him to continue with his business ventures.   In addition, he says that this business is very interesting, since he has seen it gradually grow, and the demand for his products is ever increasing because the neighbors in his community have been satisfied with the service he has provided.

At this time, Eladio is requesting a loan of 596,000 colones to buy calves.  This will improve his business and help him with his business plans.

Eladio is a member of the Caña Blancal communal bank, one of the 150 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica.  With this loan, he hopes to grow at the personal and financial level.  In addition, he notes that thanks to this type of organization which facilitates credit, he can spend more time doing productive activities.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Simukai Tailors Association Group

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Mukai from Harare. She is married with three children, two attending school. She also cares for three dependents. Mukai runs a business tailoring clothes. The business has been in operation for the past two years. She says the main challenge faced is marketing as she does everything on her own, which means she needs someone to source a market for her. 

Mukai has requested a loan of $400 to buy materials for general tailoring. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the standard of living of her family. In the future Mukai plans to employ five people.

loans.use: to buy materials (fabrics, etc.)

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Liza has a shop that sells used clothing like shirts, blouses and sweaters. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of used clothing.

Liza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Liza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of used clothing.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 53-year-old, single mother of one child.  She has been in the farming business for the past ten years earning a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan of KES 15,000 with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Jane will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. 

Her hopes and dreams are to venture fully in into pig rearing which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Exauce De Dieu Group

texts.fr: EXAUCE DE DIEU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Sophie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans. Sophie est mariée à un certain Christian. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sophie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Sophie a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Sophie vend depuis sept ans des bijoux et des vêtements pour enfants de façon ambulante. Sophie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’élargir son activité, Sophie sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe EXAUCE DE DIEU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: EXAUCE DE DIEU is a group of three people, friends who live in the same region of Bénin. The group representative, Sophie (with her hand raised in the photo) is 38 years old. Sophie is married to a man named Christian. The couple have three dependent children in school. Sophie lives together with her husband and children. The couple cover the various household expenses between them. Sophie finished school at the secondary level. In order to meet her various expenses, Sophie has been working as a mobile vendor of jewelry and children's clothing for seven years. Sophie buys her stock in a market in Bénin. With a view to satisfying her customers and in order to grow her business, Sophie is seeking a loan with ALIDé, together with the other members of the EXAUCE DE DIEU group. This loan will help them better meet their customers' needs, and to make a larger profit.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry

loans.name: Ahlam's Group

texts.en:
Ahlam is a member of this group from Iraq. Ahlam is 51 years old widow, mother of two; she started her sewing business five years ago to support her family.
She is requesting this (Qard Hassan ) loan that Izdiharona provides for divorced and widow women to buy iron and over sewing machine to increase her production and income .
The story of Ahlam and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .
They preferred to blur their face to cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Ahlam's Group $ 3,000 loan is to buy iron and over sewing machine.

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr: Anna est une femme âgée de 35 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Mariée et mère de cinq enfants, Anna est une marchande de pâte de manioc qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers et à domicile. Anna désire ce crédit pour financer son achat des sacs de pâte de manioc en vue de bien revendre puis d’en tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges de sa famille.

loans.use: Acheter 36 sacs de pâte de manioc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Joyce would like to invest in shares from stock exchange market.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia learned the how to be a seamstess with relatives who live in Monterrey, Nuevo Leo'n. When she returned to her present address in Forecastle in the state of Coahuila, she could not find a job and decided to open a business similar to the one of its relatives. This was five years ago while she was still unmarried. She began with making alterations for her neighbors and at the moment it has many orders of secretariales uniforms.

Now she is married and has two children. One is 2 years old and smallest was born on the 15th. The familiar expenses have increased with the arrival of the baby. Alicia wants to offer a better future to her children and is ready to work to obtain it. She currently needs a loan of $375 to buy materials to fill exisiting orders. Alicia wants her business to grow and sincerely thanks you for any aid you can provide.

Alicia aprendió el oficio de costurera con unos familiares que viven en Monterrey, Nuevo León, al regresar a su actual domicilio en la localidad de Saltillo del estado de Coahuila, no podía conseguir trabajo y decidió abrir un negocio similar al de sus familiares, esto fue mientras ella estaba soltera, hace cinco años, empezó haciendo pequeñas costuras con las vecinas y actualmente tiene muchos pedidos de uniformes secretariales. Ahora ella es casada y tiene dos hijos uno de 2 años y el más pequeño sólo tiene 15 días de nacido, y los gastos familiares se han incrementado con la llegada del bebé.

Alicia quiere ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus hijos y esta dispuesta a trabajar mucho para conseguirlo. En estos momentos ella necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que empleara en la compra de materiales que necesita para la elaboración de las prendas que le han sido pedidas. Ella quiere crecer y necesita de tu apoyo, y agradece sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas darle.

loans.use:
Purchase fabric and thred

compra de telas e hilos

loans.name: Anar

texts.en:
This young man is  23 years old, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. He is single.
He has run this business for 4 years.
Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy 2 cows to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows

loans.name: Boeun

texts.en: Boeun was married in 2002 and has 1 son. She learned to weave silk from her sister 14 years ago and then she started her silk production. She has never been to school. Her husband, Mr. Chea Chamroeun weaves silk as well. She is asking for a $200 loan from MAXIMA to buy silk material and sewing thread. She is able to earn enough to support her family and repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase silk material and sewing thread.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Nambooze has been a client for the last ten (10) years. She operates a shop in Kayunga District, in a small trading center called Bukoloto. Margaret is a good client who knows how to allocate her money. She sells used clothes which she buys from Kampala. She has been able to graduate from moving from one market to the other selling her clothes, to getting a shop where she operates from consistently. The shop she operates in was as a result of saving and loans she obtained from Feed The Children Uganda for the last ten years. She started with a loan of USD $30 and to date, she services loans of USD $800. She sells her clothes to both retailers and wholesale customers.

loans.use: Margaret wants to buy six bales of ladies dresses and skirts.

loans.name: Fazira

texts.en:
Fazira has a farm in the village of Kayunga. She has one cow and some poultry which she uses for laying. With the cow, she practices zero-grazing, which means that instead of the cow grazing on grasses throughout the village, it is penned up in a small corral. Feed is then bought and fed to the cow. This method takes much less attention, is simple, and quite yielding in growth. The downside is the time it takes to sickle the grass and bring it to the cow.

With her loan, she plans to buy more chicks for laying. It takes several months for chicks to become layers, and money for feed has to be spent prior to getting a return, so this can be difficult since few people have the ability to save. But Fazira has experience in farming and she budgets her funds carefully.

Fazira is 37, married, with 6 children and she cares for 3 orphans. With the money from her farm, she has been able to pay school fees. She is a committed lady whose dream is to make sure her children are well-educated and she hopes to continue expanding her farm.

loans.use: To buy more chicks for laying and more chicken feed.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en: Mrs. Seam H., 19,  is married with one little child and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works as a masseuse, earning around $5/day in revenue. Mrs. Seam H. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business so that her family’s income generation will be steadily increased. (Her Husband is pictured with a motor-bike he plans to use for his business because Mrs. Seam H. was unavailable)

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Kyobe I(A) Group

texts.en:
Teo is married with four children. She has a public pay phone, sells airtime cards and also offers phone charging services. She wants to pay school fees for the children and buy a piece of land with the extra profits.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase another pay phone and more air time cards

loans.name: Namuwaya West A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zaina Nangobi. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items. Zaina is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 2 children aged 6 and 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Zaina makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Zaina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 500000 in order to invest in business and the loan was paid back on time.

Zaina is joined in her small group by Scola N., Jane N., Farida N., and Zaina N.. Scola N. has a business selling soft drinks and wants to buy a fridge. Jane N. is currently operating a business selling matooke and wants a loan to purchase more matooke from villages. Farida N. operates a business running a bakery and wants to buy more baking ingredients. Zaina N. is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To increase stock of capital in her shop

loans.name: Mercedes Dilania

texts.en: Mercedes is thirty-two years old and a single mother of three boys and one girl, all of whom attend school in San Cristobal.  Mercedes sells underwear to men and woman of her community. She started her business last year, and now she has a well-established clientele which includes friends, teachers of the public school and people of the surroundings. Twice a month, Mercedes trips outside her community to buy the goods at low prices, and she retails them in her area. Mercedes hopes to become, before long, one of the most well-known supplier of these goods in the market. With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy big quantities of underwear so that she can reduce the frequent trips outside her community and increase her revenue.

loans.use: Purchase of underwear to add to her stock and keep running her business.

loans.name: Issac

texts.en:
Isaac is the thirty-six year old married father of a three year old daughter. His wife sells ice cream treats. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more clutch disks and pressure plates from Germany and Italy. In Ghana there are no auto parts stores, but there is a high demand for parts as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. His stand operates in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

Isaac hopes that he is able to increase his sales volume and can set aside more money to prepare for his daughter’s school fees. Isaac is a member of the lending group Respect. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Isaac would like to buy more clutch disks and pressure plates to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: expand the business

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reina A. is originally from the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega and with a lot of effort works in the business of making and selling tortillas in her house. This is very respectable work and thanks to it she has managed to support her family satisfying the necessities of the household and provide an education for her small son.

The problem that Reina is confronting nowadays is the lack of economic resources to buy the corn and firewood needed for the production of her tortillas. This is the reason that she is seeking the support of Ceprodel in obtaining a loan that will allow her to purchase the ingredients to continue the business of making and selling the delicious tortillas that she herself sells in her house in Somotillo.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Reina A. es originaria del municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega y muy esforzadamente se dedica al negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas en su sector de habitación. Este es un trabajo muy digno que gracias a el ha logrado mantener su núcleo familiar satisfaciendo las necesidades del hogar y brindándole la educación a su pequeño hijo.

La problemática que hoy en día la señora Reina está atravesando es la ausencia del recurso económico para la compra del maíz y la leña para la elaboración de las tortillas. Es por este motivo que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los ingredientes para llevar a cabo su negocio de elaboración y venta de las deliciosas tortillas que ella misma comercializa en su casa de habitación en Somotillo.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for production tortillas

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr:
Mrs. Essohanam A. is married, 29 years old and the mother of one child. She earns her income from the sale of her corn at the Agoe Assiyeye market, one of the local markets in the city of Lome. This lively market is open five days a week and attracts many buyers from the different quarters of the city. Mrs. A. started this business in 2003 and purchases her inventory in the Village of Kara, where she was born. She now has an increased number of clients and is requesting this first loan to purchase eight (8) sacks of corn to meet the higher demand.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 29 ans, madame A. Essohanam est une femme mariée qui et a un enfant. Elle a pour activité principale la vente de maïs dans le marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé l’un des marchés local de Lomé. Ce marché qui s’anime tous les cinq jours accueille beaucoup d’acheteurs venant de différents quartiers. Elle a commencé cette activité en 2003 et s’approvisionne dans son village natal qui est Kara. Actuellement sa clientèle connaît un accroissement et elle désire être à la hauteur et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter huit (8) sacs de maïs.

loans.use: Purchase of 8 sacks of corn

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi A. is 35 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. For more than 6 years, she has worked as a grain seller in Avetonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan she wishes to purchase corn, millets, rice and beans to resell. The profits from her sales will allow her to better support the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Essi A. est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales, depuis plus de 6 ans, à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter du maïs, du mil, du riz et du haricot pour la revente. Les profits de ses ventes lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: The purchase of corn, millets, rice and beans for resale

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel tiene 30 años, vive con sus padres. Es un joven que trabaja desde hace un año en la crianza de cuyes, tuvo esta iniciativa porque proviene de una familia que se dedica a esta actividad, implementó su criadero en varias celadas, donde clasifica a sus cuyes de acuerdo a la edad y sexo, la atención diaria y esmerada que les dedica le ha permitido aumentar considerablemente la cantidad de cuyes en su granja, en la actualidad posee más de 200, la tranquilidad de la rentabilidad en sus ventas es que es proveedor de una empresa agroindustrial, que demanda semanalmente una cantidad de cuyes, esta actividad, es su forma de vida, y le trae satisfacciones poder ser sostén en su familia.
Joel es movido constantemente por sus deseos de superación y su visión de un futuro mejor.
Invertirá el préstamo en la implementación de otro ambiente para la granja, para lo cual necesita materiales de construcción, en el futuro quiere ser un gran empresario agroindustrial en la rama de la crianza de cuyes.
texts.en:
Joel is 30 years old and lives with his parents. He is a youngster who has worked for one year raising guinea pigs. He had initiative given that he comes from a family that dedicates itself to this activity. He implemented his breeding place into various areas, where he classifies his guinea pigs based on age and sex. His daily level of attentiveness and the painstaking efforts have allowed him to considerably augment the number of animals in his farm. Currently, he possesses more than 200. The tranquility he has in his sales lies in that he is a purveyor of an agricultural enterprise which demands a weekly amount of guinea pigs. This activity is his way of life, and being able to sustain his family brings him great satisfaction.

Joel is motivated constantly by his wishes to improve his standard of living and by his vision of a better future. He will invest the loan into implementing another area in his farm, for which he requires construction materials. In the future, he would like to be a great agricultural businessman in the arena of raising guinea pigs.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of an additional area to improve his guinea pig farm.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji is a wife of M. and lives in a small area named Yadgar in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 8 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son has a spare parts business. The next to him makes lathe machines (machines that make tools) and sells them in different cities of Pakistan. Her daughter is in the 6th standard grade.

Rukhsana baji's husband is a tailor by profession. He has been a tailor for seven years.

Rukhsana baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy spare parts that are used to make lathe machines. This will help to expand her younger son's business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to make lathe machines

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en:
Bashorat is a 48 year old mother of two from Khujand. She requests a personal loan to make repairs to her kitchen and purchase new furniture. The money will be used to install new gas lines to her kitchen, which is crucial during the winter months when electricity is available only during specific hours of the day. With gas lines she is able to use 'balloon' gas - or canisters which can be stored for use when gas is not available from the city supply. Because of last year's winter conditions, much of Bashorat's furniture was damaged.  During periods where there was no heat in the home, the furniture became very cold.  When the heat returned, condensation formed and has warped her wooden table, chairs and other furniture.  She will use a portion of proceeds for the purchase of new furniture.

Bashorat plans to repay the loan over the next 12 months from her salary earned as a notary. She and her husband have a grown daughter who is married and also a son who is currently studying at the University in Khujand. She is slowly learning English from her husband and son and was eager to practice a few words during our interview.  ith winter already here and electricity being rationed, she is eager to get started on the repairs and thanks Kiva lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen en un principio empezó con el negocio ya que tenia ropa que le habían pasado y por ello decidió venderla, ya que con esto obtendría un ingreso extra ya que tenia   la necesidad de apoyar en el gasto familiar,  porque no completaba con el ingreso que le daba su esposo. Con los ingresos que obtuvo en la primera venta fue ahorrando y compro mas y mas pacas es así como ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio.
