Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 3 meses para comprara una paca de ropa que me están ofreciendo a muy buen precio.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen initially began her business selling second-hand clothing to earn some extra money by selling old clothing she already had. She had to help support her family financially because her husband's income was not enough to pay for the household expenses. With the profits that she received from her first sale, she began saving and purchased more and more bundles of clothing. Through this process, she has become successful in her business.

She needs a loan of MXN $4,000, which she will repay in 3 months, to buy a bundle of clothing that she was offered at a very good price.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bundle of clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua la señora Elizabeth A. se dedica a atender su tienda de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños de todas las edades.

Su actividad la realiza todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana y atiende a sus clientes muy alegremente ofertando sus productos. El motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la ropa ya que le urge obtenerla para ofrecerla y continuar con su pequeño negocio en desarrollo.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in the capital city of Managua, Ms. Elizabeth A. runs a store selling clothes for men, women and children of all ages. She works every day from early in the morning and attends to her clients in a friendly manner when offering them products. The reason that Elizabeth has come to Ceprodel is to take out a loan for the purchase of clothing, which she now needs to be able to continue offering products in her small store and help it develop.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 24-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their child. Abir has been working as a hairdresser for eight years. She requested a loan of 700 US Dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products for her work. This is the first time that Abir has requested a loan.

Abir is special in her work she does it well and she is fast. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she had to organize her time between her work and her business. Abir decided on doing her business because she always wanted to be a hairdresser and she is a motivated person, especially when it comes to her work. In the future, she plans on opening a salon.

loans.use: Abir will use the loan to purchase beauty products for her work.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa  es socia del bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Carmen es casada, tiene 45 años, cuatro hijos, de 22,16, 14 y 8 años  estudian en la escuela estatal.
El  esposo de Carmen Rosa  trabajaba en una fábrica y con la liquidación  compro un carro tiko  que lo ponen a trabajar, es una entrada más para su casa.
El negocio de Carmen Rosa es de taxi ella tiene un carro y lo da a trabajar. Carmen Rosa hace tamales los fines de semana 150 tamales, que los venden en su barrio con la ayuda de sus hijos. 
Necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles, para el mantenimiento de su taxi. 
Desde que esta en finca, le gusta el compañerismo que hay entre las socias 
El sueño de carmen Rosa es poder ir a Cajamarca allá tiene parcelas de tierra, quiere sembrar  pallar, palta y  lúcuma.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the San Judas Tadeo community bank. Carmen is married. She is 45 years old and has four children aged 22, 16, 14 and 8 who attend public school. Carmen Rosa's husband worked in a factory and with the severance pay he bought a motocar which they have put to work as this business brings additional income to their household. Carmen Rosa's business is the taxi business: she has a car which she rents out. Carmen Rosa prepares tamales on weekends: 150 tamales, which she sells in her neighbourhood with the help of her children. She needs a loan of 1,800 soles to perform maintenance on her taxi. Since joining Finca, she has enjoyed the companionship between members. Carmen Rosa dreams of going to Cajamarca where she has land which she wants to sow with butter beans, avocado and eggfruit.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To perform maintenance on her taxi

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth T. Z. tiene 35 años,su estado civil es casada. La actvidad economica de doña Elizabeth es la venta de cosmeticos y ropa. hace mas de tres años que se dedica a este negocio. sus propositos para su negocio son de establecer una pulperia y vender los cosmeticos en su casa de habitacion. el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que comprar lo necesario para ofrecerlos a sus clientes.sus deseos son de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda por lo que es su mayor necesidad.la cantida solicitada es de C$7.000 cordobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Elizabeth T. Z. is 35 years old. Her civil status is married. The economic activity of doña Elizabeth is the sales of cosmetics and clothes. For more than 3 years she has been dedicated to this activity. Her goals for her business are to establish a small grocery store and to sell the cosmetics from her home. The financing is for working capital since she has to buy the necessary things to offer to her clients. Her wish is to provide improvements to her dwelling, which is her greatest need. The amount requested is C$7.000 ($350 US) for a period of 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital - to buy cosmetics and clothes for resale and to fix up her home as a small store

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es socia del Bancomunal Amistad Unida.
Eugenia siempre le gusto trabajar, comenzó trabajando como ambulante en el mercado, hasta que pudo comprar un puesto en el mismo mercado, y se puso a vender fruta, también ella estudio repostería y actualmente hace postres.   
Eugenia necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para compra de fruta al por mayor, e insumos para los postres.
Desde que está en Finca, le ha ayudado a invertir, ha recibido charlas que le han orientado en el negocio, aprendió a ser responsable con los préstamos y pagar puntual.
El sueño de Eugenia es poner una dulcería en su casa.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the Bancomunal Amistad Unida. Eugenia always liked working. She worked as a street vendor in the market until she could buy her own stall there, and started selling fruit. She also studied pastry baking and currently makes desserts. Eugenia needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy bulk quantities of fruit and supplies for the desserts. Since she's been in Finca, she's received help with investing, has been in discussions that gave her guidance in business, learned to be responsible with loans and make her payments on time. Eugenia's dream is to start a sweetshop in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit and baking supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria T., 23, is married with 1 child. She has 1 year of experience in the elei (Samoan screen printing) business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 104 tala (~$36 USD). SPBD loans are Gloria’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase fabric paint, brushes, material, thread, a printing board, and needles

loans.name: Pheun

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheun T., 67, and her husband, Mr. Phat Tol, 70, were married in 1959 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Four of their children are married and live outside the family home, one son is a construction worker and one daughter is a silk weaver. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Pheun and her husband have been farming for ten years. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to use for farming and to purchase silk materials for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To use for farming and to buy silk for her daughter’s weaving business

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo M. is managing a small parcel of rice farm. He is 32 years old and unmarried. He owns a 1.5 hectare farm that helps him satisfy his daily needs. "I want to grow this farm so that when I will have my own family, I can easily provide all their needs", he says.

He is asking a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase insecticides, fertilizers and pay the laborers’ salaries. He thinks that with the loan he would be able to improve his harvest. 

CEVI aims to help small business grow. It reaches out rural communities and encourages people to start their own livelihood. CEVI gives with not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase insecticides, fertilizers and pay laborers' salaries

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz A. supports his parents with a small business selling men’s clothing and shoes. He operates from a little space at the central market in Agsu, Azerbaijan, where he maintains a nice variety of clothing from which to choose. Ramiz has been in business for 20 years. With good quality products and affordable prices, he has developed a solid customer base, and his business continues to grow. Ramiz has requested a loan to increase his working capital and allow him to purchase new inventory. This loan will help Ramiz to be prepared for the busy summer season so he can maximize his profits and provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to enlarge the business

loans.name: Clelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Clelia del Carmen D. C. de 31 años de edad, reside en Barrio Concepción ubicado en el departamento de La libertad junto a su esposo y su única hija de 12 años de edad, la cual se dedica a estudiar. Ella posee una venta de joyería, cosméticos, zapatos para niños y mujeres y otro tipo de accesorios para el cuidado personal de la piel. Clelia solicita un préstamo, ya que su mayor deseo es poder comprar al mayoreo, de manera que pueda ofrecer muchos más artículos a sus clientes y así mismo obtener nuevos clientes y así mejorar su economía familiar y poder brindarle un mejor futuro a su hija.
texts.en:
Clelia del Carmen D. C. is 31 years old and lives in Barrio Concepción, located in the La Libertad department with her husband and only daughter. Her daughter is 12 years old and is enrolled in school. She owns a store where she sells jewelry, cosmetics, children's and women's shoes, and other types of accessories for skin care. Clelia is requesting a loan because her desire is to be able to purchase wholesale, which is a way she could offer many more products to her customers and at the same time get new customers. This way, she can improve the life of her family and be able to provide a better future for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of more products for her business

location.town: Barrio Concepción,  departamento de La libertad

loans.name: José Akouwa

texts.fr:
José Akouwa S.  est née le 30 juin 1987 au Togo, le pays ouest de Bénin.  Elle vivait au Bénin depuis près de huit ans.  José Akouwa mène un magasin où elle vend des mèches, des produits pour cheveux, des tissus, des produits cosmétiques. Son boutique est bien aménagée.  Elle a dû louer pour donner une bonne image à son activité et par conséquents posséder des clients crédibles.

Avec le crédit, José Akouwa voudrait acheter des mèches et des produits cosmétiques.  Elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir renforcer son stock et mieux maîtriser sa demande qui ne cesse de s'accroître.
texts.en:
José Akouwa S. was born on the 30th of June, 1987 in Togo, a country to the west of Benin. She has been living in Benin for about 8 years. José Akouwa operates a store where she sells hair pieces, hair products, fabrics and cosmetic products. Her kiosk is well maintained. She rented it specifically to present an attractive image of her business and as a consequence has attracted good quality clients. With this loan José Akouwa would like to buy hair pieces and cosmetic products. She is requesting the loan to build up her inventory and to better manage her ever increasing customer demands.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair pieces and cosmetic products

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence is 52, married, and has five children. All of her children attend school. She resides and owns a two roomed house where she lives with nine people. Florence takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water in the house. The family eats two meals a day. Florence runs a restaurant in one of Kampala suburbs. 
Florence has an average customer base of twenty people a day. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for the last six years. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for both the business premises and home. Florence has been with MCDT for over six years and is servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group members. She will use this loan to buy additional stock items for her restaurant. Florence is hoping her business will expand and aspires to owning a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To stock more food for her resturant

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 51 years old and married with four children who all assist her in the trade when they are not in school. Grace sells drinks and foodstuffs and has been in this business since 2004. She buys foodstuffs from a village market and sells to women who retail it. She buys drinks from distributors who the company supplies. Grace said she hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase directly from the company at a reduced rate. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an additional cow.

loans.name: Mrs. Theavy Chem Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Theavy C. is a group leader of six members who all live in Prey Kduoch village in Takeo province. She is a rice middle woman. Her husband, Mr. Teng Thim, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile soil. In order to deal this problem, Mrs. Theavy C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of money to buy piglet for breeding. She is 34 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of money to buy piglet for breeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: New addition to home/business

loans.name: Ndejje B Kisubi Agnes Group

texts.en:
K. Agnes is a businesswoman, forty-eight years old; she has three children studying and has three dependents studying, too.

Agnes has been dealing in the business of used-clothes and crafts, like mats, for over fifteen years. She is using the loan to purchase craft items such as material for making mats, hats, etc., and to purchase used clothes to sell.

Agnes is a hardworking and courageous businesswoman whose dream is the education of her children and the well-being of her family. She appreciates the loan because it is encouraging her to work.

loans.use: To purchase craft items and used clothes

loans.name: Shahbaz

texts.en:
Shahbaz S. is a young entrepreneur. Seven years ago, he started his own business selling food and home supplies as a way to support his wife and son. With hard work and a lot of effort, he has succeeded in expanding his business. This is also thanks to daily improvement in the quality of the service and products that he offers his clients. 

Shahbaz's son is his motivation for continuing to improve and expand his business. To meet the current demand of his clients, Shahbaz is requesting a loan of 1606 AZN. With your help, Shahbaz will improve the quality of the service he offers his clients and will continue to expand his business. He appreciates the opportunity that your support offers him.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Kojoki

texts.en:
Kojoki B. is currently in the business of selling sugar, rice and soap in a shop, and is requesting a loan to purchase other items such as paraffin, bags of beans, etc. to sell.  Kojoki is 28 years old and is married to an accountant. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a larger store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase paraffin, bags of beans, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cresing

texts.en:
Cresing A. is from the village of Villanueva. She is 51 years old. Cresing is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Cresing owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing & shoes in the local community. Cresing has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cresing joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresing is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Cresing from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly composed of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en: Davaa is 49 years old and lives with her husband and 21 year old daughter in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called a “ger”. Her daughter attends university, her husband is retired and Davaa runs a household goods retail business out of a rented stall in the local market. She started her business in 2005 with working capital of 60,000 tugrugs. Since then, her working capital has reached 350,000 tugrugs and she has become established in the business community. Davaa says, “I am working hard to feed my family.” She is requesting a 400,000 tugrug to purchase products to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase products.

loans.name: Rosalinda Lugod's Group

texts.en:
Rosalinda L. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old. Rosalinda is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosalinda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosalinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise & sell in the future. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosalinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina Y. is from the village of Batangan , Valencia City. She is 34 years old. Marlina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marlina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Marlina is just starting this business.

In 2009, Marlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marlina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mujeres Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
El Señor Nolasco siempre trabajo como personal D. limpieza en diferentes empresas lamentablemente el sueldo que percibía era mínimo y no le alcanzaba para el sustento D. su familia es por  ello que deciD. invertir sus ahorros implementando una bodega  en su propia casa empezó vendiendo golosinas y algunas pocas cosas, a pesar D. la competencia  le va bien en su negocio, trata D.  mantenerlo surtido para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo necesario, en la bodega trabaja el y su esposa ella lo ayuda las veces que el se ausenta ya que sigue dedicándose al servicio D. limpieza 3 veces por semana en forma independiente. Con sus  ingresos  ha podido comprar una exhibidora y una congeladora que es indispensable para mejorar su negocio,  también pueD. ayudar a su hijo en sus estudios.
Para  el futuro el Señor Nolasco quiere buscar un local adecuado para poner una bodega más granD. en un lugar estratégico,por otro lado pertenecer al grupo" MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO" le ha servido D. mucho en sus proyectos es el unico hombre y se siente feliz dentro del grupo, en esta ocasión su préstamo lo usara para comprar alimentos para aves D. corral, incursionara en esto por que la mayoría D. sus vecinos se dedican a la crianza  D. aves  y le piden mucho este producto. El esta feliz por que en EDAPROSPO ha encontrado apoyo para lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Señor Nolasco always worked providing cleaning services for various companies. Unfortunately the salary that he was earning was minimal, and was not sufficient to support his family. For this reason he decided to invest his savings to start up a store in his home where he started selling sweets and other small items. In spite of the competition, his business is doing well. He tries to keep it well-stocked so that his customers can always find what they need. He works in the store and his wife helps him at times when he is absent, because he is also continuing to work independently as a cleaner 3 times a week. With his income he has been able to buy a display case and a freezer which he needed to improve his business, and he also helps his son pay for his studies. For the future, Señor Nolasco wants to look for an appropriate site where he could have a bigger store in a strategic location. He belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Rumo al Progreso," and it has helped him a lot with his projects. He is the only man, and he is happy to be a part of the group. On this occasion he will use his loan to buy food for poultry, venturing into this area because the majority of his neighbors raise poultry, and they get a good price for this product. He is pleased that EDAPROSPO has supported him in achieving his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Cable Workers Group, Lugazi

texts.en: K. Godfrey, at the top left, also appears in the group photo and he is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is a hardworking and devoted married man with three children aged 11, 7 and 1 1/2 years old. They are all in the primary section. He takes care of other dependants. Godfrey has been selling spare parts from Lugazi for 10 years and although he is able to make 150,000/= profit weekly, he is affected by the transport costs to Kampala where he buys his stock. This why loans help him to buy in bulk. Therefore he does not have to move all the time. He hopes to continue working hard so that he can offer a good education to his children and he believes this will be possible if he has a steady supply of goods in his shop. Godfrey needs a loan to be able to buy more spare parts for resale.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos en el distrito de Santa Rosa, un distrito cuya principal actividad es la pesca y que se encuentra ubicado a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la pesca desde que era muy joven, trabaja en embarcaciones que efectuan extracciones indutriales de anchoveta (pescado que se extrae en abundancia del litoral) y, cuando no trabaja en este rubro, tambien trabaja en pesca artesanal, el pescado que logra extraer lo vende en el muelle del distrito. El depende de estas actividades para solventar los gastos familiares por lo que siempre se esfuerza por trabajar lo mas arduamente posible.

Nicolas ha acudido a Edpyme Alternativa para solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles que necesita para realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, ya que la brisa marina esta llenando de salitre sus paredes y estas necesitan de mantenimiento para que no se dañen las estructuras.

El es un padre muy responsable y entregado a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona de confianza. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente responsable y puntual al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 52 years old, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the district of Santa Rosa, a district whose principle activity is fishing and which is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, He has been dedicated to fishing since he was young. He works on vessels that are engaged in the commercial fishing of anchovy (a fish that is found in abundance on the coast) and, when not working at this, he also works in fishing on his own: The fish that he catches is sold at the district's wharf. He is dependent on these activities to pay for the family's expenses and so he always strives to work as hard as possible. Nicolas has approached Edpyme Alternativa to solicit a loan of 1500 new soles, which he needs to makes some improvements to his home since the sea breeze fills his walls with salt and they need maintenance so that it doesn't damage the structure. He is a very responsible father, dedicated to his family. His neighbors and acquaintances consider him to be a trustworthy person. He has already worked previously with our institution and has proved to be a responsible client who is punctual at payment time.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for maintenance and repairs to his home.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres El Quetzal Group

texts.es:
Este grupo D. personas residen en Prados El Quetzal, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez, y solicitaron un  
crédito en L. Asociación ASDIR, con el cual cada una inició con una venta, los cuales son venta D. productos D. belleza, venta D. frutas, venta D. aguas, venta D. pollos, el cual lo comercializan en diferentes puntostanto en el municipio D. San Antonio como también en los municipios aledaños. Con estas ventas que realizan se ha visto L. superación que han tenido estas familias ya que el ingreso que ellas obtienen se ha conbertido  en una base fuerte que contribuye al mejoramiento económico del hogar y al mismo tiempo al logro D. los sueños para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of this group live in Prados El Quetzal, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez. They took out a loan with ASDIR which each of them invested in a sales business. The businesses incluD. sales of beauty products, fruit, soft drinks, and chickens. The sales are maD. at different places in the town of San Antonio and the neighboring towns. With their businesses, these families have seen improvements in their lives. Their earnings have improved the economic conditions of their homes and, at the same time, are fulfilling their dreams for their children.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products, fruit, soft drinks, and chickens for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable cellphone cards to sell

loans.name: Elcie

texts.es:
Elcie H. M., tiene la edad de 44 años, está casada, y vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 20 y  15 años de edad, que son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Elcie también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. 
About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Elcie H. M. is 44 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children (ages 20 and 15). Her loan will be used for attending to her farm, specifically for growing coffee. She plans to buy compost and fertilizers so that she can adequately maintain her coffee crop in order to obtain better quality and the best price when it is time to harvest. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the services that have been provided.

Doña Elcie has been farming for many years. She hopes to provide a better quality of life and greater financial stability for her family. In addition, she wants to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers for her coffee crop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of fresh fruit to make juices and snacks

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang L. is a 56-year-old widowed mother. She has six children, two of whom are now married and the other four of whom are single. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Kompong Tom province.
Leang L. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her parents. She grows different kinds of crop on her land, such as cabbages, cucumbers, and potatoes, which she sells to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. She has many partners in her teenage children who grow the crops with her. Leang L. will be using this loan as capital to grow potato crops.

loans.use: To grow potato crops

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She is 40 years old and married with ten children between the ages of 2 and 15. Five of the children are currently attending school.

She has been practicing mixed farming for over 10 years and her main product is milk which she sells to the local market. She is also a cash crop farmer and sells her tea to the local market. Her major challenges in this business are a lack of enough food for the dairy cows and insufficient water since there is no piped water and they have to rely on water from the river which is very far away.

Mary has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. With the income from the sale of milk, she will be able to provide food for her family and pay school fees for her children.

She would like to have five dairy cows in the next five years. She would also like to be assisted in sourcing for good quality dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Suy's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Suy S. is the group leader of a four member group loan located in Preaek Traeng village in Kandal province. They will all use their portion of the loan in different ways to improve their businesses. 


Mr.  Suy S. is 46 years old. He is a laborer while his wife, Mrs. Sophors Sun, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Through this activity, the couple supports seven children. One of their children is a seamstress in a garment factory; another is a jewelry maker; four are attending the local public school, and the youngest one is three years old. Although all the members try to work hard, they can only earn a small amount of money. To improve the family's living conditions, Mr. Suy S. is asking for a loan to buy coffee and fruit to start a new business reselling these goods.

loans.use: To buy coffee and fruit for resale

loans.name: Kisaka

texts.en:
Kisaka S. is 24 years old and married to Rose. He supports two people in his family.

Kisaka is a farmer. He farms on his own piece of land, which he has been doing this for the past three years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is a KADET client. This is his first loan. He plans to use 20,000 KES on harrowing, 20,000 KES on seeds, and 10,000 KES to plant 10 acres of wheat.

He hopes to use the profit he makes to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Kisaka's dream is to do large-scale farming and attain financial independence.

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: Farming expenses

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es:
Isabel de 40 años, ella vende productos de uso personal como cosméticos por catalogo de marca Avon ( empresa que ayuda a mujeres emprendedoras a vender cosméticos a un bajo costo), ella vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Ella inicio con las ventas de cosméticos Avon para tener ingresos suficientes y así dales una mejor vida a sus dos hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales. Vende maquillaje, perfumes, cremas, desodorantes a un bajo costo por catalogo. Ella vende los productos a sus conocidos y vecinos. 

Para incrementar su mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes, maquillaje, cremas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y tener un local de los productos Avon.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old. She sells personal care products, such as cosmetics, through the Avon catalogue (the company helps female entrepreneurs to sell cosmetics at a low cost). She lives in the suburb of Guayaquil (urban area, most residents are small traders). She started selling Avon cosmetics in order to have sufficient income and thus give her two sons, who attend public schools, a better life. She sells make-up, perfumes, creams and deodorants at a low cost through a catalogue. She sells the goods to her friends and neighbors. In order to increase her stock she plans to use the loan to buy perfumes, make-up and creams for her business. In future she wants to finish building her house and own an Avon product store.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume, make-up and creams.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Nancy;  Ella tiene34 años de edad,  es  separada y tiene 2 hijas,  se dedica al cuidado de su tienda de abarrotes, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes  y vende también algunos regalitos, de este modo ella surte su mercadería. La socia necesita capital de trabajo para poder incrementar sus ganancias. La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Patron de Santiago de Santiago" communal bank. This communal bank is based in the district of Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco. This borrower is Ms. Nancy. She is 34 years old, separated, and has two daughters. She runs a grocery store where she also sells some small gifts in order to diversify her merchandise. This borrower needs working capital in order to increase her earnings. She is requesting this loan to invest in running her grocery store. Ms. Nancy is grateful for and values this loan and also promises to be disciplined in complying with the repayment terms that have been established.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in running her grocery store

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Qorimankacha”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Beatriz; ella tiene 58 años de edad y es madre soltera y  tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio venta de productos de aluminios y vidrios, ella tiene una tienda donde trabaja desde las 8.00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar aluminios y vidrios para su negocio.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Maria Beatriz is a member of the Communal Bank "Qorimankacha.” The bank is located in the District of Wanchaq, Province and Department of Cusco. Maria Beatriz is 58 years old and a single mother of 4 children. She alternates her daily activities between selling aluminum and glass products. She also has a store where she works from 8 AM to 7 PM. She wants to improve her business so she is requesting a loan to buy aluminum and glass. Maria Beatriz uses this forum to thank all those who are part of this dream and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy aluminum and glass for her business

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr: M. anani est un jeune homme de 39 ans, il est célibataire, il exerce comme activité la vente de produits alimentaires, il fait ce commerce depuis 2002 et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l'achat de 5 cartons de canettes, 10 cartons de spaghetti, 6 cartons de lait et divers.
texts.en:
Anani M. is a single, 39 year old man. He sells food products. He started this business in 2002 and stocks up at the main market in Lomé. His clientele includes people of all walks of life. He is requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 5 boxes of canned goods, 10 boxes of spaghetti, 6 cartons of milk and other products.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of food products

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita S. is from the village of San Antonio, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 58 years old. Perlita is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Perlita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals, she also sells snacks. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Perlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Moreta

texts.en:
"Moreta Ricabalnca is a married woman who lives in , Brgy.Tabun-ac, Toboso, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures, a General Store and she also sells woven mats. Her husband Antonio R., who is 67 years old, works as a Laborer to earn his living .  have  eight children who are 23 to  46 years old. 

Moreta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Moreta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 21st cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy stocks for her general store so that she could continue to save up for future expansion of her business. Moreta Ricabalnca is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stocks of goods to sell

loans.name: Anhbayar

texts.en:
Anhbayar B., age 27, trades in raw materials, such as sheepskin and wool, at his trading business in his town. He lives with his wife and daughter in a fenced house in the Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. Anhbayar purchases his materials from sources in the countryside, collecting them with his own truck and selling the materials in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, for a profit. 

He started his business in 2004, by purchasing a raw materials in the local market and selling those materials to wholesalers. After years of successful operation, he has managed to expand his business. With his earnings, he was able to afford to buy a new truck in order to transport his materials. 

Anhbayar has gained a lot of experience and knowledge over the years and he hopes to use this experience and knowledge to keep his business growing. His future goals are to continue growing his business and to provide a good education for his child. 

He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw materials from the countryside and rural areas in order to increase sales.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials duch as sheepskin and wool to offer for sale

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida S. is 49 years old, married, and blessed with 3 children; one of them is an adult and the rest are school-aged. She is from the village of Pta. Sulong, Baliangao. Brigida is engaged in raising hogs to sell. From this activity, she's able to earn a monthly net income of 3,500 PHP. She has been in this business for 15 years.

In 2004, Brigida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Brigida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Brigida is requesting her 11th loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed for the hogs.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the hogs.

loans.name: Nowerina

texts.en:
N. Nowerina lives in the Busega neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Nowerina has a business of a bar. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Nowerina sells her products from home, by means of retail. Nowerina has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and sodas.

The main business challenge(s) for Nowerina include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar. Nowerina lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: Lily's Group

texts.en:
Lily B. is from the city of Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City. She is 49 years old. Lily is the group leader for a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lily is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lily owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Lily has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lily joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Lily is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Lily's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand the business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Juan Javier

texts.es:
Juan Javier  Q. G. tiene 29 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 6 anos. El vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Juan es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Juan cultiva cacao y arroz y tiene este negocio desde hace 1 año. El compra y vende sus productos en Matilde Esther. El solicita el crédito para ampliar las siembras de cacao y de arroz. El préstamo le ayudara a mejorar las cosechas. 

Sus metas para el futuro son tener un carro, una casa propia y una finca. 

El mayor desafío que el enfrenta en su negocio es la época de invierno, ya que en esa temporada las cosechas bajan bastante. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta descansar, jugar indoor y salir a las fiestas patronales.
texts.en:
Juan Javier Q. G. is 29 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and has two children aged 9 and 6.  He lives in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province. 

Juan is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new group is located in the community of Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Juan grows cacao and rice.  He has been in this business for one year.  He buys and sells his products in Matilde Esther.  He is requesting this loan to expand the cacao and rice crops that he grows.  The loan will help him to improve his harvests.  His goals for the future are to own a car, his own home and a farm.  The greatest challenge that he faces in his business is the winter season as, during this season, his harvests are considerably reduced.  In his spare time, Juan likes to relax, play indoor soccer and celebrate the local fiestas.

loans.use: To expand the cacao and rice crops that he grows

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is twenty-eight years old, a single mother of one child living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a desire to educate her child. For three years she has been operating a bar and her major challenge is the unpredictable nature of customers while her dream is to own a bigger bar in town. Elizabeth needs the loan to buy beers and sodas for sale.

loans.use: Buying beers and sodas for sale

loans.name: Ann Wanjiru

texts.en:
Ann Wanjiru M. runs a retail shop in Mlolongo and earns a good income. She is married to Sammy and they have two school-aged children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She has never borrowed from any other MFI. She is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy maize flour, sugar, and sweets to add to the stock in her shop. 

Ann hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To stock her retail shop with items like sugar, maize flour,and sweets

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Vive con su familia en su casa propia ubicada en la parte rural del caserío San Pablo Huartaco II en el distrito de Tambogrande. Éste es una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino en un corral en su propio domicilio. Lleva 10 años realizando este negocio. Ella cría animales menores y cuando ya han alcanzado el tamaño y peso ideal los ofrece en venta al público en general en el mercado local. Cuenta con una clientela establecida en su comunidad. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce el rubro a la perfección. 

Mabel solicita el crédito para arreglar su corral y comprar más alimentos balanceados para su ganado. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles. Mabel es trabajadora y muy encargada a su familia. Espera aumentar sus ingresos para seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mabel is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives with her family in her own home located in a rural area of the San Pablo Huartaco II community in the district of Tambogrande. This is a farming area located in the Piura province, in the region of the same name, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She raises sheep in a corral at her own house. She has had this business for 10 years. She raises small animals and when they have reached the ideal size and weight she sells them to the public in the local market. She has established clientele in her community. She learned this activity from her parents, that is, she knows this business perfectly. 

Mabel is asking for the loan to fix her corral and buy balanced feed for her sheep. For this, she has thought it best to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500 nuevos soles. Mabel is hardworking and taked good care of her family. She hopes to increase her income to continue getting her family ahead.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman who lives in Aborlan, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  a general store, food vending and tricycle transport.  Her husband Belindo, who is 51 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 9 and 22 years old. Myrna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Myrna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 28,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,000 to buy additional products to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and expansion of her business. Myrna is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rukarara Development Group-Kihihi

texts.en:
Amiria K. is a 30 year old happily married mother of 4 high spirited kids who are all happily in school. Amiria, who is affiliated with Rukarara development group-Kihihi, has been running a food sales business for the past 2 years in Mizimera Trading center Market. Rice is what she has, for the most part, been selling, although she also has other foods for sale at her stall, such as bananas, cassava and millet.

Amiria says she began this business with savings from her erstwhile milk sales business. Many of her friends describe her as courteous, amiable, tenacious, and determined in whatever she does. Weekly, she says this business generates her shillings 20,000 as profits, and she says with this loan, she is going to purchase more bags of other cash crops such as pineapples, sorghum, maize, dried beans, etc. to resell.

In the group photo, one male member's face is slightly obscured and he has been marked as not pictured.

loans.use: to purchase other cash crops such as pineapples, sorghum, maize, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou P. is 34 years old, married and has four children, the oldest being fourteen years old while the youngest is only two.

Marilou is a farmer. She primarily grows rice, then sells her harvest to the market. Marilou works hard to sustain her family especially so as to support her children's education.

Marilou's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farming necessities.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farming necessities

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Reside junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral como pavos y gallinas. Ella engorda a su ganado para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local.  Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más de 4 años en la parte posterior de su casa, donde tiene corrales acondicionados para esta actividad.  Los ingresos que percibe le sirve para cubrir los gsatos de su familia. 

Marisol anhela que su ganado alcance el peso y tamaño adecuado para venderlo, con los ingresos comprar más ganado y engordarlo.  Sin duda lo logrará, es sabido que los pobladores de Tambogrande son gente emprendedora y pujante.  Para lograr su objetivo, Marisol ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
31-year old Marisol is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the agricultural area of Tambogrande in the region of Piura, more than four hours from the town of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Marisol earns her living by raising sheep and poultry such as turkeys and chickens. Once they are fattened, she sells them in the local market. She’s been doing this work for more than four years at the back of her house where there are pens specially made for this purpose. The money she earns pays for the household expenses.

Marisol’s greatest wish is for her livestock to reach the best weight and size possible before she sells them. With the income she will buy more animals to fatten. There’s no doubt that she will succeed, as the inhabitants of Tambogrande are known for their entrepreneurial and vigorous spirit. To achieve her goal, Marisol has asked Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 soles.

loans.use: to buy nutritious animal feed

loans.name: Luisita

texts.en:
Luisita is 43 and married with five children. Her eldest child is 13. Luisita’s husband works as a farmer. She is also a farmer and for the past five years has been farming in San Francisco, Agusan del sur. Luisita earns 10,000 PHP a month.

Luisita is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. In the future, she hopes to make her livelihood successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Kyerima Dembe Development Group

texts.en: 36-year-old God has been in the grocery store business for 4 years now. He operates from Kayunga. This happily married father of 5  sells mostly vegetables and fruits. He says he began this business with the persuasion of one of his closest friends. He is also in the motorcycle transportation business. Weekly, he says this business can generate for him 189,000 shillings in profit. He says he will use this loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Entente Group

texts.fr: ENTENTE est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Agathe Dossi. Les membres du groupe habitent ensemble dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née le 07 Mars 1966 au Bénin, Agathe Dossi est mariée et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Agathe Dossi habite ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Agathe Dossi fait le commerce des cartes de recharges téléphoniques au Bénin. Agathe Dossi s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes de la place. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Agathe Dossi et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: The Entente Group is composed of three individuals. Its representative (the one raising her hand in the photo) is called Agathe Dossi. The group members live in the same neighborhood in Benin. With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members are seeking their first loan from ALIDé. Born on March 7, 1966 in Benin, Agathe Dossi is married and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. Agathe Dossi lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various family needs. In order to support herself and the children, Agathe Dossi sells recharge cellular  cards in Benin. She stocks up from local wholesalers. This first loan will certainly allow Agathe Dossi and her group to expand the level of their activities, and to increase the number of customers as well as the revenues.

loans.use: to buy phone cards

loans.name: Flor Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lucha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, venta de pescado, fábrica de lácteos, costura de chalecos, tienda de artículos varios, artesanías, venta de comida, tapicería.
 
La señora Lucha,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de chalecos, que viene trabajando hace trece años atrás, el cual inicio solo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de tela, este material lo compra de la Ceja y por mayor, posterior a la elaboración. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación, salud y ahorros.

En la fotografía nos acompaña la hermana de una de las socias, ella es la que mira la ventana.
texts.en:
The Flor Kantuta Community Association will start its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Panamericana. It is comprised of eight members and is run by a board of directors headed up by Lucha. The businesses that the members of the community association run are varied. Among them we have: crocheting blankets, selling fish, dairy production, making cardigans, a general store, arts and crafts, food sales, and upholstery.

Lucha states that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer and that she started by invitation from a promoter. She has a business of making cardigans. She has been in this business for three years, which she started on her own.

The loan she will take is to purchase fabric. She will purchase this material from Ceja wholesale after it is made. This work allows her to generate revenue to support her family. She is married and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training, health, and savings.

In the photograph, the sister of one of the members is present. She is the one looking out the window.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Juan Yamid

texts.es:
HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS JUAN YAMID TRABAJA LA MADERA CON ESTA LABOR HA PODIDO SOSTENER SU FAMILIA Y HA PODIDO DARLES UNA BUENA CALIDAD DE VIDA.

EL QUIERE TENER UNA MAQUINA NUEVA QUE LE FACILITE SU TRABAJO Y ADEMÁS ASI PODER OFRECER OTROS SERVICIOS PARA SUS CLIENTES, DE ESTA FORMA SE INCREMENTAN SUS INGRESOS Y ASI PODER MEJORAR CADA DÍA SU VIDA Y LA DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
For more than 10 years Juan Yamid has practiced woodworking. With this job he has been able to take care of his family and give them a good quality of life.

He wants to get a new machine that will make his job easier and so that he can offer his customers other services. This will increase his income and allow him to improve his life and that of his family every day.

loans.use: to buy a machine.

loans.name: Yeggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Yeggo du Banc Villageois de Gabar est créé depuis le 14 mai 2010,il est composé de dix huit  femmes qui habitent le même village et mènent comme activités principales le maraîchage et le petit commerce.



Madame Awa la responsable est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée mère de neuf enfants en charge dont un neveu;  elle fait du maraîchage et a une expérience de 20 ans; elle cultive du persil, des carottes,oignons tomates et choux.Parallèlement elle mène son petit commerce de denrées alimentaires et de ses produits récoltés. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou bleu et couverte d'un châle mauve.


Elle achéte ses semences et ses denrées dans la ville et revend au marché du village; les produits récoltés sont vendus dans les marchés hebdomadaires.
Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter plus de semences et de marchandises afin d'augmenter ses revenus.

Elle aide son mari pour les dépenses des besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The Yeggo solidarity group belonging to the Banc Villageois in Gabar was set up on 14th May 2010. It is made up of 18 women who live in the same village and whose main activities are market gardening and small-scale trading.

Awa, who is in charge of the group, is 43 years old, married and mother to nine children who are in her care, one of whom is her nephew. She has a small market garden and has 20 years experience in this domain; she grows parsley, carrots, onions, tomatoes and cabbages. At the same time she sells food products, including her own harvested produce. She is standing on the right of the photo, dressed in a blue "boubou" (an African flowing dress) covered by a mauve shawl.

She buys her seeds and food products in the town and sells them at the village market; the harvested produce is sold at the weekly markets. Her loan will allow her to buy more seeds and products in order to increase her income.

She helps her husband to provide for the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her small market garden and food products for resale

loans.name: Zoya's Group

texts.en:
According to top designers of Kyrgyztan, the textile industry of the country has an extreme need for human resources. There are many designers, who are generators of ideas and low-level seamstresses, who execute the intended idea. However, very often both sides face misunderstandings which are caused by the absence of a middle linkage between them. The industry is in need of mid-level employees who would interpret top designers' ideas into small tasks for seamstresses. 

Zoya, 53, is the leader of this group. She is one of those linkage employees who are critically important for any business. Zoya is married and has been providing private sewing and designing services for two years. She acquired these skills while working for a local fashion house. Her business was started with the purchase of a sewing machine for 10,000 soms. This equipment is Zoya's main asset and helps create hundreds of looks. A monthly profit is around 6,000 soms (~$135); however, a very small part of it is saved for the purchase of additional equipment. Zoya would like to use the loan for the purchase of a new type of sewing machine that would definitely improve the quality of her clothing. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: La señora Paulina tiene un puesto de venta de abarrotes en el mercado Rodríguez. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería como ser: azúcar, fideo y demás productos para abastecer y tener un stock para vender a sus clientes. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona Las Lomas en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y está siendo canalizado a través de los financiadores en Kiva.
texts.en:
Paulina has a stand selling groceries at the Rodríguez market.  She needs the loan to buy merchandise like sugar, noodles, and other products to stock her store and to have stock to sell to her customers.

She lives in her own house, which is located in the Las Lomas zone in the city of La Paz.  She is single and has two children.

This is the first time she has had a loan with IMPRO.  The loan is being funded through Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sugar, noodles, and rice, etc. for her grocery store.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed, with 7 children.  Leonora has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages, and canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks. Leonora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Cristiana

texts.en:
Cristiana is 49 years old and has four dependents; all are attending school. She established a retail store in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, which is her place of residence. Her store has existed for over four years and constantly caters to community members' basic needs and other necessities for subsistence. She earns a total of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP)  a month.

Cristiana is a member of GDMPC, joining this year. This is her second time to borrow from the cooperative PHP 6,000. The money will be used to acquire additional goods to sell for a profit. As time goes on, Cristiana hopes to sustain store operations and expand her business range to improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To acquire additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa, de 38 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a pareja y sus 03 queridos hijos y por ellos trabaja muy duro para sacarlos adelante. En su querido pueblo de Santa Rosa, Luisa ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida, desde muy niña aprendió la actividad familiar que es la agrícola, hoy trabaja en sus propias tierras al lado de su amado pareja donde viene cultivando plantas de cacao y café, frutos que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a los miembros de su familia. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de San Francisco y Santa Rosa, lugar donde percibe mejores precios por cada uno de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero. Lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los carros de carga son muy escasos por esta parte de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP y espera de un pequeño préstamo para poder cumplir sus objetivos y por lo cual esta dispuesto en cumplir con el pago respectivo. Con los 3, 000 nuevos soles solicitados, adquirirá abonos y fertilizantes naturales para mejorar sus plantas y así sacar buen provecho en cuanto a sus frutos.
texts.en:
Luisa, 38, is a happy and hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house together with her partner and her three beloved children, for whom she works very hard to get them ahead.

Luisa has spent most of her life in her beloved town of Santa Rosa.  From a very young age she learned farming, the family business.  Today she works her own land alongside her beloved partner, who grows cacao and coffee, crops that have provided the income necessary to support his family.  She sells everything she harvests in the distribution centers located in the cities of San Francisco and Santa Rosa, where she receives better prices for all her crops.

What Luisa likes best about her work is planting her land, and she does it with painstaking care.  She has been doing this work for 12 years and she considers that the hardest part is transporting her crops, since cargo vehicles are scarce in this part of the jungle area of the Apurimac River Valley.  In time, she wants to buy more land, to increase production.

This will be Luisa's second loan with MFP.  She hopes to be able to achieve her goals with a small loan, for which she is prepared to make the respective repayment.  With the 3000 PEN requested she will acquire manure and natural fertilizers to improve her plants and so take good advantage of the crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Ummoja

texts.en:
Ummoja is a single woman who lives at a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the extended family.

For the past three years, she has operated a restaurant business, operating from the market, whereby town dwellers and neighbours are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of competition. Her major dream is to expand her restaurant business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, rice, and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, rice, and maize flour.

loans.name: Sandra Johana

texts.es:
Doña Sandra esta contenta por que pronto se podra pasar  a su casa nueva de concreto, ella sigue con su negocio de venta de fritanga, nacatamales, asi como, ahora cuida a dos niño en medio tiempo lo que le genera mejores entradas economicas.
Ahora con los prestamo que Afodenic ha dado en dos ciclos lleva mas rapido el proceso de  la construccion, con el credito anterior logro terminar paredes de enfrente, ya que tenia terminado todo el cajon, el cual junto a su esposo con ahorros habian comenzado la construccion.
Con este nuevo prestamo pondra todo el techo en donde comprara perlines, laminas de zinc, golosos, soldadura, ya que solo el techo y las puerta hace falta. Y que pronto espera estar gozando con su familia de una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
