Sandra is happy because she’s going to be able to move into her new concrete house soon.  She’s still working selling fried fast food snacks and nacatamales but has started to care for children half days which is an extra source of income.

With the loans that Afodenic has provided in the last two cycles she’s been able to do the house construction faster.  With the previous loan she managed to finish building the front walls since she’d finished the entire framework which her husband had started to build with savings they had.

With this new loan she’ll be able to install the roof.  She will buy purlins, metal sheeting, screws and solder since all they have left to do is install the roof and door.  She hopes to soon be enjoying a better dwelling with her family.

loans.use: to roof her house.

loans.name: Byron Salomon

texts.es:
En el departamento de Estelí, en una comunidad llamada San Rafael, habita Byron, de 30 años de edad, casado, agricultor, su nivel escolar es básico solo curso hasta sexto grado de primaria. El se dedica a sembrar café. Su padre fue el que le enseño a sembrar, preparar la tierra conforme fue pasando el tiempo, su padre le dio 2 manzanas de tierra para que sembrara , las cuales ha venido trabajando desde hace 4 años , tiene un año que se ha dedicado a sembrar café, pues antes sembraba hortaliza y granos básicos. Además el puso una pequeña pulpería la cual es atendida por su esposa, ambos trabajan y se apoyan mutuamente. 
El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abono y pago de mano de obra para sembrar café. Con esta inversión podrá sacar adelante su siembra de café orgánico, ayudarse con los costos que este le genera. El desea lograr establecer una manzana más de siembra de café, exportarlo fuera de Nicaragua e invertir en su pulpería para salir adelante y lograr mejorar su hogar.
texts.en: 30-year-old Byron lives in Estelí department, in a community called San Rafael. He is married and works as a farmer. He has a basic level of education as he only studied up to the sixth year of elementary school. Byron grows coffee. It was his father who taught him how to sow and prepare the soil. Over time, his father gave him two manzanas of land (one manzana = 1.68 acres) on which to grow his crops. He has been working this land for four years now. He has been growing coffee for one year as he previously grew vegetables and basic grains. In addition, he has also set up a small grocery store which his wife looks after. They both work and support each other. Byron is requesting this loan to buy supplies, fertilizers and manure, and to pay laborers to sow his coffee. With this investment, he will be able to start sowing his organic coffee and help cover the costs that this generates. Byron would like to be able to sow an additional manzana of coffee which he would like to export outside of Nicaragua. He would also like to invest in his grocery store so that he can get ahead and manage to improve his home.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers and manure, and to pay laborers to sow his coffee

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 53 years old and married with 9 children. With 4 children in school, Merlie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari sari store.

Merlie has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, spices, canned goods, etc. In the future Merlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
Desde hace 15 años Maria Ester se dedica a la confección directa junto a su esposo e hija trabaja día a día con la ilusión de sacar su negocio adelante y responder por los pedidos que sus clientes le hacen, su principal labor es la confección de uniformes y delantales para restaurantes y peluquerías, a sus 54 años de edad sueña con ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia, y mejorar los ingresos del hogar.

Con la motivación de cumplir sus sueños, hoy Maria Ester solicita un préstamo, el cual invertirá en compra de materia prima para la confección al por mayor, como: Hilos, telas y otros insumos básicos para realizar las prendas con la mayor calidad posible, pues así las utilidades serán mayores y su calidad de vida se verá altamente beneficiada.
texts.en:
For 15 years, Maria Ester has been sewing garments direct.  Together with her husband and daughter, she works every day with the hope of making progress in her business and filling the orders that her customers place with her.  Her main task is making uniforms and aprons for restaurants and hairdressing salons.  At 54 years of age, Maria Ester dreams of offering her family a better future and improving her household income.

With the motivation of achieving her dreams, Maria Ester is requesting a loan which she will invest in buying raw materials for sewing items to sell wholesale, such as threads, fabric and other basic supplies which she uses to make garments of the best possible quality.  This will increase her profits and her quality of life will be greatly benefited.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making garments (threads, fabric, etc.)

loans.name: Por

texts.en:
Mrs. Por is a 40-year-old married woman who has been residing in the Baray district of Kompong Cham province. She is a loving mother of four children, all of whom are attending the local public school.
 
Mrs. Por earns a living by raising some piglets in the back yard of her house, and generates approximately $2.00 a day. This income is barely enough to cover daily costs. 

Anyway, she also gets an income from her husband, who transports firewood for sale through the commune and local markets. Mrs. Por would like to ask for some funds from Kiva through HKL to purchase a buffalo that can be used to haul a firewood trailer.
 
With the profits she and her husband earn, they will be able to save so they can rebuild their wooden house with a tiled roof.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo that can be used to haul a firewood trailer.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Teresa es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora se dedica  a la venta de ropa, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Teresa requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa como por ejemplo pantalones y blusas. 

Teresa agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Resourceful Women), a Communal Bank whose members meet every thirty days in the town of Cusco.

Teresa is a resourceful and hardworking mother who engages in selling clothes. She owns a small stand in one of the most popular markets in Cusco. She has been engages in this activity for a few years already, and things are going very well for her thanks to the dedication she works with.

In this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy clothes such as trousers and blouses.

Teresa is thankful for and gives great value to the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her monthly dues.

loans.use: To buy items of clothing such as trousers or blouses.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past ten years, Christine has operated a photocopy machine business and she also sells stationery from a shop to her neighbors. Her major business challenge is seasonality in her place of operation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Christine is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase stationery for her shop. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer’s demand.

loans.use: to purchase stationery for her shop

loans.name: Pok

texts.en: Pok, 44, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Pok and her husband sell palm sugar and palm products. Pok is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase more palm sugar to resell at the market. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, Pok would like to use any additional income to purchase a plot of farmland and raise livestock. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy palm sugar and palm products to resell

loans.name: Mori

texts.en:
Mori is a 40-year-old, married woman with four children, two of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Mori is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Losambo Plus Group

texts.en:
Losambo Plus is a group of 28 owners of small businesses chaired by Antho. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI (Micro-Finance Institution) HOPE DRC to grow their businesses.

Antho is determined to be a successful businesswoman. She operates a general store. She became a microentrepreneur in 2001. She already received  two loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory. She will buy items for resale in order to reinforce her working capital and increase the profit. She will seek to make more profit by stocking more goods preferred by her customers. 

Antho's business brings in a profit of US$ 480 per month. Antho is 51 years old, unmarried, and the mother of three children whose ages range between 16 and 23. One of them attends school. She is also taking care of her grandchild.

loans.use: to purchase items for resale in her store.

loans.name: Djibrirou

texts.fr:
Djibrirou est un cultivateur âgé de 53 ans, il est établi dans le village de kassack nord, il a commencé à exercer cette activité de culture rizière depuis son enfance accompagné de ses parents, avec ce crédit, il va acheter du semence de riz de la variété sahel 108, de l'engrais, de l'herbicide et du carburant.

Il a comme perspective d'avenir d'augmenter le montant de crédit octroyé ceci va lui permettre d'accroître la surface de terre cultivable et d'avoir en fin de récolte un rendement abondant, il a aussi comme projet de lutter pour une autosuffisance en riz dans son village et dans le pays.

loans.use: Achat de semence de riz(variété sahel 108), d'engrais, d'herbicide et de carburant

loans.name: Lady Pamela

texts.es:
Lady Pamela con 41 años de edad, de estado civil separada, vive en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como lo son gallinas, patos, pavos y cuyes, con más de 03 años de experiencia en el negocio,su negocio está ubicado en su mismo en su mismo domicilio. Solicita el crédito para la compra de más aves de corral y alimentos para estos, de esta manera diversificar su negocio. De esta manera obtendrá mayores ventas y mayores ganancias.

Lady Pamela es socio recurrente para Epyme Alternativa, con un crédito anterior de S/.1000 el cuál lo canceló de manera puntual.

loans.use: para la compra de más aves de corral y alimentos para estos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Leah would like to invest in shares on the stock market.

loans.name: Bibi Hawa

texts.en:
Bibi Hawa weaves carpets with her 3 children in her house. She learned the trade during the war when she was in her village - at that time everybody weaved carpets. She learned from one of her neighbours and then she taught her children.

Bibi Hawa is an uneducated women but she prefers her children to study and go school. She took a loan with the help of a loan officer and then boughtlots of materials for her business.

She works 7 days of the week to complete one carpet in a month, then her husband sells it in the market. Through this process she can make a good income.

loans.use: Buying thread

loans.name: Bih Regina

texts.en:
Regina was born in 1949. She is married to a polygamist and she has eight children. She has been taking and repaying GHAPE loans but the greatest challenge she has faced was the fact that she spent her fifth Empowerment Credit at the hospital when she was sick and had to work so hard after she left the hospital to pay it back. The most painful incident in her life is when she lost her daughter and had to go through a very hard time trying to bring up her deceased daughter’s child who was still a little baby when her daughter died. She also lost another child and five of her sisters in a space of two years, leaving her with more than enough stress to bear.

She knows that her business will be a success because she has been doing this business for a long time alongside other business like renting out her house to tenants, poultry farming, selling wood, etc, and this has been a great success. This is beneficial to her community in that she provides cooked food to her neighbourhood everyday. At times when there is a funeral, she is paid to provide food for the programme. She also provides housing to others and wood which is the principal fuel of her community to her neighbours. First loan repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Regina would like to buy supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is married with two daughters. She sells women’s clothing in the central market of Melitopol. Marina has been in this trade for 13 years. She has been a client with Nadiya Ukraine for the past four years, maintaining a perfect credit history. Currently, she has about $1000 in inventory. Her gross monthly income is about $600 and her net profit is about $300. Marina is very diligent, communicative and charming. 

Marina is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase inventory for the upcoming fall season. She believes that financial assistance will help her increase the variety of clothing items she offers, and allow her to make additional profits to improve her family’s standard of living. Marina hopes that the uniqueness of her merchandise – she sells Hungarian linen clothing – will guarantee successful sales and good profits.

loans.use: Purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Blasa

texts.es:
Blasa describes herself as a hard-working, enterprising and happy married mother of three. Her husband is a laborer. She decided to start a sowing business to help him with household expenses, since she wanted her children to get an education and that wasn't possible on her husband's salary alone. She started out helping a woman who ran a tailoring shop, and after she learned the trade she was offered a job. As time went on, the owner passed away, and Blasa always remembered how the owner had encouraged her to start her own business. So that's what she did, installing a small shop in her home. It has gone very well since then, and she has been able to grow the business.

Blasa is requesting a loan of $550, which she will use to purchase materials so she can fulfill her customers' requests. The end of the year is fast approaching, and that is when demand is at its highest. She plans to repay the loan within five months. Blasa and her family are very grateful for your support in helping grow this business and move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Blasa es una mujer casada y su esposo trabaja como obrero, ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora, alegre y emprendedora, tiene 3 hijos y decidió poner su negocio de costurera para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ya que quería que sus tres hijos tuvieran educación y con el sueldo de su esposo eso no se podía, ella empezó ayudándole a una señora que tenía un taller de costura y cuando terminó sus estudios de corte y confección le ofrecieron trabajo en ese taller, al pasar el tiempo la señora que la contrató falleció y siempre recuerda que esa señora la alentaba a que ponga su propio negocio y eso hizo, instalando su pequeño taller en su casa y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien y a podido crecer con su negocio.

Blasa solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 550 para comprar materia prima con la cual pueda realizar sus trabajos que le solicitan sus clientes sobre todo en esta época que se acerca fin de año y mucha gente demanda a hacer ropa, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella y su familia están muy agradecidos por tu apoyo a que pueda continuar con su negocio y salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase dressmaking materials

loans.name: Thi Muoi

texts.vi:
Ms Mười is 31 years old. She has a kiosk at the local market selling clothes. She has 2 school aged children. Her husband works as a carpenter. She applies for a loan to buy more clothes, Everyday she's at her kiosk from the morning until night. To pay back the loan in small installments makes it easier for her. She wishes to be able to qualify for bigger loan in the next round so that she'll be able to expand and to offer more cloth selection.

Translated by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Mười 31 tuổi, chị bán quần áo ở chợ gần nhà. Chị có 2 con đang học cấp 2. Chồng chị làm thợ mộc, chị vay vốn để mua thêm hàng bán. Hàng ngày chị chủ yếu ở chợ tới tối mới về nhà. Vay vốn trả góp giúp chị có điều kiện tiết kiệm tốt hơn. Chị mong đợi được vay nhiều hơn để mở cửa hàng to hơn bán nhiều loại hơn.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sales

loans.name: Yean

texts.en: Mrs. Yean S., age 26, is a housewife. Her husband is employed at a private company, earning around $3 each day. They have one small child. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation and to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation and to repair her house.

loans.name: Kitooro 2 (D) Group

texts.en:
Prossy (group leader) is 33 years old and divorced with four children. She has a retail shop. The group has been together for ten months. Joyce sells used clothes, Christine sells shoes and Sarah sells new clothes. Prossy wants to use the extra business profits to pay shcool fees for the children and begin a poultry business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more goods or products for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in supplies.

loans.name: Cesilia's Tusongembele Group

texts.en:
Cesilia is a 30 year-old married woman with 3 children, ages 10, 9 and 2. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 70 and 50. Cesilia sells clothes, a business that she started in 2000. She works everyday from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan of $875 to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling cloth, food, and operating a café.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Luisa Ivania

texts.es:
Luisa E. is a bread maker. She has her own bakery in her house in the municipality of San Rafael in the city of Managua. With experience has come success in this business. She’s been able to succeed by diversifying her products. She makes white bread, sweet bread, buns and pastries.

Luisa E.’s immediate need is to acquire basic ingredients to continue baking bread. This is why she’s looking for support from Ceprodel, to obtain credit that will allow her to buy the ingredients she needs and continue her bakery business at home.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer,

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Luisa E. es a la elaboración de pan teniendo su propia panadería en su casa de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael en Managua. Con mucha experiencia en este negocio, ha logrado salir adelante diversificando sus productos tales como pan simple, pan dulce, picos, reposterías y bolillos.

La necesidad atravesada por la dama Luisa Espìnoza es la inmediata urgencia de adquirir la materia prima para llevar a cabo la elaboración del pan. Es por esto que busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir el pan y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio que atiende en su casa de habitación.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Sreyrath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyrath I. and her husband were married in 1993 and have three children, one son and two daughters. All of her children are in school. Her husband has been a mason since 1993. Now he is working in Phnom Penh City. The family lives on an Island in the  Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sreyrath has been a weaver since she was fifteen years old. It’s skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who sells them in Phnom Penh. 

She is requesting a loan of US$200 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Iliana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Iliana started her jewelry sales business 5 years ago. With her husband's help, she was able to save a small capital to work with, and the number of her customers has increased because of her hard work. She contributes to the education expenses of their two children, a 17- and an 11- year- old.

She requests a loan of $250 to be paid back in 3 months to purchase wholesale jewelry and offer better prices to her customers. With your help, Ileana and her business will shine.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva translator

Iliana incio su negocio hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de joyeria con ayuda de su marido logro juntar un pequeño capital para trabajar y ha visto incrementar su numero de clientes en base a su esfuerzo, ella contribuye con los gastos de educacion de sus 2 hijos de 17 y 11 años.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $ 250 que pagara en 3 meses para la compra de piezas de oro por lote y asi mejorar los precios a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Iliana podra salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is 45 years old and at present lives in her own home, which is located to the north, with her husband of 48 years old who works part-time in a sugar refinery, and their two children of 22 and 12 years old respectively. Martha has a beauty salon in her own home. She developed this business some years ago and has a lot of experience. They also recieve daily rent from a vehicle which is used as a taxi on interprovincial routes. In both activities the competition is average, but what allows them to continue is the number of years they have had both businesses. Their loan request is to purchase items for the beauty salon, to a total price of US$1000. Martha has a good credit record and currently has debts with two financial entities.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Martha cuenta con 45 años de edad y actualmente vive en su casa que es propia y que está ubicada al Norte, en esta cas vive junto a su esposo de 48 años de edad quién trabaja medio tiempo en un ingenio azucarero, Sus do hijos tienen 22 y 12 años de edad respectivamente. Martha tiene un salón de belleza que está instalado en su propio domicilio, desarrolla esta actividad desde hace varios años atrás por lo que tiene muchas experiencia. También reciben una renta diaria de un vehículo que trabaja como taxi en rutas interprovinciales. En ambas actividades la competencia es media, pero lo que les permite seguir adelante es la antiguedad de ambos en sus negocios. La presente solicitud es para la compra de artículos para el salón de belleza, el precio total aproximado de estos equipos es de $us. 1,000.-. Martha tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios y actualmente tiene deudas con dos entidades financieras.

loans.use: Purchase of salon equipment

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Entente Est Bonne) Group

texts.fr:
The 10 women of the Benkadi group are all married and have an average age of 38 with on average 5 children. They live in big traditional extended families with their parents-in-law, their husbands, brothers and sisters, children, and generally with co-spouses, in the Dandila district of the village of Mèfa (Ségou Region, Republic of Mali). United by societal and professional ties (helped along by activities sponsored by the NGO, Foundation for International Development Africa) for some ten years, they are essentially involved in selling cereals, firewood, condiments, and various items found in shops.

In order to remediate their lack of financial resources, these women decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso, from whom they are presently requesting their first loan.

They intend to use this loan to buy 12 sacks of unshelled peanuts, 4 sacks of millet, 32 wagonloads of firewood, a large quantity of condiments, and various items found in shops. They do their purchasing of firewood where they live or in neighboring villages (Zenguela, Farabougou et Gachi); they buy their cereals in Douga, Siguila, and Dialabougou, and they purchase their condiments and diverse items in the regional capital, Ségou.

The products are sold for cash door-to-door in Ségou, retail for cash or credit in the fairs of the surrounding villages, and out of their own homes. Their clientele is mostly female.

They expect to earn a monthly average profit of 16,000 FCFA which will be used essentially to make payments on the loan, to add to their business capital, and to cover family living expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Les 10 femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec les beaux parents, leurs maris, les frères et sœurs les enfants et généralement des coépouses dans le quartier Dandila du village de Mèfa. (Région de Ségou République du Mali) Unies par des relations d’ordre sociale et professionnelle (les activités de l’ONG FIDA aidant) depuis une dizaine d’année, elles exercent essentiellement le commerce de graines de céréales, de bois de chauffe, de condiments alimentaires et d’articles divers de boutiques.

Afin de pallier l’insuffisance des ressources financières ces femmes ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elles sont à leur premier prêt.

Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 12 sacs d’arachide non décortiqué, 4 sacs de mil, 32 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, une grande quantité de condiments et d’articles divers de boutique. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place ou dans les villages voisins (Zenguela, Farabougou et Gachi) en bois de chauffe; en céréales (Douga, Siguila, Dialabougou) et Ségou la capitale régionale pour les condiments alimentaires et les articles divers.

Les produits sont vendus au comptant en ambulant à Ségou, en détail et à crédit également au comptant dans les foires des villages environnants ou sur place à domicile. La clientèle est majoritairement féminine.

Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 16.000 FCFA.qui servira essentiellement à payer les intérêts du prêt, augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et subvenir aux dépenses familiales.

loans.use:
Purchase of firewood, cereals, and various other consumables for re-sale

Achat de bois de chauffe, de céréales, et d’articles divers de consommations

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Ibrahima N. est né le 18 janvier 1956 à Bambey. il s'active dans le métier de la photographie depuis cinq ans. il veut acquérir un nouveau appareil avec ce pret.
texts.en:
Ibrahima N. was born on January 18, 1956 in Bambey. He has been working as a photographer for 5 years. He wants to acquire a new camera with this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of photographic materials

loans.name: Nadira

texts.en:
Nadira A. was born in 1961. She is married and lives together with her husband in Kalo ević, a village near Te anj. Nadira`s husband works outside of Bosnia and Nadira sells clothes and other textiles at the marketplace.

Nadira has been a good client of WWI for a long time, and this will be her fourth loan through WWI to develop her textile business. She wants to be ready for the coming winter season and she needs a loan in amount of 1500 KM to buy clothes for re-selling. Nadira hopes to extend her business just little more.

loans.use: To buy clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Mrs. Nem K., 66, and her husband, Mr. Pann Mean, 67, live in a small village located about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Married in 1971, they have three sons and three daughters. One of her daughter's is a silk weaver, two of her sons are studying in a local school, and one son works as a fisherman. 

Mrs. Nem has been selling fish for ten years, while her husband has worked as a horse-car driver for five years. He has also been plowing farmland to earn extra income for over ten years. Mrs. Nem is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a horse for her son's horse-car driving business and to purchase silk materials for her daughter's weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and silk materials

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela tiene 49 años, está casada y tiene tres hijos, quienes siguen viviendo en su casa. Durante su niñez apoyaba a sus padres en su chacra, cuando se casó, junto a su esposo sembraban plátanos en las dos hectáreas de tierra que tenían, la que hasta ahora les produce, pero hace cinco años decidió abrir una bodeguita denominad “Bodega Mechi”, y ella le gusta el comercio y hace con agrado, hace un año incrementó sus ventas, adicionando carnes rojas y de pollo, este rubro le resulta más rentable, asimismo la venta de cerveza le es mucho más rentable. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP. Tiene planeado comprar una vitrina para exhibir mejor sus productos.
texts.en:
Marcela is 49 years old, married, with three children who live at home. During her childhood she helped her parents on their farm and when she married, she and her husband planted bananas on their two hectares of land. This was their livelihood until five years ago when they decided to open a small grocery store called "Bodega Mechi". Marcela likes the store and works there happily. A year ago they increased their sales by adding chicken and red meat, which made their business much more profitable, as did the decision to sell beer. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. She plans to buy a display case to better show her products.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a display case for her shop

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Mrs. Pech R. is a 33-year-old and lives in Roka village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Choeun Chea, are grocers who own a small store in their house where they sell grocery products. Since their business is going well, they want to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries for her inventory. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan. She has four children who are attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries  for her inventory

loans.name: Moisei

texts.en:
Moisei G. lives in Floritoaea Veche village, Ungheni district. Ms. G. is a person with serious intent, punctual and responsible, calculated. She is married and has a good reputation. She works as a deputy on the instructive process in a gymnasium. She has been working since September 1990. 

According to salary certificates, Ms. G. receives an average monthly salary  of 2460 lei. Ms. G. has received a loan in the amount of 5000 to purchase pigs. Our client's plan is to raise pigs in order to sell pork at the central market.In her business she is helped by her husband. The purpose of the loan is to increase the number of pigs.

loans.use: to increase the number of pigs she raises

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Evaline has been a clothes seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 175. Every day she works at her business from 7am to 6pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Evaline is 31 years old, married, and has four children: ages 19, 17, 6, and 3. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Christina, Stellah, Prisca, and Mary. Each woman has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika S., 21, is single with no children. She has only begun her business of planting, harvesting, and selling  bananas and taro. She sells to the villagers and general public two days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).

She has never borrowed from SPBD before. SPBD loans are Veronika’s only access to capital because she can't qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She really needs this loan to help her focus on the business, so she can provide financial support to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for planting

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov S. is 36 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City, in Cambodia. She is a worker in the garment industry, getting a salary of $80 a month. (S. was not available for photographing, so her husband is in the photo instead.)

She currently is responsible for two children who are still young who attend primary school. To help support the family's foods needs, her husband works as a local barber. To reduce the cost of transportation, Pov is requesting a $1000 loan to purchase a motorcycle so she can use it to ride to work and for family needs.

loans.use: Purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en: Leilani K., age twenty-four, is married with one child.  She has three years of experience in the taxi business. She sells to the general public for seven days per week. She has one previous loan with SPBD, a Kiva field partner.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $80.  SPBD loans are Leilani’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy new tires, seat covers and vehicle registration.

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoem C. is a farmer in Sophy village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land on which to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she earns a little income to support her family. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding and to reduce her cost of plowing.

Her husband, Mr. Yin Ry, is a construction worker. Mrs. Yoem C. is 45 years old and the mother of eight children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a laborer. Another two are enrolled in the local school and the remaining two are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding and to reduce her cost of plowing

loans.name: Meren

texts.en:
Meren C. is 58 years old and a resident of Barangay St. Teresa in Lallo, Cagayan province. She sells fruit and vegetables and is able to make PHP 300 average daily net income. Her husband served as Barangay (district) Captain in their village and used to help her in managing her fruits and vegetable vending business. They have children who are also helping her in buying volumes of vegetables and fruit since they no longer attend school.

They have only .3 hectares (.75 acres) of rice field where they get stock for their rice consumption. Meren is asking to borrow PHP 10,000 that will serve as additional working capital for her vending business. In this way, her vending will grow more for the future of her two children who were not able to continue studying to a higher level of education.

loans.use: To serve as additional working capital

loans.name: Trương Thị

texts.en:
H. Trương Thị (525030644) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has two school-aged children.

H. owns and operates a business raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 4,200,000 VND a month.

In 2002, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 6th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación 2000”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 60 años D. edad, es viuda y es madre D. 05 hijos todos ya independientes,  y  no tiene estudios.  Vive en el Barrio Alasaya.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 6 años,  su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual invirtió en su negocio D. compra venta D. abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, que es la compra y venta D. abarrotes, con los cuales ella comprara, arroz, azúcar, leche, harina, fideos, etc.

Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando y D. alguna manera ayudar a sus nietos.
texts.en:
The señora Eusebia belongs to the communal bank 'Nueva Generación 2000', which is located in the key district, Provincia D. El Collao, Puno Department. She is 60 years old, is a widow and mother to 5 children, who are all independent, and she hasn't studied. She lives in the neighbourhood of Alasaya. She has worked with el Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 6 years. Her first loan was of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, which was invested in her business in the purchase of grocery items. Now she requires a loan of S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, to be able to invest in her business, which is the purchase and sale of groceries, of which she will buy rice, sugar, milk, flour, pasta etc. Her biggest dream is to continue working and in some way help her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk, flour, pasta

loans.name: Maria Apolonia

texts.es: María Apolonia B. Ríos tiene 62 años. Es madre soltera. Su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos. María se levanta muy temprano para conseguir la leche, ya que tiene un lugar que se la proporciona a un precio accesible así ofrecerlas a sus clientes. Por lo que ella vende sus productos en el mercado, María es una mujer con muchos problemas económicos, pero gracias a los sacrificios que ha realizado ha logrado salir adelante. El destino de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de sus productos como leche, cuajada, queso, crema. Su mayor deseo es extender su negocio para que el día de mañana sus hijos logre salir adelante.
texts.en:
María Apolonia B. Ríos is 62 years old. She is a single mother. She runs a business in the sale of dairy products. Maria gets up very early to acquire milk, given that she has a place that offers her milk at an affordable price, which allows her to offer it at a good price to her clients. Even though she sells her products in the market, Maria has many financial problems, however, thanks to the sacrifices that she has made she has been able to get ahead in life. The loan will be used as work capital to purchase products, such as milk, cheese curds, cheese, and cream. Her biggest wish is expand her business so that her children can someday succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase milk, cheese curds, cheese, and cream).

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
MRS. CORAZON PEGARIDOis 59 years old, married with 4 adult children and lives in Brgy. Dulao, Bago City, Negros Occidental.

According to Mrs. Corazon, having a family is not easy just like starting a business. This is why she was a bit apprehensive when friends encouraged her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003, but then she decided that it was about time she should have a hand in improving her family's standard of living.

With her first loan, Corazon started a small general store, and to her surprise she discovered that she had the talent for business and 3-months, her sari-sari(general) store generated a good income for her family. 

Now six years and several loans later, Corazon wants to again borrow PHP 12,000 which she needs to expand the product offerings in her store.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: MORE GOODS TO SELL IN HER GENERAL STORE

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells drinks, fried meat and pepper soup. She gets her drinks from the company vehicle, which goes 'round the town to supply those who buy in large quantity. Mary has been in these businesses for over eight years. Mary hopes for the loan amount of N120,000 to purchase drinks to sell. She is 50 years old and married with two children, with the increase in profit as a result of this loan my family will be better cared for. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase drinks to sell

loans.name: Khémesse

texts.fr: Khémesse N. est une veuve âgée de 62 ans, mère de 12 enfants. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt s’activer dans l’embauche ovine. Son objectif est de développer son activité pour mieux prendre en charge les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Khémesse N. is a 62 year old widow who is the mother of 12 children. With this loan she wishes to set up a sheep business. Her goal is to build up her business in order to better take charge of the family expenses.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise sheep

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam S., 37, works in a casino along the Vietnam and Cambodia borders. He is married and lives with his wife and three school-aged children. He typically makes about $6 per day and is his wife also helps support the family by selling porridge and noodle soup from their home in Phnom Penh. She earns around $24 in revenue per day. This couple would like to take out a loan of $1200 to reinvest in the porridge and noodle soup business.  Sam's wife is pictured here in front of the store.

loans.use: To invest in a porridge and noodle soup business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: effectuer le labour et acheter des fertilisants.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine P. is from Iligan City. She is 51 years old. Josephine is married and has 3 school-aged children. Josephine owns and operates a business selling home cleaning and other products to local community members. Josephine has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately PHP5,000 a month.

In 2009, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her business. Josephine is requesting a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional profits generated from the loan to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To increase stop inventory.

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en:
Amgalan E. is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Kharkhorin, the ancient capital of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Since 2000, E. has run a special order home furnishings carpentry business. In 2008, his wife began a canteen business close the the Erdenezuu monastery, a major tourist attraction in the city and a large gathering place for local Buddhists. The monastery canteen was successful so E. and his wife have decided to start another canteen at the local outdoor market in order to attract more customers. They are in the process of building a house near the local market so that they can be closer to their second business. E. says, “My dream is to build a warm, comfortable house for my family from my business profits.” He is requesting a loan of 500,000 tugrugs (approx. $338 USD) in order to complete the construction of their home near the market. XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To complete the construction of their home near the market

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Khoeun K. lives in the Prey Run village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a well builder. His wife, Mrs. Nob Naet (pictured here), is a pig breeder. Her pig-breeding business is going well, so she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food. Thus, Mr. Khoeun K. is asking for a loan for this purpose.

This couple has four children; three are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: Purchase more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en: Jocel D. is from the village of Caputol. She is 27 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Jocel owns and operates a motorcycle transport "habal-habal" business, providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jocel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jocel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Ream

texts.en:
Mrs. Ream C. is a villager in the Voat Svay village in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which to cultivate rice to earn a living. Aside from this, she is a duck breeder. Since the second business is going well, she wants to expand it. She decided to ask for a loan to buy duck food and 120 more ducks for breeding.

Mrs. Ream C. is a widow with three children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, another one is a duck breeder and the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy duck food and more ducks for breeding

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden B. is from the town of Quezon San Isidro. She is 27 years old. Eden is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Eden owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Eden joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eden has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eden is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Eden from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fish to re-sell

loans.name: Franco

texts.es:
Franco es un joven entusiasta y emprendedor de 25 años, y está casado con Reina de 25 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Sherlin de 6, Mayte de 3 y Briana de 1 año, esta familia vive en una casa alquilada.

Desde hace 5 años él se dedica a sembrar papa, arveja, habas, zanahoria y maíz, en terrenos arrendados y algunos heredados a su esposa. Lo que más le gusta de su labor es fumigar sus sembríos para evitar que sean invadidos por las plagas; por otro lado, le disgusta caminar largas horas para llegar a sus chacras porque no existe carretera.
Paralelamente aprendió el oficio de panadero, el cual ejerció estos dos últimos meses y al ver las buenas utilidades que recibe de ambas actividades planea en el futuro instalar una panadería, donde elaborará panes, pasteles y tortas, pero sin dejar de sembrar, ya que gracias a la agricultura su familia tiene estabilidad económica.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas ahorrando con anticipación, como se lo enseñaron los integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita pretende invertirlo en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico y semillas de arveja y papa.
texts.en:
Franco, 25, is an enthusiastic and enterprising young man. He is married to Reina, 25, and they have three children: Sherlin, 6, Mayte, 3, and Briana, 1; they live in a rented house. For the last 5 years he has farmed potatoes, peas, broad beans, carrots and corn on leased farmlands and on lands inherited by his wife. What he likes best about his work is fumigating his plantings to prevent them from being invaded by pests. On the other hand, what he dislikes is having to walk for long hours to reach his farmlands because there is no road. He also learned how to be a baker. He has baked for the last two months and, upon seeing the good profits he makes from both activities, he is planning to set up a bakery in the future to make bread and cakes. He won't stop farming, though, because it's thanks to farming that his family has economic stability. This is his 4th loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion, saving money in advance, like he was taught by his fellow communal bank members. The funds requested will be used to buy several sacks of organic manure as well as potato and pea seed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and seed.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane B. is from the village of Alimannao, Penablanca, Cagayan. She is 28 years old. Jane is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jane is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Jane works in a family member's business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Jane has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Jane is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Jane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly made up of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Las Serpentinas Group

texts.es: El banco LAS SERPENTINAS se conformo con 15 socias, las reuniones se llevan a cabo en el domicilio D. Lucy que es la presidenta del grupo, Las Serpentinas se reúnen a las 17:30 p.m. y tienen como norma D. que la asistencia es obligatoria. Lucy que es la más destacada del grupo se dedica a vender en una tienda, ella venD. en su tienda licor y algunos abarrotes desD. hace tres años atrás. El resto del grupo tienen como actividades la venta D. empanadas, venta D. hamburguesas, hay un comerciante, otros venden pan, también venden alimentos balanceados, uno ofrece servicios D. albañilería, otro venD. productos nutricionales, uno es taxista, otro vive D. la renta D. su vehículo, tres señoras se dedican a la venta D. verduras y por último también hay una señora que se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos. En cuanto a la competencia  si bien existe la misma también hay demanda ya que las actividades desarrolladas  les permiten obtener ingresos por los clientes fijos con los que algunos cuentan. Lucy destinó su crédito para abastecer más su tienda al igual que el resto del grupo que destinó el financiamiento para capital D. trabajo D. sus negocios. Las serpentinas cuentan con experiencia crediticia, además D. contar con la experiencia D. trabajo bajo el sistema comunal ya que varias participaron del mismo sistema en otras entidades financieras. Como se pueD. ver en la foto ninguno D. los varones estuvo en la primera reunión por lo que sus esposas tuvieron que representarlos a ellos más.
texts.en:
The “Las Serpentinas” communal bank was formed by 15 associates. Lucy is their president and the members meet at her home at 5:30 pm. Attendance is required. Lucy, who is the most prominent member, has a store where she’s been selling liquor and a few grocery items for the past three years. The rest of the members of the group do different things, such as selling “empanadas,” selling hamburgers, one is a businessman, others sell bread, and balanced food items, one member works as a mason, one drives a taxi, another lives from the rent he receives for his vehicle, three of the ladies sell vegetables, and one lady sells cosmetics. Even though there is competition, there is still a demand and their developed businesses allow them to earn incomes from regular customers, whom they count on. Lucy will use the money from this loan to stock her store, while the others will use it to proviD. working capital for their businesses. “Las Serpentinas” have prior experience with loans and with working under a communal banking system, as some of the members have worked with other communal banks. As the photograph shows, none of the men were at the first meeting so they were represented by their wives.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es natural de Urubamba,  tiene 54 años y tiene cuatro hijos de las cuales todavía depende de la socia,  ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

Claudia tiene una pequeña empresa de venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo cemento, arena, piedra y muchas cosas más, ella empieza su actividad de trabajo a las 6 de la mañana cuando preparara desayuno para sus hijos y para su esposo, ella después se va a trabajar al negocio. Ya son 6 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Claudia pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Su primer crédito de la socia fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar dos volquetes de hormigón. El anhelo de la socia es abrir una empresa familiar donde se alquilé maquinaria pesada y desearía empezar comprando una palanca mecánica.   
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Claudia is a native of Urubamba. She is 54 years old and has four children who still depend on her. She is a responsible mother who works hard and is always looking for opportunities to get ahead and to build a better future for her children. Claudia has a small business selling construction materials including cement, sand, rock and much more. She starts working at 6 in the morning, when she prepares breakfast for her children and husband. Afterward, she goes to her place of business. She has already spent six years in this line of work and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts forth in her job. Claudia is a member of the Third Millinneum communal bank, part of the Arariwa Association. Her first loan as a member was for $100, which she invested in her business. She requires the current loan in order to buy two cement trucks. Her dream is to open a family business of heavy machinery rentals, and she would also like to purchase a mechanical lift. She is grateful for the opportunity offered to her by Kiva partner Third Millinneum communal bank, and she promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two cement trucks.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing engages in a rechargeable cellphone cards business and also sells drinks. With these businesses she makes her living in Benin City, Nigeria.

Blessing wants to stock her store with more rechargeable phone cards to attract more customers and improve on her sales. She is requesting a loan of NGN 40,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards and drinks to sell as this will go a long way towards increasing her income.

Blessing is 28 years old and is married with two children, 4 and 7 years old. She appreciate all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable cellphone cards and drinks to sell

loans.name: Wilson Kiptarbei

texts.en:
Wilson Kiptarbei L. is a gentleman who is 29 years-old. He is married to Clara L. and together they have been blessed with three beautiful children who are all in primary school. 

Wilson is a maize farmer and he has been farming for 12 years now. His farm is in an area called Sinonin where he also lives with his family.  He normally practices cash crop farming where he sells maize to his neighbors after harvesting.

Wilson came to know about Kiva partner KADET through another existing client and this will be his first loan through KADET. He is planning to use the entire loan for farm inputs.  He will buy two bags of maize seedlings worth 4,000, plough with 8,000 shillings and plant with the rest of the money. 

His dream is to become a better farmer, expand his farm and increase his production.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a motor for one of his station wagons

loans.name: Kaliba Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
38-year-old M. Solomy is a married woman with three children. For the last seven years she has been plying her business selling new clothes in Lugazi town. With it, she has been able to provide for all her children.

Solomy’s future prospects, too, are not looking bad given the 300,000 shillings she makes in a week. By implication, she has enough financial clout to ensure her business’s longevity. With this loan, she wants to make purchases of new clothes that she will sell to her increasing clientele.

Solomy is a business lady, indeed! She started her business from the little savings she had made as a housewife but, due to her determination and hard work, she is where she is now.

loans.use: The purchase more new clothes to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y actualmente no tiene hijos dependientes, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Illimo, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de flores en el cementerio de Illimo desde hace mas de diez años. Ella ofrece sus flores en el exterior del camposanto y los principales clientes son aquellas personas que llegan a visitar a sus familiares difuntos. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida y los ingresos que percibe le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Juanita desea adquirir mas flores para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias, para lograr su meta ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer alegre y entregada a su trabajo, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para sentirse activa. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una mujer responsable y amable.
texts.en:
Juanita is 55 years old, married and currently does not have any dependent children. She lives with her husband in Illimo district, an agricultural district in Lambayeque province, an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling flowers in the Illimo cemetery for over ten years. She sells her flowers outside the graveyard and her main customers are people that come to visit their late family members. The business has been well-received and the income that she earns serves to help her husband with the family’s expenses. Juanita wishes to acquire more flowers in order to increase her sales and profits. In order to achieve her goal, she has solicited a credit of 2000 Peruvian nuevos soles (PEN). She is a cheerful and hard-working woman whose greatest wish is to continue working in order to feel active. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her a responsible and friendly woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flowers to expand her sales business

loans.name: Bayardulam

texts.en:
Bayardulam B. is 43 years old and lives with her two daughters in Uvs province, western Mongolia. She and her family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Bayardulam operates a transport service in her town. She uses a car  to transport people back and forth around her town. 

Bayardulam started her transportation business in 2008 after purchasing her car. She has found success with her business and has gained much experience as a driver over the years. 

Bayardulam is a very honest and hard-working person. For the future she hopes to continue to provide a high-quality, convenient and efficient transportation service.  She is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase new parts for her car in order to increase her earnings so she will be able to afford her daughters' tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en: Ilhomjon U. is a young clothing merchant from Istaravshan, Tajikistan. He started his small business when he was in his late teens and gradually, though much hard work, he has been able to develop it into quite a successful enterprise. Ilhomjon has the qualities it takes to succeed as an entrepreneur. Goal-oriented, hard-working and punctual, he is a natural businessman. Funding from IMON International has been instrumental in helping Ilhomjon build his business. His first loan was for $1,500 and since that time, he has benefited from one additional loan while establishing a great credit history. He has requested a loan of $2,000 to add to his available working capital. The ability to purchase large quantities of inventory in bulk saves time and expense for merchants such as Ilhomjon. He appreciates the availability of funding through IMON International. It allows him to take advantage of good opportunities and focus on growing his business so that he is able to adequately provide for himself and his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a being key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for selling

loans.name: Takku Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKKU LIG. est créé le depuis 6 mois. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues du même quartier. Et appartenant au même Banc Villageois SANTHIABA COKI2.

Madame Penda G. debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, emmitouflée d’un voile rose est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est divorcée et vit avec ses trois enfants

Elle fait de l’embouche ovine, de l’aviculture, la vente de crèmes glacées et la vente de glaces.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter un mouton, des poulets à élever et payer les factures d’électricité pour la fabrique de crèmes glacées et de glaces.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa progéniture, par exemple la nourriture, la santé et l’habillement. Elle mène cette activité pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The solidarity group TAKKU LIG. was established six months ago. It is composed of eleven women from the same district. The women belong to the same Banc Villageois of SANTHIABA COKI2. Ms. Penda G. is the group's leader (standing at the far right in the photo and snug in her pink headscarf). She is 55 years old, divorced, and living with her three children. She fattens livestock, raises poultry, and sells ice cream and ice. With her new loan, Penda is going to buy a sheep and some chickens to raise and is also going to pay the electricity bills for the making of ice cream and ice. Penda's goal is to provide for her children, for example, in terms of food, health care, and clothing. She runs her business in order to be able to support herself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a sheep and some chickens and covering the cost of electricity

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El Señor Miguel vive en casa familiar como cuidador de un colegio es soltero no tiene mucha familia, y quiere superarse empezar desde cero es por ese motivo que  empezó desde pequeño como constructor con su papa y le gusto ahora, el trabaja solo porque aprendio mucho gracias a su papa , el también se dedica a la venta de rellenos con su tía son como socios y es por eso que saco el crédito para comprar harina por quintales y también para comprar pintura y  rodillos y otros para la construcciones, el  señor se fue agradecido por la oportunidad  con el crédito, .es nuevo con la institución y con el crédito kiva.
texts.en:
Miguel is single and doesn’t have much family. He lives in a hostel and is employed as a watchman at a school. He wants to improve himself starting from zero. This is the reason he started from a very young age to work as a builder with his father and he liked it. Now he works by himself having learned a lot working for his father. He’s also kind of a partner with his aunt in a rellenos (consist of a layer of mashed potates surrounding a mixture of meat and vegetables beef or chicken with onions, peppers, tomato, etc. which is then dipped in a batter and deep fried) business and that’s why he requested the loan to buy flour by the quintal (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilograms). He will also buy paint and paint rollers and other construction supplies. He was grateful for the opportunity with the loan. He is new to the Institution and to Kiva loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint, paint rollers and others at wholesale.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Qorimankacha”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonieta; ella tiene 28  años de edad y es  madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fotocopiadora, micas y anillados, ella tiene dos pequeños puestos dentro de la universidad San Antonio Abad, ella trabaja desde las 7.00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia quiere equipar su negocio . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para su fotocopiadora.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Antonieta is a member of the Communal Bank "Qorimankacha.” The bank is located in the District of Wanchaq, Province and Department of Cusco. Antonieta is 28 years old and a single mother of two children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business of offering services such as photocopying, making transparencies, and spiral binding of documents. She has two small posts in the San Antonio Abad University, where she works from 7 AM to 5 PM. She wants to better equip her business so she is requesting a loan to buy materials for her photocopier. She thanks those who are helping her fulfill her dream through this forum and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her photocopier

loans.name: Alpha

texts.fr: Monsieur alpha N. est un père de famille de 39 ans qui vit dans la localité de Bambilor. Cela fait 3 ans déjà qu’il exerce l’élevage de poussins et la culture de légumes (piments, aubergine, chou etc.).Ce qui l’a surtout motive a diversifier son activité  était le fait qu’il disposait d’un vaste champ inexploité. Il est membre de la caisse de  Bambilor depuis  avril 2010 .Il n’y a jamais contracté de prêt .Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000f qui sera utilisé pour l’achat d’intrants et la construction de deux bassins. Son souci est d’améliorer ses gains pour une meilleure prise en charge des besoins vitaux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Alpha N. is a 39-year-old father of a family living in the Bambilor area. For 3 years, he has raised chickens and farmed vegetables (peppers, eggplant, cabbage, etc.). What motivated him above all to diversify his business was the fact that he owns a vast field that is still unused. He has been a member of the Bambilor local fund since April 2010. He has not drawn any loans from them so far. He is seeking a loan of 200,000 F, which will be used to buy agricultural inputs and build two ponds. His concern is to increase his earnings in order to better take care of his family's essential needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investissement

loans.name: Thophillus

texts.en:
Thophillus is a 39-year-old man, married with seven children aged 15, 13, 11, 9, 7, 5, and 2 years old. He has two other dependents and lives in his own home. His family goal is to have well educated children. His home address is Masindi, Uganda.

He is in the retail shop business and has been in it for 2 years. He started with selling maize grains and later started the retail shop. He faces business challenges of high rent and competition. In future he expects his business to grow into a big retail shop. He wants the loan to enable him to buy cooking oil, soap, sugar, rice and other domestic items to sell in his shop.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, soap, sugar, rice and other domestic items for resale

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter is 28 years old. He is a member of Wazalendo group in Faulu, Kenya. He sells utensils, plastic containers, mattresses and metallic suitcases. He has been running the business for three years and has managed to employ three people. Walter also works on contract as a teacher. He hopes to expand his business and improve his standards of living. He has requested for a first loan of KES 50, 000. With the loan, he will add stock mattresses and metallic suitcases.

loans.use: To add stock mattresses and metallic suitcases.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James K., age 40, has a transport business and he owns a motorbike that he uses to transport his clients. He has been in this business for the past five years and has created a sizeable clientele. He and his wife, Milliecent Anchieng, have four daughters and two sons between the ages of four and 16 years old. The family lives in the town of Migori.

James wants to buy a new motorbike, the purchase of which will create an employment opportunity for one person, and he needs to do maintanance on the old motorbike. For these reasons, James has applied for a loan of Kshs 80,000 from KADET Ltd. This will be his second loan.
 
He aspires toward buying a Nissan minibus in the future to help grow his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike and to perform maintenace on an existing motorbike

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem Y., 50, is married and lives with her husband in Takeo province. Since 2008, she has been selling cakes, vegetables, and meat and is able to make about US$2.50 of profit each day. She uses the trailer attached to a motorbike to transport the food and sell around the village. Her husband works in construction, making US$2.50 a day as well. This couple has four children. Two are in school and the other two are working in construction. Hem Y. wants to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By buying a motorbike, her family can save more because they will not have to spend money on moto-taxis.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. lives in the Busega neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced and has 6 children, four of whom are now in school. Annet has a bar. She has been in this business for two months and she works 7 days a week. Annet sells her products in a retail shop.    

Annet has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more soda and beer.     

Annet's main business challenge is transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar. Annet lives in a home that she owns with electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more beer and soda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional capital for her newly opened sari-sari store

loans.name: Estuardo

texts.es:
Estuardo G. V. tiene 53 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 7 hijos (28, 27, 26, 25, 20, 13 y 12 años). El vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Estuardo es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.  

Estuardo se dedica a la producción de cacao y naranjas. El tiene este comercio desde hace 6 años. El compra y vende sus productos en Matilde Esther. El solicita este crédito para poder sembrar mas plantas de cacao y de naranja. El crédito le ayudara a mejorar sus tierras y cosechas.
