Lo que ha soñado toda su vida es tener más terrenos y un buen carro. La época de invierno es la temporada más difícil para Estuardo porque en ese momento no hay producción.

En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar volley y salir a las fiestas patronales.
texts.en:
Estuardo G. V. is 53 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and has 7 children aged 28, 27, 26, 25, 20, 13 and 12.  He lives in  Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

Estuardo is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new loan group is located in Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office, in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in a number of different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Estuardo farms cacao and oranges.  He has been in this business for 6 years.  He buys and sells his products in Matilde Esther.  Estuardo is requesting this loan so that he can sow more cacao and orange plants.  The loan will help him to improve his land and his harvests.  He has dreamed all his life of owning more land and a good car.  The winter season is the most difficult season for Estuardo as there is no production over the winter.  In his spare time, he likes to play volleyball and celebrate the fiestas of the local patron saint.

loans.use: To sow more cacao and orange plants

loans.name: Nematulloi

texts.ru: Неъматуллои Бухори проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 28 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей на рынке Мехргон. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает мужскую одежду. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Nematulloi B., 28, lives in Yavan with his wife and two children. He has secondary education. He makes a living by selling male clothes at the Mehrgon market where he rents a stall. Having been in this business for six years, Nematulloi is applying for a loan in order to increase the assortment of goods.

loans.use: to increase assortment

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah, 51, is a married mother of six children whose ages range between 17 and 37. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years and raises cows that produce milk which she sells locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to provide the basic needs of her family.

She has requested a loan of 31,200Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The profits from this loan will help her provide for the basic needs of her family. She plans to buy at least four dairy cows and a motorcycle to transport milk to the market in the near future. Her biggest challenge has been transporting her farm produce to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Felicita Del Socorro

texts.es: Felicita del Socorro de 50 años, tiene un negocio una pulpería, desde 11 años este negocio, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, pues sabe que los financiamientos han servido de gran aporte para su negocio. Sabe que tiene que levantarse temprano todos los días para iniciar su labor, ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que disfruta de su actividad económica. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y detergentes.
texts.en:
Felicita del Socorro is 50 years old and has a store that she has managed for eleven years. She has worked with Fundación León 2000 for a long time and the loans have been a great help to her business. Felicita knows that she must wake up early every day to begin her work. She is an enterprising woman who enjoys what she does for a living.

The loan she requested will be used to buy basic grains, candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy basic grains, candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Luz Elena S. M. de 34 años de edad, es una mujer muy responsable, la cual trabaja muy duro elaborando pupusas, las cuales son una comida típica de este país, que posee mucha demanda. Ella vive junto a su madre, con la cual reside en San Alejo, en el departamento de La Unión. Las pupusas son un platillo, el cual está elaborado de masa de maíz o arroz, y así mismo rellena de chicharrón, queso y frijoles. Con este negocio es como Luz logra salir adelante junto a su madre, es por ello que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para elaborar más pupusas, y de esta forma aumentar sus ganancias las cuales serán de mucho beneficio para su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Elena S. M. is 34 years old. She is a very responsible woman who works hard making pupusas, a traditional Salvadoran dish that is in great demand. Luz lives with her mother in San Alejo in the Department of La Unión. Pupusas are a dish made from cornmeal or rice and filled with pork, cheese, and beans.

This business has enabled Luz and her mother to move forward. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy a greater quantity of supplies for making more pupusas. In this manner, she hopes to increase her earnings since this will be of great benefit to her family.

loans.use: Purchase corn, cheese, beans, and pork for making "pupusas"

location.town: San Alejo, departamento de La Unión

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 23 year old single man. He has been selling second-hand clothes to earn his daily bread. He has become more focused in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya. He dreams of opening other branches for his business in the future.

He has been guaranteed a loan of 20,000 Kes by his group member in Faulu Kenya, and will use the loan to buy trousers, blouses and skirts to sell.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.en:
Mamurjon lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is married and has one child. He is a hardworking man and is engaged in selling fabrics. He has been in this business for nine years. Mamurjon purchases goods from Dubai and sells them in Dushanbe in his shop in the market of «Korvon».  His average income is 400 Somoni per a day.  

Marmurjon wants to expand his business.  That’s why he wishes to increase the assortment of his goods.  Mamurjon would like to get a loan of US$1100 to purchase new and good quality materials, which will attract more customers. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy new fabrics for his shop

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asuncion tiene 59  años de edad, y es casado. Tiene 2 hijos menores. Vive en casa propia en la zona rural del distrito de Tucume en la región del Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Cuenta con el servicio básico de agua solamente,  no de energía eléctrica. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 50 familias.

Se gana la vida desde hace 20  años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. El suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.  Desea usar su crédito para invertir en la compra de aves menores para engorde y alimento balanceado para sus animales. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Espera aumentar sus ingresos para poder seguir ofreciendo una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Asuncion is 59 years old and is married. He has 2 small children. He lives in his own home in the rural district of Tucume in the Lambayeque region in the north of Peru. The only home utility he receives is water - he does not have electrical supply. His community is small, with about 50 families living there. 
For 20 years, he has been earning a living raising and selling young animals in corrals located in the back part of his home. He typically raises pigs, sheep, turkeys, and ducks, and when they have reached a good point of development he offers them for sale to the middlemen who always visit the area where he lives. He learned this work from his parents, and he knows exactly how to do it. He wants to use the loan to buy some young birds to fatten-up and feed for his animals. For this reason, he has seen fit to request a loan of $725 from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). He hopes to increase his income to be able to offer a better quality of live to his family.

loans.use: to buy more baby birds to fatten and feed for his livestock

loans.name: Jabrayil

texts.en:
Jabrayil E. is 49 years old. He is married and has five children. Jabrayil is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from raising large livestock and their sale at the local market. Every year, he buys young calves from farms in adjacent villages. He raises the calves with the help of his wife and sons. He then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. 

Today, Jabrayil is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest an additional 1,000 Azerbaijani new manats in his business

loans.use: to purchase two cattle.

loans.name: Hammad

texts.en:
Hammad is a 45-year-old father of four daughters and four sons, Hammad is a schoolteacher. He took out a loan from FATEN to paint the house walls. The walls need urgent painting and leaking maintenance.

Hammad, who appears in the picture here, is a teacher with a salary that won't allow him to pay for the painting expenses. Repaying a loan is going to make this possible.

loans.use: to paint the walls of the family house

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 38 years old and lives in West Point. She is married with six children between the ages of 10 and 22, and all of her children are currently in education.
Martha has been selling oil and charcoal in her community for the past 11 years. The major problem she faces is the high transportation costs to move her charcoal. Martha is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business. In the future, she plans to buy some land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Sope Naby Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 27/06/2008.Il est composé de 18 membres.

Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Celle  qui est à l’extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupement.Elle a pour activité principale: la couture.

Elle possède une bonne expérience de cette activité pour avoir eu à la pratiquer durant le passé.  

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter en quantité suffisante des tissus de plusieurs variétés afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.

Son objectif est d'acheter une maison et d'accroitre la rentabilité de son activité
texts.en:
This group was created on June 27, 2008. It is composed of 18 members. Their principal activity is petty commerce.

The lady on the far right of the photo is the leader of the group. Her principal activity is sewing. She has a good deal of experience in this business since she has been in it in the past. Her loan will allow her to buy a sufficient quantity of various sorts of cloth  so that she can satisfy the needs of her clientele. 

Her goal is to buy a house and to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Rosa, se dedica a la venta D. mariscos variados, vive con su esposo y su nieto D. 15 años D. edad, ella inicio el negocio hace 17 años, en el lugar D. residencia, cuenta con mucha experiencia pues este negocio ya que es el que le permitió crecer a sus hijos y educarlos, dándole las ganancias necesarias.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para comprarse pescado, calamar, langosta y camarones, con esta inversión aumentara su mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes, que los mariscos estén frescos para generar mayor atracción.
Las aspiraciones D. Rosa es aumentar sus ventas, que el negocio mejore cada día, poder ser puntual con los pagos D. este préstamo y contar con todo lo necesario en su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa sells a variety of seafood. She lives with her husband and 15-year-old grandson. Rosa started her business 17 years ago from her home. She has extensive experience in this business and it has allowed her to raise and educate her children using the profits she has earned.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan to buy fish, squid, lobster, and shrimp. This investment will increase the inventory that she offers to her customers. By offering fresh seafood, she will be able to attract more customers.

Rosa aspires to increase her sales and improve her business each day so that she can submit her loan payments on time and acquire everything she needs for her home.

loans.use: to purchase fish, squid, lobster, and shrimp.

loans.name: Matanat

texts.ru: Matanat 32 qoda. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Matanat jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona uje 5 let kak rabotayet v konsaltingovom biznesse. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviy kompyuter dlya predostavleniya svoim kliyentam ludshego obslujivaniya. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyego druga kotoriy pomog yey v etom biznesse.
texts.en: Matanat is 32 years old.  SHe is married and has one child.  Matanat lives in Baku with her family.  She has worked in consulting for five years.  Now she needs 2000 AZN to buy a new computer to provide her clients with better service.  She started this business with her friend who helped her with it.

loans.use: to buy a new computer

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.en:
Hipolita is a 40-year-old woman, married, and residing in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two school-age children with her. 

She is selling fish in the local community to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She earns a total of PHP 4,820 a month from this venture. Hipolita has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 at GDMPC to acquire more fish varieties to sell in the communities nearby. She hopes to have a fish vending stall in the marketplace and earn more profit in the future.

loans.use: to acquire more fish varieties to sell in the communities nearby

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario lives and works in La Concordia, a canton in the Esmeraldas province in northeast Ecuador. Esmeraldas is known for its warm subtropical climate, its incredible beaches, and its thriving agricultural economy.

Dario is fifty four years young and divorced; he lives alone. In his spare time he likes playing sports, particularly soccer, though these days he does a bit more watching than playing. 

This is Dario's first loan with Kiva. Dario raises and sells pigs, and he will use his loan to to buy more pigs and feed. He is a self-taught entrepreneur, and decided on this business because he likes working with animals. He spends much of his time working, and he receives help from no-one. Dario also works in a school part-time as a janitor, which doesn't leave a lot of time for raising the pigs. It's particularly hard for him to find time to clean the stall, which takes a while. He hopes through this loan he can buy more pigs and increase his profits, bettering his quality of life in the process.

Dario's hopes for the future are to improve his business, increase his income, and "find a partner with whom he can share the rest of his days."

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, age 53, owns and operates a shop that sells such items as canned goods, noodles, bread, toothpaste, and soap. She has been engaged in this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 14,900 in order to purchase more grocery items.

Rosa and her husband have three children and live in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Rosa has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosa hopes to have a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is 27 years old and lives in the town of Masidi in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  He is married and has 2 children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Rogers has a business of a retail shop that sells spare parts, which he has had for 4 years.         

To help expand his business, Rogers has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase spare parts for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rogers hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Rogers hopes to expand his business.   Rogers is a member of BRAC’s Small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly, age 40, is married to Mr. Bin, age 43. Both of them live in the Kampot Province. She has four single children, all of whom are students and they always depend on her income. 

Mrs. Ly always uses her own farmland to grow a rice crop in both the rainy season and the dry season. Mrs. Ly and her husband make an income of approximately $2.25 USD a day to help cover the family’s expenses. Mrs. Ly would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a few sacks of fertilizer so her grow will grow well.

In the future, Mrs. Ly hopes to use her increased income to buy a new pumping machine, to decorate her house and to support her children to finish at least the high school level.

loans.use: to buy a few sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a dressmaking shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, and dreams of establishing a clothes-selling business in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, Mwanaisha wants to purchase cloth materials for resale with a loan of Kshs 20,000.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase thread for weaving.

loans.name: 03.08.98 Thiệu Toán Thiệu Hoá Group

texts.en:
Duyên has worked in agriculture, farming food, for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Duyên faces in her business is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Duyên  is 50 years old and married, with 4 children. She  is the group leader of the 98 Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. Duyên lives and works in Thiệu Hoá district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. This is Duyên's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, Duyên  hopes to build a new house, have her business do well and buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Sokoroti

texts.en:
Sokoroti has been practicing farming in Narok for the last seven years. He is 31 years old, single and supports his parents.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.


In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer and be rich.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel,  es una persona joven, viven en la comunidad de Mayra de la  provincia de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba.
Esta época por el desastre natural de la sequia su pequeña parcela de cebolla no maduro bien, este desastre le hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos que el percibía para sobrevivir en esta vida ya que sus papas no se encuentran juntamente con y el y solo tiene que auto mantenerse. 
Gabriel es una persona joven  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicada a su trabajo,  como la agricultura son épocas estacionales en sus tiempos libres se dedica a trabajar en atención de gomería Gabriel está solicitando el crédito para   comprar abonos  y semillas para mejorar sus cultivos  y aumentar su producción para mejorar sus ingreso económico y  tener  asi una mejor calidad de vida.  El crédito ayudara mucho a Gabriel en el duro trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a young person. He lives in the community of Mayra, of the province of Mizque, of the departament of Cochabamba.
This season, due to the natural disaster of a drought, his small plot of onions didn't grow properly. This disaster made him fail to get the income he used to get to get by in life. His parents aren't a live anymore and he has to support himself.   

Gabriel is a young man who is loved and respected in the place where he lives. He is dedicated to his work, agriculture in season and in his free time, he works in tire repair. Gabriel is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer and seed to improve his crops and increase his production in order to increase his earnings and have a better quality of life. The loan will really help Gabriel in the hard work that he does.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed for his agricultural activity.

loans.name: Gantsooj

texts.en:
Mr. Gantsooj, 20, is a taxi driver and he has been running his taxi since he got his driver's license. He lives with his wife in his parent's house. Initially, he started his taxi service with his dad’s car, but now he has own new car, bought with his earnings. Now he already has permanent customers for his taxi line. 

Gantsooj always thinks about moving out from his parents house and living individually with his own family in a ger. But, he could not achieve this plan, due to some financial problems. A ger is the nomadic Mongolian traditional tent and it does not cost so much in the markets of Mongolia. It consists of its wall, made of sheep's wool and other parts made of wood. Historically, Mongolians have been living and using the ger for their nomadic life for many hundreds of years. The loan Gantsooj is taking will be used to cover the cost of a new ger for his family's housing.

loans.use: to cover the cost of a new ger for his individual life.

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”SAN ANTONIO DE SAN SALVADOR”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de San salvador en la provincia de Pisac y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Regina;  La socia tiene 43 años de edad, la socia es soltera, la socia tiene 4 hijos de  23, 22, 16, 10 años de edad; la socia compra al por mayor maíz amarillo seco y lo fermenta para elaborar la chicha de jora, la socia solo vende la jora  las diferentes picanterías o chicherías, ella lleva  a Pisac y otros poblados cerca para vender su jora. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz amarillo para preparar la jora.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Regina is a member of the ”SAN ANTONIO DE SAN SALVADOR” communal bank, located in the San Salvador district, within the Pisac province and Cusco department.

She’s 43 years old, single and has 4 children, ages 23, 22, 16, and 10.  She buys dried yellow corn in bulk to make chicha (fermented corn drink).  She only sells to taverns or chicha bars.  She takes it to Pisac and other nearby towns to sell.  She is asking for this loan to invest in yellow corn to make chicha.

She appreciates the loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz amarillo para preparar la jora.

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en:
Regina's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Regina is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past four years, Regina has been working hard to manage her small business which makes and sells cassava flour. 

To help expand her business, Regina has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cassava and will help Regina to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Regina hopes that in the future she will be able to start a big retail shop. 

Regina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has improved Regina's future prospects by helping her to learn more about herself and how to improve her relationship with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava.

loans.name: Met

texts.en: Met, 46, is married and resides with her husband and seven children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who grows agricultural crops to financially support her family. Her husband is a fisherman. Additionally, he is a construction worker. Three of her children are employed at a garment factory. Met is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase an agricultural machine to use in her farming business. She can use this machine to till her land, as well as transport her crop to sell. In the future, she plans to grow more rice in the dry season to generate more income to support her family. In addition, she would like to renovate her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase an agricultural machine to use in her farming business

loans.name: Zvionere Group

texts.en:
This is Tamai, a 32 year old married man with three children ages 6, 3, and 2 years old. Only one child is going to school at the moment. He does not have any other dependents staying with him.

He is in the business of packaging in high density foam in the suburb of Rujeko in Masvingo town. He has been in the business for two years now and is doing well.Tamai has requested a loan of $250.00 to buy packaging materials. With the extra income from this loan he will be able to pay school fees for his school going kids. He says that the challenges he faces are that some of the debtors fail to pay on time. In the next five years he wishes to open a shop in the Central Business District of Masvingo.

loans.use: to buy packaging materials

loans.name: Silvia Sara

texts.es:
La Señora Silvia es socia del banco comunal 2671, vive por un hermoso lugar de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es una de las más importantes del país, en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles.

Doña Silvia tiene 36 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo tiene una discapacidad por lo que recibe estimulación y su segunda hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y presta sus servicios conduciendo una unidad de taxis, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
La Señora Silvia se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal desde hace 6 años y labora sin un horario fijo, muchas veces sus clientes la visitan en su casa para que les venda sus productos.

Se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para incrementar su mercadería.
 
Su sueño es que su hijo se mantenga con buena salud.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member of Communal Bank 2671.  She lives is a pretty place in the city of Cuenca, one of the most important cities in the country.  In December 1999 it was named a World Heritage Site.  The people there maintain the culture and traditions of their communities, and they are known for being pleasant and kind people.

Silvia, 36, is married and has three children from this relationship, ages 13, 10, and 1.  Her first son has a disability for which she receives assistance and her second daughter studies in a school in the city.  Her husband is a driver by profession and offers services driving a taxi.  She does not have her own home, which is why she lives in her mother's home and shares the household expenses.

Silvia has worked for six years selling Yanbal beauty products and she works without a fixed schedule.  Many times her customers visit her in her home so she can sell them products.

This is the fifth loan she is getting from the communal bank and she is going to invest it in buying cosmetics to increase her merchandise.

Her dream is for her son to stay in good health.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: José

texts.es: José es un microempresario de 52 años residente en el municipio de Madrid, él se dedica a la elaboración de un plato típico del departamento del Tolima, llamado la Lechona Tolimense, receta que adquirío de su familia y durante 20 años la ha preparado por encargos de empresas y particulares. Este plato es elaborado a base de arroz, vegetales y especias, su principal ingrediente es la carne de cerdo y arveja frita y es servido generalmente con arepas de maíz blanco y natilla, una receta muy tradicional en la temporada decembrina.  José realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para realizar unas adecuaciones locativas a su negocio, él comprará cerámica para pisos y pagará por la mano de obra a albañiles que le realizaran la instalación y así de mejorará la imagen del negocio y con ello sus ventas.  José es padre de cuatro hijos y durante años ha vivido con su cónyuge en una humilde vivienda del municipio de Madrid, su principal meta es continuar en su negocio para darles bienestar a su familia.

loans.use: él comprará cerámica para pisos y pagará por la mano de obra a albañiles

loans.name: Ami

texts.en:
Ami G. was born in Tsévié in 1970. She went to school and earned her middle school diploma (BEPC). Lacking the support to continue her education, she had to quit. She then learned to sew, and for five years she has been running her own dressmaking shop, called «Vivre Ensemble», or Live Together, thanks to an initial loan of $350, which she repaid without a problem. She is in a common-law marriage with a plumber who left in search of work in Bénin. That is why Mrs. G. has been alone for 16 months with her 3-year-old daughter. There has been no news of her husband. She courageously deals with household expenses by herself. An adroit and very energetic woman, she puts everything she knows into her work, and she is renowned in her neighborhood for the quality of her services. She would like to include among her goods for sale various fabrics and other boutique items not currently available in her area. This will provide a comprehensive range of goods for her customer base.

To achieve this, she is requesting a loan of $950 to stock and sell traditional skirts, bags, and shoes for women. This new project will grow her business and of course her income, allowing her to take care of her child.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame G. Ami est née en 1970 à Tsévié. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en classe de 3ème sanctionné par le BEPC. Obligée d’abandonner ses études par manque de support, elle apprit alors la couture et depuis cinq (5) ans, elle gère son propre atelier de couture grâce à son premier crédit de $350 obtenus et parfaitement remboursés. Elle vit dans une union de fait avec son mari plombier qui l’a abandonnée pour s’installer au Bénin en quête de travail. C’est ainsi que Madame G. Ami vit seule depuis 16 mois avec sa fille âgée de 3 ans, sans aucune nouvelle du mari. Très courageuse, elle fait face seule aux charges du ménage. Femme ingénieuse et très dynamique, elle met tout son savoir-faire au service de ce travail, et la qualité de ses services fait sa renommée dans son quartier. Elle veut associer la mercerie et la vente de tissus qui manquent dans le quartier et ses environs à la couture pour rendre un service complet à sa clientèle.

Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 pour l’achat et la revente de pagnes, sacs et chaussures pour dames. Ce nouveau projet va accroître ses activités et de facto ses revenus lui permettant de s’occuper des besoins de son enfant.

loans.use: To add traditional skirts for sale, plus shoes for women, to her dressmaking shop

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Client History: Señora Erlinda has a small stall where she sells sweets, food staples, soft drinks, canned foods, cookies and other cheap and popular products for family consumption. She also sells prepared food (noodle soup). Since her store is close to 2 schools, her soup sales are good. Her store is located in the Tembladerani zone, a neighborhood of the western slope of the city of La Paz. She has three children, all of whom are still her responsibility. They help tend to the store. She is separated from her husband and 51 years old. She has been selling noodle soup in the schools for more than 12 years. Her sales are retail, onsite in her store. She does not have any employees since her children help her.

This is the second time she has applied for a loan from Impro. Her case history in our institution classifies her as Client 0, that is to say with excellent fulfillment of the repayment of her loan. The loan for which she is applying will be used to buy canned foods, sweets, soft drinks and other products as a way to offer more variety in her store.

Her previous credit history with Impro allows her access to this loan, since her experience in her business will bring her the earnings with which to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Erlinda tiene una pequeña tienda para venta de dulces abarrotes refrescos, conservas y galletas y otros productos populares y baratos para el consumo familiar. También se dedica a la venta de comida (Sopa de Fideo) ya que por estar cerca de dos colegios sus ventas en este rubro son satisfactorias. Su tienda esta ubicado en la zona de Tembladerani (Barrio de la ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz). Tiene tres hijos que están a su cargo quienes le ayudan en la atención de la tienda ya que esta separada de su esposo. Tiene 51 años y trabaja con la venta de sopa de fideo en los colegios más de 12 años. Sus ventas son al detalle, en su tienda y no trabaja con otros empleados ya que sus hijos le ayudan.

Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito de Impro, su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 0, es decir con cumplimiento excelente en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de conservas, abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y otros productos para surtir su tienda.

Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Cécile

texts.en:
Cécile A. was born in Aklakou in 1968 and is married and the mother of four. She came to selling fish by doing volunteer work for fishermen. Each evening, she used to go and gather the fish that the fishermen had left. She would smoke them. Little by little, she developed an interest in selling smoked fish. And then she invested her small income in a carton of frozen fish. Once smoked, the fish were offered in front of her home. Today, she is a great merchant, renowned by local consumers. And so, the demand has gotten very good, but she lacks enough money to grown her business. She is therefore requesting a loan of $1,000 to increase her production and to meet customer expectations. That is how she will succeed in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Madame A. Cécile est née en 1968 à Aklakou. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, elle est arrivée aujourd’hui à la vente de poissons à partir de son activité de bénévolat auprès des pêcheurs. Chaque soir, Cécile A. passait collecter les poissons restants auprès des pêcheurs, qu’elle fumait. A petit coup, elle a senti le goût de vendre les poissons fumés. Elle a alors investi son petit revenu dans l’achat de poissons en carton au frigot. Après fumage, elle les expose à la devanture de son domicile. Aujourd’hui, elle est devenu grande commerçante, bien reconnue par les consommateurs locaux. Du coup, la demande est devenue très forte mais elle ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour élargir son commerce. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de $1000 pour augmenter sa production et satisfaire sa clientèle. Aussi, réussira-t-elle à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying, smoking, and selling fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase mobile phone airtime for resale to expand her business

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Juanita and I'm dedicated to the selling personal items like lotions and creams as well as making and selling tortillas. For my age I have a lot of experience doing this type of work. My clients are neighbors and my children's co-workers. If I increase my inventory I can improve my income and be able to repair my home. That is my goal at the moment since it's raining hard and part of my roof is in bad shape. Help me get supplies so I can increase my sales and be able to fix my home.
Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer
Hola me llamo Juanita y me dedico a la venta de lociones, cremas y elaboracion de tortillas. Por mi edad me he dedicado a este negocio del que tengo muy buena experiencia vendo tortillas y lociones, mis clientes son mis vecinas y compañeros de trabajo de mis hijos. Se que acrecentando mi inventario puedo tener mejores ingresos para poder reparar mi casa, esta es mi meta por el momento ya que las lluvias son fuertes y parte del techo se encuentra en mal estado. Ayudenme a tener material de trabajo para mejorar mi ingreso y poder darle prioridad de mejorar mi casa.

loans.use: Purchase lotions, corn meal, firewood and other items.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha A., 30, lives in Kisiwani,  in the Buguruni area of Dar Es Salaam city. For the past six years, she has been running a restaurant in the Kisiwani area. She has developed her entrepreneurial skills through the Youth Self Employment Foundation. She now wants to expand her restaurant  to cater to more customers at a time.  She is asking for $325 to enlarge her restaurant.

loans.use: Enlarge her restaurant

loans.name: Indira

texts.en:
Mrs.Indira T., 20, lives in Nakhu, a village located in the Lalitpur district of Nepal. Most of the people in this locality are involved in agriculture. Mrs.T. has three people in her family including herself. Her husband's name is Dil Kumar T.. He is 25 years old. Mrs.T. has one daughter who is 4 years old and goes to nursery school.

Poultry farming is the only job Mr. and Mrs. T. have, so they rely on it to support their family. Mrs. T. sells chickens and eggs in the market. She needs a loan of US$ 175 to buy chicks to raise and feed for their chickens.

loans.use: To buy chicks to raise and feed for them

loans.name: Kabowa 1(E) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for 12 months. Betty is married with seven children, and runs a poultry farm. She needs to buy more baby chicks to raise, and intends to use the money she makes from selling them when they are grown to build a new chicken house and buy a piece of land. Mary and Annet work as seamstresses and plan to use their portions of the loan to buy new sewing machines. Prossy plans to set up her own kiosk in the local market and Zaina wants buy a hair dryer for her beauty salon. Each member of this group is confident that these steps will increase their income and help them and their families live better lives.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses by buying new equipment or materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in rice crop/harvest.

loans.name: Mwanaisha's Tunajiamini Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a 45 year old married woman with four children, ages 26, 25, 16, and 8. Mwanaisha owns a small food vending store. Every day she works from 8 A.M. to 8 P.M. at her business where she earns a monthly profit of about $25.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Hidaya, who sells cloth.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
Leopoldo G. is originally from the district of San Rafael in Managua. He owns a bakery which provides him with enough income to take care of his family composed of his wife and a young son who currently goes to a nearby school.

With a lot of effort and sacrifices, he has been able to support his family through the income he makes from the bakery. Currently, he's unable to purchase the main ingredients to make bread. This is the main reason why Ceprodel, the lending institution, has approved him to get a loan so that he can purchase the main ingredients for his bakery and an electric generator in case of power failure in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Leopoldo G. es originario del municipio de San Rafael en Managua dedicándose al negocio de panadería con el cual debe mantener su hogar que consta de su esposa y su pequeño hijo que actualmente estudia en un colegio cercano a su localidad.

Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado llevar el sustento a su hogar por medio de la panadería sin embargo la necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa esta caballero es la adquisición de la materia prima para la elaboración del pan. Es por esta razón que Ceprodel le ha apoyado con créditos que le han permitido comprar su materia prima y a la vez le ha permitido adquirir una planta eléctrica para usarla en momentos que la energía falle.

loans.use: To purchase main ingredients to run a bakery and an electric generator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flower seedlings.

loans.name: Sophat Suos Village Bank Group

texts.en: A Village Bank loan which consists of twenty-five people is in this case in Khsom Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Sophat S. is the Village Bank President and she is a housewife who cooks food for her children. Mrs. Sophat S. is a widow with five children, two of whom are laborers who have been hired to cut firewood for a profit. Two others are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is studying in state school. Even Mrs. Sophat S. family members have different business activities; they are still in poor condition. They now live in an old house so Mrs. Sophat S. now would like to ask for a loan to build a new house in order to replace the old one.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to build a new house in order to replace the old one.

loans.name: Bianka Anais

texts.es:
Bianka started in business before she married with the help of a friend. With her experience in sales, she has now signed up for direct sales of cosmetic products and it is going very well.

She began her business principally to help her husband with household expenses. His job did not pay steady wages, so they couldn't make enough support themselves and buy diapers and milk for their young son. For this reason she decided to sell a little to help with the basic expenses.

She began about 1-1/2 years ago selling creams, deodorants, and cosmetics to her neighbors and friends. She sells on credit when she is able to in order to increase her clientele.

She needs a loan of US$300, which she will repay in 5 months, in order to buy merchandise, to fulfill an order that she has, and to take advantage of sale prices. With your help Bianka will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Bianka inició el negocio ya que antes de casarse le ayudaba a una amiga y ella siente que adquirio algo de experiencia en ventas por lo que ahora ella se inscribio en la venta de los productos cosmeticos directamente y le va bien

Inicio su negocio prinicipalmente para ayudar con los gastos de la casa a su esposo ya que en el lugar donde trabaja no tiene un sueldo fijo y no se completaban con lo que a el le daban, ya que tenian a su hijo chiquito y habia que comprar pañales y leche es por eso que se decidio a vender minimo para ayudarle con los gastos basicos.

Comenzó hace aproximadamente 1 ½ años vendiendo sus vecinas y amigas las cremas desodorantes y algo de cosmeticos los deja a credito cuando ella puede soportar lo de un pedido para asi hacerse de mas clientela.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancia y surtir un pedido que tiene y para aprovechar las ofertas de temporada. con tu apoyo Bianka saldra adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel M. sells is a commercial driver who uses his own car. At the moment the car is giving him problems and he needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for the repairs of his car. He is married, but his wife's income Hairdresser is not sufficient for Joseph Maxwell M. and his 7 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is running a transportation services business in Ivano-Frankivsk. He is married with a teenage daughter who is 16. Sergey has been in this business for 9 years already. He rents a car and uses it to offer taxi rides to his customers. His daily income is about US$ 30-40.

Sergey would like to purchase the vehicle he's renting at this point to be able to manage his time and efforts more efficiently and become full owner of business. We believe Sergey's focused approach to business and his diligent hard work will help him repay this loan on time and expand his business as a result.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle to use as a taxi

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin A. is a 46-year-old married man with three adorable daughters. Yasin is a hard-working man who started his own business as a source of income and savings in case of unemployment. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business 20 years ago. Over time, he has increased his cattle sales, and he is proud to say that the business has been running well, but he now needs additional capital to expand his business. 

Therefore, Yasin requests a loan of $1200 USD to purchase four calves. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Sauliat

texts.en:
O. Sauliat, 38 and married with three children, lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria, where she sells clothes in her shop located along Ojo Igbede Road.  Previously selling clothing door to door, O. was able to rent a shop for her business with the assistance of LAPO MICROFINANCE.  She is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell, hoping to stock all that her customers need. This, she says, will enable her to retain those customers.  

O. says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: La Sr. Nidia tiene 34 años de edad, habita en Healeah, madre soltera con tres hijos de 3, 18 y 19 años de edad. Actualmente realiza un aumento de su casa para brindarle mayor comodidad a su núcleo familiar y espacio para su negocio en donde pueda alcanzar mayores cantidades y variedad de productos. E l negocio tiene catorce  años de existir y se inicio en compañía del padre de sus hijos, posteriormente consiguió financiamiento y ha venido creciendo aceleradamente pero los planes de doña Nidia es convertirlo en una pulpería con variedad en sus productos con calidad. Gracias a los prestamos que Afodenic le brinda, esta cumpliendo sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Nidia is 34 years old and lives in Healeah. She is a single mother with three children ages 3, 18, and 19. She is in the process of putting an addition onto her house so that her family can be more comfortable and so that her business has the space to carry a larger quantity and a wider variety of products. She started the business fourteen years ago with the father of her children. Later she obtained financing, and it has continued to grow quickly. Nidia’s plans are to convert it into a grocery store with a variety of quality products. Thanks to loans from AFODENIC she is achieving her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for an addition to her house

loans.name: Srei Leak

texts.en: Mrs. Srei Leak Y. is a 22-year-old and she now lives in Tuol Sro Lau village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Sun Sok, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate cassava to earn a living. In the plantation, they face a small problem because they do not have enough money to hire laborers to work their field. Thus, Mrs. Srei Leak Y. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to hire laborers to work on their field

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa Z. est une jeune femme de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de légumes au grand marché de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle espère avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son commerce en achetant des marchandises afin de satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle sans cesse croissante. Cette opportunité lui permettra de gagner plus de fonds pour subvenir aux besoins de se enfants.
texts.en:
Yawa Z. is a young woman, 35 years of age, married, and the mother of two. She is a retailer of vegetables at the grand marketplace of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She hopes to use this loan to expand her commerce by buying merchandise to satisfy the needs of her ever-increasing customer base. This opportunity will enable her to earn more and to provide for the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruit for resale

loans.name: Eliashea

texts.en:
Eliashea has been a  maize seller in the Tengeru in the neighborhood of Arusha for 4 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business from 8am to 4pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more maize for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Eliashea is married, and has two children. She also cares for two additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more maize for her business.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa L., 52, is married with 6 children.  She has 3 year experience in the fishing business. She sells to the general public and villagers, 4 days per week. She has made 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Epenesa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy a new canoe to replace the old one, some fishing equipment and a fishing net.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment such as; fishing net, goggles, fishing spear, canoe and fishing suit

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy S. is a villager in Trapaing Kok village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Ngel Touch, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a fisherman.

The couple has four children, one of whom is a beautician while the others are attending the local school.

Thuy requests a loan to buy more piglets and pig food. She will use the rest of money to buy more cosmetic supplies for her child's business.

She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: Buy more piglets, pig food, and cosmetic supplies for her child's business.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera I. has been an active member of LAPO microfinance since 2006. She is a sawmill operator. She purchases timber and takes it to her sawmill for conversion into planks.

Vera is 45 years old and married with four children. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more timber. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more timber to convert into planks

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella sells foodstuffs and soup ingredients. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and soup ingredients to sell. Stella is 32 years old and married to P. who owns a restaurant. They have two children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and soup ingredients to sell

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Enhbayar B. lives with his wife and two small children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His ten year old son goes to a local high school and his three year old daughter stays at home.

Enhbayar runs a small car repair shop from his home's garage. He also sells second hand car accessories. He has been running his repair shop for the last nine years. He usually purchases cheap car accessories from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar. In 2008, he traveled to South Korea to buy high quality car accessories for his business but failed to make a profit due to the expensive shipping costs. He is working hard to make this up.

In the future, he would like to expand the most profitable side of his business, which is fixing cars in his shop and selling cheap secondhand accessories. He requests a loan to purchase materials and car accessories for his repair shop.

loans.use: To purchase materials and car accessories for his repair shop.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
La señora Paola vive en alquiler con su esposo en la calle Ángel Gómez de la zona de Alto san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que ella realiza es la elaboración de cotillones, como ser piñatas, canastitas, sombreritos, etc. En esta actividad le ayuda el esposo y juntos generan sus ingresos para el hogar.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, de manera que pueda comprar más materia prima (papel de colores, goma de pegar, cartón, etc.), elaborar mas productos para la venta y así obtener mejores ingresos.

Esta es la primera vez que acude a Impro para solicitar un préstamo y consideramos que, una vez analizado el flujo de caja y la evaluación social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Paola lives in a rented house with her husband on Ángel Gómez Street in the Alto San Pedro zone in the city of La Paz. She makes gift bags, piñatas, baskets, hats, etc. Her husband helps her with this business. Together they generate income for their home. The loan is to buy raw materials (colored paper, glue, cardboard, etc.) to make more products to sell and obtain better income. This is the first time she has asked Impro for a loan. We think that once the cash flow is analyzed and the social evaluation is completed, she will qualify for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materiels, colored paper, glue, cardboard, etc. for making piñatas, hats, baskets, etc.

loans.name: Ernesto Alexander

texts.es: Ernesto Alexander D. C. de 34 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque junto a su prima y una sobrina de 10 años de edad. El posee una venta de medicina desde ya hace 3 años atrás. Ernesto solicita un préstamo ya que desea aumentar el numero de medicinas que posee y así mismo comprar tarjetas de recarga de saldo para celulares, con el fin de comercializarlas también. El desea poder mejorar su negocio y mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Ernesto Alexander D. C. is 34 years old and live in Tonacatepeque with his cousin and 10 year old niece. He has owned a small pharmacy for 3 years. Ernesto is requesting this loan because he wants to expand the number of medicines that he has, as well as purchasing reloadable cellphone cards, with the aim of selling them also. He would like to improve his business as well as his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicine for store

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha García tiene 60 años de edad. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de almuerzos y desayunos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Martha  es una mujer que tuvo que atravesar muchas dificultades. Su mayor desafío es encontrar nuevos clientes, para ofrecer la variedad de productos a sus clientes. El destino de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y gaseosas. El sueño de Martha es obtener un cafetín de su propiedad.
texts.en:
Martha García is 60 years old. She is a married woman. She has 1 child under her care. Her business is in the sale of breakfast and lunch. She has dedicated herself to this business for over 5 years. Martha has had to face many difficulties. Her biggest challenge is finding new clients, to whom she wants to be able to offer a variety of products. The loan will be used as work capital to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, and soft drinks. Matha’s dream is to own her own café.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Qork capital (to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, and soft drinks).

loans.name: Karla Veronica

texts.es: Karla Verónica Ríos Martínez está casada con José, ellos tienen 2 hijos que asisten a una escuela pública. Hace más de 4 años que Karla se dedica su pulpería. Ella es una mujer muy inteligente, ya que siempre ha sabido invertir el dinero en su negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes son sus vecinos, y otros son de comarcas mucho más lejanas y recurren a su pulpería porque Karla se levanta temprano para realizar los quehaceres del hogar, realizar las compras. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, jugos, pan, galletas y productos de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Karla Verónica Ríos Martínez is married to José. They have 2 children who attend a public school. Karla has been operating a small grocery store for more than 4 years. She is a very intelligent woman who has always invested her money back into her business. Most of her customers are her neighbors, but she has some who come from distant regions because Karla’s store is open early enough for them to run their errands and do their shopping.

Her loan will be used as working capital to purchase candy, soft drinks, juices, bread, cookies and everyday consumer products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu produces and sells a locally-made cooker. Aminu is 48 years old and married to Mr. O., who is a teacher, and they have seven children. The family lives in Lagos state.

Aminu has been in this business for five years now. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase materials in bulk for producing the cooker. She says this will reduce the unit cost and will help pay for transportation to the market. This will increase her profit which will help her in better caring for her family.

loans.use: To purchase material for cooker production

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge has raised his son from the age of six, because his wife left to work in another country. He had a job in a bakery for 12 years. With his savings, he bought a place in the market and started a juice shop. He works in the juice shop serving breakfast everyday, from 7 in the morning to 10 at night.

Jorge is 59 years old and married. He has a 20-year-old son who works in the mornings and is also studying at university to acquire a systems engineering degree.

Jorge is a member of the Valley Roses Village Bank. Since joining FINCA, Jorge has learned to manage his business better and is thankful for the business skills he has acquired at the village bank. Jorge needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy bread, carbonated drinks and fruits for his store.

loans.use: To buy bread, carbonated drinks and fruits for his store

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah K. is 28 years old. He is married to Magdaline Ndanu who is 22 years old and they are blessed with one child. Jeremiah has a retail stand in Changamwe where he sells an assortment of bags. He has been running this business for six years. Jeremiah was introduced to KADET by an existing client and is glad to access his first loan. He plans to increase the stock of bags in his store with the funds. He hopes that through subsequent loans from KADET he will be able to establish a permanent large store and to also diversify his business to clothing. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase his stock of bags

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros Y. is 62 years old and married with 3 adult children. She and her husband help each other in running their business. The couple lives in the village of Nabantu-an, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. Even while she is growing older, Milagros and her husband want to retain their independence by having their own business. Milagros is quite content that her 3 children have their own families and are all gainfully employed, earning enough to afford giving extra money to support their parents. Milagros is very aware that she needs to have proper nutrition now to stay healthy, and she also dreams to build a decent house for herself and her husband.

Milagros always wanted to help her husband earn their living. She knew that if she only had the opportunity to use her cooking skills, she'd make a successful business, but before she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001, she did not have such an opportunity. But as soon as she became a member of NWTF-PD, she was able to set up her own "carinderia" an eatery or luncheonette selling and serving cooked food in a simple kitchen setup, adjacent to her house. Before long she had a loyal clientele and her food sold out fast each day, she had to frequently increase the volume she cooked each day. It was fortunate that she could borrow additional capital to address the growing opportunity that she was able to sustain and stabilize her business. Later, she even started investing in raising pigs as it would allow her to build savings. She only sold her pigs when she really needed the money. Her business ventures earn her an average income of PHP 5,000 per month and it is taking her one step nearer her dream.


With her previous loan, she borrowed Php 10,000 on her 12th cycle and used it as additional capital for her businesses. She was able to return this loan in full without any delays. Now she is borrowing the same amount of Php 10,000 for her 13th cycle loan to use in her business in Carinderia and raising pigs.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her lunchenette and raising pigs

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es: Rosa Haydee M. C. reside en Cojutepeque municipio del departamento de Cuscatlán. Rosa tiene 45 años de edad vive con su esposo , sus dos hijos y su padre don Jesús de 76 años de edad. Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora tiene una venta de pupusas y tortillas hace 13 años y ahora también ha montado una pequeña vitrina con productos de belleza para comercializar, la aspiración de Rosa es poder aumentar la demanda de sus productos de belleza, pero para esto necesita de más variedad,  y es por ello que solicita de un crédito que le permita invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Haydee M. C. lives in the Cojutepeque municipality in the department of Cuscatlán. She is 45 years old and lives with her husband, her two children, and her 76-year-old father, don Jesús.

Rosa is a hard-working woman who has operated a business selling pupusas (traditional Salvadoran dumplings) and tortillas for the last 13 years. Now, she has added a small showcase filled with beauty products for sale. Her goal is to increase the demand for the beauty products, but for this she needs more variety. That is the purpose of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory for beauty products business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 44-year-old married father of two children. For the past four years, he has run a Jua Kali shop (an informal store, sometimes consisting of goods spread out on a blanket on the ground). He sells mali mali (household goods), including blankets, rubber shoes and baby clothing. He also works as a taxi driver to earn extra income. 

Francis says that since joining Faulu, a Kiva partner, he has been able to meet his financial obligations, pay for his children to attend a better school and buy some assets. He would like to expand his business to become a wholesale supplier and move to a better premises. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel and Arsenio L. of Barangay Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya, are striving to earn a living to support their three children. Despite the current economic crisis, they have a strong faith and determination to be successful in the future through patience and hard work.

Within their village, Maricel and Arsenio cultivate their small parcel of land by planting rice and some vegetables. Since harvesting takes a long time, Maricel also sells meat, frozen foods, and barbecued food in front of their house to earn an additional income. Since her capital is small, she can only earn a net income of 1,500 PHP a month. For this reason, Maricel wants to borrow 8,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to increase her capital and acquire more products to be sold in her village.

loans.use: As additional capital to acquire more products to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is married, 55 years old, and she has no child. Her husband is a farmer and they are currently living at Talairon, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental.

Evelyn is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP as additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store. Her husband’s income is not enough for their daily needs and so she wants to have more stock for her sari-sari store in order for her to earn more income.

Evelyn plans to expand her little store into a convenience store and wishes to see their family succeed in their chosen field of business.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
Lizeth, de 19 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y sencilla, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.
Tejiendo chullos (prendas para la cabeza), chalinas, guantes, etc, Lizeth pasa sus días. Sus tejidos los vende en su pequeño puesto ubicado en la mina La Rinconada (poblado minero), donde con mucha rapidez son adquiridos por sus clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer, ya que desde muy pequeña aprendió a hacerlo, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es realizar los acabados a las prendas que hace, pues debe ser muy detallista.
Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda brindarle una mayor comodidad a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Lizeth con MFP y planea ahorrar poco a poco para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar más tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Lizeth is 19 years old and a hardworking, modest young woman. She lives at home with her parents and her greatest hope is to succeed in life.

Lizeth spends her days weaving wool caps, scarves, gloves, etc. She sells her finished articles from a small vending post located in La Rinconada (a mining town) where she has been able to quickly build up her clientele. Weaving is the part of her job that she enjoys most. She learned this skill when she was very young and now has been in business for three years. Lizeth says that finishing a single garment is difficult because it requires a lot of detail. In the future, she hopes to have a larger shop so that she can provide greater convenience to her customers and improve her income.

This is her first loan with MFP. Lizeth plans to save little by little so that she can make her payments on time. She does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank, where she feels very happy. With her loan of 700 soles, she will buy wool for producing more hand-woven articles.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Mrs. Neang K. is currently a resident of Kampong Chhnang province, located about nineteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She owns a handicraft business whose main activity is making baskets, from which she earns a living. Neang K. has been married for many years to Chay Ly, and they have eight children, half of whom are married and live independently while the others are single. Neang K. is assisted by her husband in weaving bamboo baskets. Neang K. needs a loan to buy more raw materials for her weaving business. Note: the picture shows Neang K.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Lester

texts.en:
Lester V., from the village of Roxas, Avenue Iligan City, is 25 years old, single, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lester owns and operates a business selling flowers in the local community. Engaged in his business for over five years, he earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lester joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lester is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand the business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Manayon's Group

texts.en:
Manayon C. is 47 years old and from the town of San Antonio, San Agustin. She is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Manayon is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Manayon has been engaged in her business for over 32 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.
Manayon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Hadjah Nankya's Group

texts.en:
Hadjah is 42 years of age.  She is married with six children aged between 3 and 18 years. All her children go to school. The family owns a four-room house where she lives with ten people. She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home.  The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include: utility bills, school fees for children, medication and food. 

Hadjah owns a stall in the Ndeeba market selling bananas. Hadjah buys her bananas nearby, so she doesn’t incur any transport costs.  She serves an average of 30 customers a day. She has run this business for over twenty-five years.  Her main business challenges are: defaulters, the rainy season (because she works from a muddy place) and the ever-increasing price of bananas.  She sells on a retail basis only. She has been with MCDT for over nine years. She is requesting her twentieth loan working with the same group. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She aspires to grow her business and start buying directly from farmers. 
.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia tiene 27 años, es una mujer responsable y hogareña que vive en su casa propia con su esposo, Sosimo de 32 años, y sus 4 hijos.  

Desde muy pequeña se dedica al cultivo de café, plátano y palta, aprendiendo las técnicas agrícolas que le enseñó su padre. Luego de casarse, junto a su esposo, siembra una cantidad mayor de productos oriundos de la zona. Ellos cuentan con terrenos propios, los mismos que compraron con bastante esmero y sacrificio ahorrando las ganancias de los frutos que comercializan en los mercados de la ciudad de Tarma, Huancayo y Lima, lugares donde vende a buenos precios que la alientan a seguir trabajando.
Lo que más le gusta de su actividad es hacerse cargo de su vivero de café, pues viene contando los días para renovar sus plantaciones. Asimismo, pronto piensa instalar un negocio de venta de carne de pollo, ya que sería la única comerciante dedicada a este rubro, también aprovecharía el local para acopiar granos de café que luego trasladaría a otra ciudad para su comercialización.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tienen con MFP y está tranquila y feliz de continuar trabajando en su banco comunal, donde la gente es muy espontánea, unida y responsable en el cumplimiento de sus obligaciones. Con los dos mil soles que solicita comprará carne de pollo y algunas verduras que venderá en su casa.
texts.en:
Antonia is 27 years old, is responsible and a homebody who lives in a house she owns with her husband Sosimo, 32, and her four children. Since she was young she has worked growing coffee, bananas, and avocados and learning from the agricultural techniques her father taught her. After getting married, along with her husband, she grows a greater number of crops that are native to the area. They own their fields, which they bought after carefully saving the earnings from the fruits they sold in the markets of Tarma, Huancayo and Lima, places where the good prices encourage her to keep working. What she enjoys most about her work is to take care of her coffee nursery since she counts the days until she can renew her crops. Additionally, she soon plans to start a business to sell chicken meat as she would be the only one dedicated to this business. She would also take advantage of the business to keep her coffee beans to later move to other cities for sale. This is the second loan she has with MFP and is calm and happy to continue working with her communal bank, where the people are spontaneous, close, and responsible about meeting their obligations. With the PEN 2,000 she is asking for, she will purchase chicken mean and other vegetables that she will sell from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment for new business

loans.name: Mercedes Azucena

texts.es: La Sra. Mercedes Azucena E. hurtada     ella se desempeña como profesora de educación primaria ella tiene de laborar como docente  treinta y dos  años, es madre de tres hijos, ella es casada actualmente.
