Ha tenido  nueve  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación y este crédito ella lo quiere para hacer una construcción de un muro  en su casa de habitación  y así tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Mercedes Azucena E. H. has been a primary school teacher for thirty-two years. She is the mother of three children and is currently married. She has had nine previous loans from CEPRODEL and has used each of them to make improvements to her home. She will use this loan to build a wall and thereby make her home more respectable.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials such as stones and cement

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
N. Betty is a single mother of one child and four helpless dependents. She has operated a bar business for seven years, earning her a profit of 100,000 Ugandan shillings. This bar is strategically located in Kibaati, Mubende District, with highly esteemed customer care and hygiene, thus pulling in a good number of customers.

With this loan, Betty hopes to purchase more stock; that is: beers, soft drinks like sodas, and wines in order to meet the increasing demand from her customers. This will fetch her more profits, enable her to sustain her family needs, and motivate her to go for her dream of starting up a beer depot.
 
Betty belongs to a group of thirteen members who hold each other accountable and insure one another in paying back the loan because they want to access the future successfully.

loans.use: To purchase more beers, wine and sodas for her bar business

loans.name: Anibal De Jesus

texts.es:
el sr. Anibal de Jesus C. se dedica a la venta de refrescos en varios lugares cercanos a su comunidad.
Anibal es un hombre emprendedor que a trabajado muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia. 
Anibal se levanta muy temprano todos los dias para cargar su carro de refrescos poder salir a repartir los mismos en diferentes pulperias y mercaditos.
Anibal es padre de 4 hijos y todos dependen de el.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas refrescos ya que los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes son mas grandes y a veces no logra cubrir con la ruta que tiene diaria porque se le acaban los refrescos.
texts.en:
Anibal de Jesus C. sells soft-driks in various locations near his community. He is an enterprising man who has worked very hard to move his family forward in life. Anibal rises very early in the morning every day to load his car with soft-drinks to distribute to various small grocery stores and markets. Anibal has 4 dependent children. He will use the funds to buy more soft-drinks because his customer orders are larger each time and sometimes he doesn’t have sufficient stock to fill all the orders he has in his daily routes because he runs out of soft-drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks.

loans.name: Eduardo Miguel

texts.es:
Eduardo tiene 57 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a un hijo que aun depende de el, su domiciclio se ubica en el distrito de Chepén, perteneciente a la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 10 años a brindar servicio de planchado de autos en un pequeño taller ubicado en plena carretera Panamericana (la carretera mas grande del país, atraviesa todas las regiones de la costa), su establecimiento se encuentra estratégicamente ubicado frente a un grifo, por lo que siempre tiene trabajo que realizar. Este negocio le ha servido para solventar los gastos familiares durante todo este tiempo, por lo que se encuentra muy agradecido con su trabajo y planea seguir adelante en esta actividad.

Eduardo desea mejorar su negocio con la compra de mas material y de herramientas que le permitan brindar un mejor servicio y por consiguiente obtener mas clientes, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por pirmera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.	

Eduardo es bastante trabajador y responsable, su mayor anhelo es poder obtener un local propio donde pueda ejecer su oficio ya que el que actualmente tiene es alquilado. Sus clientes y vecinos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona honesta.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 57-years-old, married, and lives with his wife and one dependent child. His home is in the Chepén district, belonging to the province of the same name, located in the La Libertad región, one hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque región. For more than 10 years he has provided a auto detailing service in a littel garage located right on the Panamerican Highway (the biggest highway in the country, which crosses all the coastal regions). His business is strategically located in front of a water-tap, which means he always has work to do. This business has helped him pay all his household expenses during the past 10 years, and for this he is very thankful for his work, and he plans to continue on with this job. Eduardo wants to improve his business by purchasing more material and tools that will allow him to provide a better service to increase his customer base. In order to accomplish this, he has asked for his first loan from Edpyme Alternative, in the amount of 1000 nuevo soles. Eduardo is very hardworking and responsible, and his greatest dream is to be able to buy his own spot where he can do his work, since the one he has now is rented. His customers and neighbors admire him very much, and consider him to be an honest man.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials and tools to grow his business

loans.name: Phineas

texts.en:
Phineas is 40 years old. He is married with two children, age 6 and 13 years old. Both of the children are currently attending school.

He is a farmer from Nkubu town in Eastern Kenya. He has been farming for fifteen years and his products are bananas and cereals which he sells to the local market. He also operates a hotel business and a salon in the same area. His major challenge in farming is insufficient finances for expansion and an insufficient supply of water.

He recently completed a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 KES. He has requested this loan from Juhudi for 60,000 KES to purchase farm supplies and to install a water system to improve his banana plantation. The extra income from this loan will enable him to pay school fees for his children and to build a decent home for his family.

In the future he would like to purchase an extra two acres of land to increase his banana plantation.

He says Juhudi Kilimo has made him realize that farming is a business like any other.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and install a water system.

loans.name: Arjomand Group

texts.en:
S. Wahid is the leader of Arjomand Group. He is 33 years old, married and has three children who are in school. He lives in the district 3 of Jalalabad city. 

He runs a tailoring business. Currently his business income is not enough to meet his family's needs and pay salaries to his workers. Therefore, he wants to take a loan to purchase some rolls of cloth and thread to increase his business income and broaden his business capacity. 

He would like to thank  all Kiva lenders around the world for their effective process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and thread to broaden his business and increase income.

loans.name: Hieu's Group

texts.en:
Hieu T. N. is 49 years old. She not only grow rice, but she also raises chickens. Now, she raises about 400 chickens and sells eggs one or twice per week. She has two children. Her husband is a farmer. They have a monthly income of about 5,000,000 Vietnamese dong. She has participated in SEDA since 2004 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycL., she would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy food for chickens.
 
About other borrowers in her group.
 Hien T. L. is 41 years old. She sells fruit in the market. She would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to expand her business.
 Son T. T. is 36 years old. She has a restaurant (sells coffee, beer). She would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to invest in her restaurant.
 Hoa T. P. is 27 years old. She would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to expand livestock.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana is a dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for ten years and has employed two people from his community. He sells his milk to Kenya Cooperative Creameries. He is also a cash crop farmer and sells his tea to the local market. 

Johana is 41 years old. He is married and has four children who are all attending school.

Johana has a clean record with Juhudi Kilimo after he successfully completed his previous two loans of 45,000 KES and 60,000 KES. He has requested this loan of 80,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will go towards the education of his children.

In the future, he would like to own at least three quality dairy cows. He is grateful to Juhudi for the support given.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, de 37 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Los arduos días de trabajo que tiene Félix en su chacra, le han ayudado a mejorar su economía, es por eso que trabaja todo lo que puede, sembrando plátano y café, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de La Merced. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus plantaciones, ya que sabe que unos productos sanos se venden a mejor precio, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que subir los empinados cerros de su poblado, ya que es ahí donde tiene sus sembríos. Para el futuro, espera mejorar sus chacras y sembrar en totalidad todas sus tierras. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea entrar en mora y perjudicar a su grupo comunal, en donde es muy querido por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los dos mil quinientos soles que solicita, comprará insumos para cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas de insectos.
texts.en:
Félix, age 37, is a very modest and hard-working man. He lives in his parents’ house, and what he wants most is to get ahead in life. Félix’s arduous days of working on his farm have helped him improve his finances. That is why he works as hard as he can planting bananas and coffee. He will later take these products to sell at the market in the city of Merced. What he likes the most about his work is taking care of his crops. He knows that healthy products sell for a better price. He has been doing this activity for five years. He considers the most difficult part to be having to climb the steep hills in his village. That is where he has his crops. In the future he hopes to improve his farm and plant on all of his land. This is his third loan with MFP, and he is prepared to make all of his payments punctually. He does not want to be in arrears and penalize his communal bank. He is held in high regard in his communal bank because of the order he imposes in their meetings. He will use the 2,500 soles that he is requesting to buy supplies to take care of his crops and protect them from plagues of insects.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to take care of his crops and protect them from plagues of insects

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
la sra Rosibel C. L. es una mujer trabajadora, que se dedica a la venta de comida y golosinas desde hace varios años en su casa de habitacion.
Rosibel es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales los tiene estudiando en el colegio de la localidad.
Rosibel se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar la comida que vende durante todo el dia.
junto con su esposo han dedicado tiempo para sus hijos.
su tiempo libre lo dedica  a la crianza de gallinas.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de las comidas y de las golosinas, para incrementar sus ventas y asi tener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosibel C. L. is a hardworking woman, who has been selling food and snacks from her home for the past several years. Rosibel is the mother of three children who are all attending school in town. She awakens at 4 a.m. each day to prepare food to be sold throughout the day. She and her husband are dedicated to their children. Rosibel spends her free time raising chickens. This loan will be used to buy more materials (products) to be used for the manufacture of foods and sweets, in order to increase her sales and bring in better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de refrescos, carnes, tortillas, manteca, arroz, pollo, condimentos, agua, papas, repollos, cebollas, tomates, zanahorias, pepinos, yuca, lechuga. (soft drinks, meats, lard, rice, spices, water, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, carrots, cucumbers, casava and lettuce)

loans.name: Ma Guadalupe

texts.es: Ma Guadalupe Tojo M. trabaja en una maquiladora donde se levanta temprano para ir a su labor. Ella es madre de 2 hijos que están en edad escolar, es por ello que solicita un crédito para comprar los útiles escolares, uniformes. Ma Guadalupe quiere ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor educación para que en un futuro sean personas profesionistas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe Martinez works in a beauty store and gets up very early every day to get to her job. She is the mother of 2 children who are currently attending school. Guadalupe is requesting a loan to purchase school supplies and uniforms for her children. She would like to provide her children with a good education, so they will have good professions in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To help pay for school supplies and uniforms for her two children

loans.name: Maria Barbarita

texts.es:
María de 56 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona urbana caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales.

Comenzó con su tienda de vivieres ya que por su sector no había y necesitaba genera ingresos para su familia, poco a poco vendiendo aceites, arroz, bebidas pudo tener su tienda. Ahora trabaja todos los días en su tienda y en ocasiones vende comida. 

Para surtir mas su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar, bebidas. En el futuro quiere tener bien surtida su tienda para que sus clientes tengan mas opciones.
texts.en:
María, 56 years old, has a small store in the front of her house. She lives in an urban area where most people are informal merchants. She started her general store because there were none in her neighborhood and she needed to have an income for her family. She was able to open the store by selling oils, rice and beverages little by little. She now works every day in her store and occasionally sells food. In order to diversify her business, she will use the loan to buy rice, sugar and beverages. In the future, she would like to have a lot of variety in her store to offer her clients more options.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, sugar, beverages

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase important materials for his shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria Margarita es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, barrio Virgen del Carmen, convive con Francisco Lezme, juntos tienen un hijo de 3 años.
     
     Ella comenta que desde muy joven  empezó a trabajar con su macate (Venta ambulante de ropas al contado y a créditos) por que estudiaba y era la única forma de solventar sus estudios ya que sus padres son de escasos recursos y solo podía acompañar en los gastos de la casa, hoy en día ella trabaja por cuenta propia, con varios años de experiencia en el ramo y cuenta con  clientela formada.

       Agradece a  Fundación Paraguaya  por la oportunidad que le brinda para acceder a un préstamo y promete cumplir con puntualidad con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita is from the city of Carapegúa located in the community of Virgen de Carmen. She lives with Francisco and together they have a three-year-old son.
    She says that ever since she was small she has worked in sales (as a roving salesperson selling clothes on lay away or credit). She did this because she was a student and this was the only way she was able to study. Her parents are poor and were only able to pay for the household expenses. Today she works for herself. She has many years of experience in the field and has a dedicated customer base. She is thankful for the Paraguayan Foundation for the opportunity they have provided for her by making available this loan. She promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: She will buy clothing such as jeans, blouses, shirts and other items.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas, age 32, sells clothes for a living. He has been engaged in this work for three years and his monthly income from the business is Kshs. 6,000. He is requesting a loan of Kshs 30,000 from KADET Ltd. and will use the loan to purchase more clothes to offer for sale during the coming festive season. With the anticipated profit from the business, he hopes to open another business. 

This is his second loan and his previous loan was successfuly repaid. His dreams are to have a stable business and to assist the needy in the society.

Douglas and his wife, Jacklyne B., who also produces some income, do not have children, but together they support another family of six people.

loans.use: To expand his clothing sales business

loans.name: Angeliza's Group

texts.en:
Angeliza S. is from the village of Brgy. Sta.Cruz, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old. Angeliza is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Angeliza is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Angeliza owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Angeliza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angeliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Angeliza is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Angeliza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Moeun S. is a 23-year-old married man with no children yet. His wife is a garment worker and earns a fixed salary every month. The couple lives in Kompong Chhnang Province.

Moeun has been employed as a construction worker since 2005, and he earns a profit on average of 1.5 USD per day. In order to earn more money, Moeun wants to buy a secondhand motorcycle to start a new business as a motor taxi driver. This is why he would like to request a loan from Hattha Kaksekar Limited, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.name: Abiyunze Group

texts.fr: Jean Damascene M. est commerçant, et il est un membre du groupe Abiyunze.  Il a 25 ans, il est marie, et il a 2 enfants entre 10 mois et 3 ans.  Son niveau d’éducation est l’année 6eme primaire, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 60 poules pour son commerce.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est l’augmentation de l’activité.  Il voudrait devenir grand commerçant, et distributeur aux autres.  Il voudrait aussi assurer le bien être de sa famille, et s’autofinancer.
texts.en: Jean Damascene M. is a shopkeeper, and he is a member of the Abiyunze group. He is 25 years old, married, and has two children whose ages vary between 10 months and 3 years. He studied up to the 6th grade in primary school, and he is going to use his loan to buy 60 hens for his business. His strategy to raise his sales is to increase his business. He would like to become a large retailer and distribute goods to others. He would also like to ensure the well-being of his family and to be self-financing.

loans.use: To buy 60 hens for his business.

loans.name: Keur Sambou 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de KEUR SAMBOU 2 vient de recevoir son premier financement avec CAURIE-MF. Il est composé de 42 femmes qui sont toutes du même village. 

Madame MARIEME S., debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo et mise en médaillon est présidente du Banc Villageois. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. 

Elle fait principalement de l'élevage, comme activité parallèle elle fait du petit commerce de produits divers, tels de l'arachide, niébé etc.. 

Son premier crédit avec CAURIE-MF lui permettra de mieux développer son activité. 

Son objectif est de constituer une bonne épargne afin de prétendre à un prochain prêt plus important.
texts.en:
Composed of 42 women who are all from the same village, the Banc Villageois of KEUR SAMBOU 2 has just received its first financing with CAURIE-MF.  Ms. MARIEME S. (standing at the far right in the photo and appearing in the cameo) is the president of the Banc Villageois.  She is 53 years old, married, and a mother of five children.  She mainly raises livestock.  On the side, she has small business involving a variety of goods, such as peanuts, black-eyed peas, etc.  

Her first loan with CAURIE-MF will enable her to develop her business further.  Her goal is to save up a good amount of money in order to aspire to a larger subsequent loan.

loans.use: Buying a sheep to fatten

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wood and a cutting machine to use in a souvenirs workshop

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha P. and her husband, Mr. Khay Kung, live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokha sells vegetables, while her husband is a wooden house builder. She is asking for a loan of $1,000. She will use $600 of the loan to purchase more vegetables for resale and the remaining $400 to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable for resale and build a restroom for house

loans.name: Hilda Teresa

texts.es: CLIENTE RECURRENTE TIENE 56 AÑOS D. EDAD CUENTA CON BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO D. PAGO VIVE EN CASA D. SUS PADRES TIENE DOS HIJOS ES SEPARADA HACE MAS D. 11 AÑOS CUENTA CON NEGOCIO EN EL MERCADO SANTO DOMINGO TIENE UNA BODEGA BAZAR CUENTA CON UN PUESTO PROPIO SOLICITA CREDITO PARA INVERTIRLO EN CAPITAL D. TRABAJO
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda Teresa is 56 years old and has a good credit record.  She lives with her two children in her parents'  home and has been separated for over 11 years.  She has a stall in the Santo Domingo market where she has set up a grocery store.

She plans to use the loan as working capital.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a 44-year-old single mother of five, living in Hioma, Uganda, with a dream of building her own house for residing in. She runs a business of a bar and lodge plus a cosmetics shop. She has been operating them for ten years and the business is still at its boom stage. She faces the challenge of employee misconduct, and she hopes in the future to build her own bar and lodges. She wants the loan to buy beds and bed sheets for the lodge.

loans.use: Buying beds and bed sheets for the lodge

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married and has two children. He sells men's clothing at one of the markets in Melitopol city. He has been in this business for 12 years. He has always tried to offer his clients large variety at affordable prices. His profit is about 5,000 UAH per month. The clothing business is the only source of income for his family. Oleg uses the profit to help his parents to survive economically as well.

Oleg would like to borrow 20,000 UAH to increase his inventory. He is going to use the loan to purchase new clothing for the spring season. Oleg is very optimistic and believes he can develop his business even more.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing for the spring season

loans.name: Alexis

texts.en: Alexis is 29 years old.  He is very hardworking.  He owns a general store in which he sells a variety of items such as radio batteries, rice, sugar, and clothes. Alex is requesting a loan to buy more batteries, rice and sugar in order to increase his inventory.

loans.use: purchase batteries, sugar, and rice to resell

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en: This is 31 year-old Mustapha K..  He is married, and has 4 children ages 3, 6, 10 and 12 years. In 2006, Mustapha established his essential drugs business. He began his business because he believes this business will help him provide livelihood for his family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 350,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Mustapha requires a loan in order to add more stock to business for more profit. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Mustapha plans to open a bigger shop, educate his children to university level and build a house for his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more essential drugs for his business

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en: From a large and humble family, Gulmira A., 32, is a married loving mother of one son. She started her business of raising and selling cattle in 2002, learning everything on her own. Now helped by her husband, Gulmira provides a better quality of life for her family with the income she generates. She is requesting a 1000 AZN loan to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment, Gulmira will be able to substantially increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 29 years old, married and has two children.  

He makes metallic boxes, tanks, cooking pots and energy-saving cookers so as to earn a living. He has been in the business for eight years. He has employed two people to assist him.  

He has become more focused in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya. He also saves his money through Faulu Kenya. He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  

He has requested 50,000 KES to buy metal sheets.

loans.use: To buy sheet metal.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 44 years old and married with three children.  To earn a living, he sells school uniforms.  He has been engaged in the business for nineteen years.  He also sells mobile phone airtime cards.  

He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya, his lifestyle has improved and he has gained confidence as the chairman of his group, which is registered under Faulu Kenya.  

He has requested 80,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  He will use the loan to buy mobile phone airtime cards and fabric for making uniforms.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making uniforms and mobile phone airtime cards.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: Emiliano tiene 50 años, es separado, vive con su hijo William en su casa propia  en el centro poblado de natividad del distrito de Pichari. Ante la separación con su esposa, por lo que solo tuvo que afrontar la vida solo y hacerse cargo de su hijo. Desde entonces se dedica a los negocios, donde posee un terreno agrícola y es ahí donde cultiva café y cacao. Por otro lado es dueño de un motel y por tal desea amueblarlo completamente para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por tal razón pide un crédito a MFP para cumplir con su propósito. Este es su segundo empréstito  con MFP, por lo que esta agradecido y comprometido a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Emiliano es un hombre  solidario con todos los de su banco comunal. Con los 3.000 nuevos soles desea amueblara mejor su motel.
texts.en:
Emiliano is 50 years old, separated from his spouse, and lives in his own home with his son William in the central village of Natividad, District of Pichai. Having separated from his wife, he had to face life alone and take care of his son. Emiliano focuses on his businesses. He has a plot of farmland on which he grows coffee and cacao. Emiliano is also the owner of a motel and wants to completely furnish it so that he can offer the best service to his customers. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from MFP to accomplish his goal.

This is his second loan with MFP. For this reason, he is grateful and promises to be punctual with his payments. Emiliano is supportive of everyone in his Communal Bank. His loan of 3000 PEN will be used to buy furnishings to improve his motel.

loans.use: to purchase furnishings for his motel.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un menuisier. Ils ont trois enfants.
Akossiwa a travaillé comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle vend des produits d'alimentation. Elle achète les produits à Lomé.
Akossiwa a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 4 cartons de conserves, 6 pattes alimentaires et des autres produits d'alimentation.
Elle vend aussi de la boisson.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a woman of 39. She is married to a carpenter and they have three children. 

Akossiwa has worked at selling goods since 2005. She sells foodstuffs. She buys her products in Lomé.

Akossiwa has requested her third loan from WAGES to buy four cases of tinned goods, six cases of pasta, and other groceries. 

She also sells alcoholic beverages.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Keom

texts.en:
Keom, 50, is a married rice farmer who lives in Kompong Speu Province. She is married to Mr. Chork, who is 51. They have three children, two of whom are single and one who is married. One of her children sells clothes in Phnom Penh City. 

Keom's husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees behind his house. Palm-tree-climbing jobs are very common for poor people who live in the commune. Keom is looking for a loan to help her daughter buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: to help her daughter buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lourdeliza

texts.en:
Lourdeliza is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. She has a food shop that sells snacks like rice and cassava cakes. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks. Lourdeliza is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es: Maria De Lourdes de 74años es una mujer que disfruta de su actividad. Ella  se dedica a la venta de frijoles cosidos y tamales, el cual inició hace 45 años, Sus clientes, son amigos, vecinos, referidos que circulan por su vivienda donde está ubicado su negocio. Aunque su gran desafío es la alta competencia, se sostiene con precios justos y con su natural amabilidad y vocación de servicio que favorecen la sostenibilidad de su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual inicia su historial crediticio, solicitando este crédito para la compra al por mayor de frijoles y leña para su negocio.
texts.en: Maria De Lourdes, 74, is a woman who enjoys her work. She sells cooked beans and tamales, which she has been doing for 45 years. Her customers are friends, neighbors and referrals who pass by her home, which is where her business is located. Although her great challenge is the high level of competition, she sustains her business with fair prices, her natural friendliness, and dedication to providing service that keeps her clients coming back. This is why she has started her credit history by requesting this loan, which is for buying beans and firewood wholesale for her business.

loans.use: to buy beans and firewood wholesale

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 46 years old and is married to Saphine. They have eight children. Michael is a tailor by profession and is applying for a loan to enable him to buy more materials to add to his stock and also to buy another sewing machine. He hopes to open up a tailoring school in the future.

loans.use: To buy more materials to add to his stock.

loans.name: Sofina

texts.en:
Sofina is 39 years old and has been engaged in the buying and selling of fish and meat for almost seven years. Through this business, she can afford to send her three children to school. She works hard to fill the needs of her children. 

She is requesting a loan amount of PHP 7,000 to buy fish, meat and two Styrofoam boxes where she will stock her goods. She wants to develop her business into a bigger one in order to gain a higher income for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fish, meat and two Styrofoam boxes where she will stock her goods.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 53 years old and has been engaged in the piggery business for seven years. She said it is not easy work to take on this occupation. But because of the determination and inspiration that her children provide, she does everything for the benefit of their underprivileged lifestyle.

For that reason, Florentina is asking for a loan amount PHP 5,000 to provide for the needs of her pigs by giving them better feeds and vitamins. She is dreaming to become one of the fortunate dealers of pigs among different municipalities in their province. She is patiently growing her business into a bigger venture. She hopes that someday she will achieve her dream and lift her family from poverty.

loans.use: to provide for the needs of her pigs with such things as feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Fahamu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nankafu, leader du groupe d’affaire «Fahamu», est  entrepreneur, âgée de 56  ans, mariée, mère de plusieurs  enfants et petits fils et filles. Son mari est un petit commerçant. Elle est vendeuse de vêtements (friperie). Elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre depuis sa jeunesse. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 9 cycles avec  crédit de Hekima. Son premier capital fut  reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  5 ballons de friperies et réaliser d’autres micro projets de la famille.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et acheter une jeep pour son déplacement personnel.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Nankafu, the borrower and leader of the Fahamu business group, is a 56-year-old businesswoman who is married, the mother of several children, and has grandsons and granddaughters. Her husband is a small storekeeper. She sells clothing (second-hand). She has been undertaking small, income-generating occupations such as this since her youth. 

Nankafu has just completed 9 loan cycles with Hekima. Her initial capital came from her husband. This new loan will allow her to provision her business with 5 bales of second-hand clothing and take on other mini-projects for her family. Furthermore, she wishes to see her children grow up comfortably, and to buy a jeep for personal transportation.

Nankafu thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women who are excluded from traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase 5 bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Piedad Asucena

texts.es:
La Señora. Piedad es socia del banco comunal Bella Vista, vive por una comunidad que  pertenece al a parroquia Victoria del Portete (Cuenca), esta localizada al sur de la Capital Azuaya, lleva su nombre en honor a la batalla ocurrida en sus campos, precisamente en las faldas del cerro Portete el 27 de Febrero de 1829. Su gente mantiene las tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

La Señora. Piedad tiene 23 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido una hija de 3 años de edad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a cuidar de su hija que aun esta pequeña, como pasa en casa se dedica a críar animales como: cuyes y ganado. También labora en la agricultura y lo que cosecha  es para el consumo de su casa y el sobrante lo vende. 

Es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar en esta actividad.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Piedad is a member of the Communal Bank “Bella Vista”. She lives in a community that is part of the parish of Victoria del Portete (Cuenca), which is located to the south of the capital of Azuaya. This area is named in honor of a field battle that took place at the foothill of Portete on February 27, 1829. The people have maintained the local traditions and earn their living by raising animals and farming.

Sra. Piedad is 23 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a three-year-old daughter. Her husband works as a private employee. They do not own a home, so they live at the house of a relative.

Piedad spends her time performing the household chores and taking care of her daughter who is still small. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs and cattle. Piedad also engages in farming. Her harvest is for household consumption and the surplus is sold.

This is her first loan with the Communal Bank and the money will be invested in the purchase of chickens so that she can start this activity. Her goal is to have a home of her own.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Dionisio Ramon

texts.es:
Dionisio tiene 51 años de edad, está casado con Lina de 53 años, viven en su casa propia. El es mecánico de motos hace más de treinta años y su señora es encargada de limpieza en una universidad, quien también aporta en los gastos del hogar, tienen dos hijos todos mayores de edad y profesionales independientes.
Dionisio es uno de los pioneros en la ciudad en el rubro de mecánica para motos, lo aprendió lo hizo en la capital en donde estuvo trabajando por cinco años y después habilitó para su propio taller, en donde trabaja con el su hermano.
Actualmente trabajan también con él un sobrino y un primo a quienes les enseña la profesión, cabe destacar que la mayoría de los mecánicos de moto de la ciudad  han pasado por su taller. Dionisio tiene clientela formada por la responsabilidad y la calidad de los trabajo que realiza. 
Necesita el crédito para la compra de una moto, lo cual lo ayudará a la hora de visitar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dionisio, 51, is married to Lina, 53; they live in their own house.  He’s been a motorcycle mechanic for over thirty years and his wife works in the cleaning crew of a university and also contributes to household expenses.  They have two adult children who are independent professionals.

Dionisio is one of his city’s pioneer motorcycle mechanics.  He learned this skill in the capital where he worked for five years and then set up his own repair shop where he works with his brother.  Currently a nephew and a cousin also work with him; he’s teaching them the profession.  

It’s worth pointing out that most of the city’s motorcycle mechanics have passed through his shop at one time or another.  Dionisio has a well-established clientele which has formed thanks to the responsibility and quality of the work he does.  He needs the loan to buy a motorcycle that will be of use to him when he has to go visit customers.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Bumuutsogzol

texts.en:
Bumuutsogzol is a 39-year-old widow who lives with her two sons and one daughter in an outer 'ger' district (a district without basic infrastructure) of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her elder son and daughter attend local university, while her other son attends secondary school. 

Bumuutsogzol has supported her family by operating a clothing retail stall business at the largest outdoor market in of Mongolia for eleven years. When she first began her business, she had one million MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) in working capital. Now she has 6 million MNT in working capital. She sells jeans and trousers, which she imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China, twice a month. 

She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase jeans and trousers for the upcoming season. “Sometimes it’s really hard to support the family alone, but it’s my responsibility, therefore I must to do that,” Bumuutsogzol says.

loans.use: to purchase more jeans for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El comité "Nuevo Amanecer" es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar en equipo, y de esa forma fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La Sra. Fatima es una de las miembros del comité, ella se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos. Comenta que le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que le gustan mucho los animales, gracias a su trabajo incansable ella logra mantener a su familia y de paso ayudar con los gastos de la casa. Ella se define como una mujer muy luchadora, trabajadora y emprendedora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollitos para la cría, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio. Esta muy agradecida a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da a ella y a sus amigas.
texts.en:
The group “New Dawn” is from the city of San Ignacio and is in its third loan cycle of the entrepreneurial women program with the foundation.  The women’s goal is to work together as a team and in this way create a spirit of solidarity and reach the highest level of the program.

Fatima is one of the members of the group.  She raises and sells chicken.  She says that she likes what she does very much because she likes animals.  Thanks to her untiring work she manages to support her family and help with household expenses.  She describes herself as a fighter, hard working, and entrepreneurial.

She requests this loan to buy chicks to raise, which will help her a lot in her business.  She is very thankful to the foundation for the opportunity they give her and her friends.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Bunafsha

texts.ru: Бунафша проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 25 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет средне - специальное образование, портниха. Бунавша 15 лет занимается шитьем. Кроме того она у себя дома открыла интернет кафе. В этой области Бунафша четыре года. Она берет кредит для покупки компьютеров.
texts.en: Bunafsha lives in the city of Khujand.  She is 25 years old, married and has two children.  She has a secondary-specialized education and is a seamstress.  Bunafsha has been involved in sewing for 15 years.  Besides this work, she opened an internet cafe at her home.  Bunafsha has been in this business for four years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of computers.

loans.use: to purchase computers

loans.name: Fátima Narcisa

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fátima,  tiene 52 años de edad está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad y aún viven en su casa junto a sus respectivas familias. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para el negocio de su esposo el cual se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo,  una vez por semana  se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Guayaquil a comprar la mercadería para luego con la misma trasladarse hasta la ciudad de Esmeraldas lugar donde realiza  sus ventas puerta a puerta, allá se queda dos  a tres días y luego regresa a su hogar, lleva más de 28 años en este negocio y en ocasiones ella lo acompaña en sus recorridos.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar ropa de todo tipo  y ropa interior. Lleva más de cuatro años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la oportunidad que le han brindado para poder ayudar a su esposo con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The “San Vicente” communal bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place noted for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.


We met Fátima here.  She’s 52 years old, married and has three children who are all now adults but still live at home with their respective families.  Her husband is a merchant.


She is a great housewife who is taking out the loan for her husband’s business.  He is a merchant; he sells all types of clothes.  Once a week he goes to the city of Guayaquil to buy merchandise to then take to the city of Esmeralda which is where he sells it door-to-door.  He stays there two or three days and then returns home.  He’s been in this business for more than 28 years and sometimes she accompanies him on his routes.


This loan will be used to buy all types of clothes and underwear.  She’s been in the communal bank four years and likes it because of the opportunity it’s given her to help her husband with the loans.  Her dream is to have a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy clothes and underwear.

loans.name: Rabikhon

texts.ru: Рабихон жительница города Исфара. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Рабихон занимается торговлей на рынке. Она готовит и продает горохи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки гороха в оптом.
texts.en: Rabikhon lives in the city of Isfara. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children. Rabikhon trades in the market. She cooks and sells peas. She has been doing this for five years. She is taking out a loan to buy peas in bulk.

loans.use: buy peas in bulk.

loans.name: Woody

texts.en:
Woody is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 4 children. 

Woody has provided motorcycle transport or "habal-habal" services for 5 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for his business. Woody is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline for his transport service.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 49-years-old, married to Simon and they are blessed with three children. She has been in the dairy farming business for the past ten years with the monthly income of Kes 8,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Lucia will use the loan to buy animal feeds. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to venture into bee keeping.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for  her dairy cow.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 35-year-old man living in Taiz, Yemen. He is a father of two children. His background education is Chartered Accountant. Khalid's business is a grocery store that he started 15 years ago with limited capital and income. He knows how to attract customers through the service that he provides and the prices that he offers. His main customers are the homemakers living in his neighborhood and the local community. So, he is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses. 

Being an ambitious man, Khalid would like to expand his business. So he took a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to rent a separate space and increase the variety of products. 

In the future, he hopes to purchase a truck, which he will use to pick up goods from wholesalers to take to his grocery and to purchase another shop to open, an accounting office, which has a network of branches, titled by his name.

loans.use: to rent a separate space and increase the variety of products

loans.name: Antoinie

texts.fr: Antoinie est une femme de 55 ans mère de famille. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( patates, macabo, maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 17 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai acheter des régimes de plantains et des sacs de patates pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy bags of potatoes and bunches of plantains.

loans.name: Wangnigninangbe Group

texts.fr: WANGNIGNINANGBE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Salimatou Augustine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 41 ans. Salimatou Augustine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Salimatou Augustine est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Salami. Le couple a deux enfants, scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Salimatou Augustine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Salimatou Augustine vend des sacs, des chaussures et des savons depuis dix ans. Salimatou Augustine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Salimatou Augustine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe WANGNIGNINANGBE, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des chaussures, des sacs et des savons.

loans.name: Nueva Victoria No. 1 Group

texts.es:
Cecilia es una joven de 21 años de edad es soltera con una linda familia, ella vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Cecilia para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, con este negocio lleva ella más de 15 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio.
Cecilia con el afán de mejorar su negocio ha decidido solicitar un préstamo  que lo invertirá en la compra de ropa típica como: fajas, cortes y güipiles, pues con la época navideña su negocio de ropa típica tiene mucha demanda por esa razón el acude a un préstamo para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes. Su gran sueño es fortalecer su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de  productos de ropa típica como: fajas, cortes y güipiles.

loans.name: Ami Chantal

texts.en:
Mrs. Ami Chantal M. is a 43 year-old woman who is married with four children. She has shouldered most of the household expenses since her husband lost his job three years ago. She owns a small general grocery store where she sells iced water and food. However, the income is not enough to cover all the family needs, and her children are often sent home from school due to non-payment of school fees. With the situation becoming increasingly worrying, Mrs. M. obtained a loan of $350 which she paid back quickly and without any problem. She manages her business well, and deserves financial support to allow the business to grow.

She is requesting a loan of $900 to fund the buying and reselling of basic food products. This will allow her to increase her income, thus ensuring the well-being of her children and her family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme M. Ami Chantal est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Mariée et mère de 04 enfants, elle supporte la grande partie des charges du ménage depuis que son mari a perdu son emploi il y a 3 ans. Propriétaire d’une petite boutique d’alimentation générale, elle y vend de l’eau glacée en dehors de l’alimentation. Les revenus étant insuffisants pour couvrir les besoins de la famille, ses enfants sont régulièrement renvoyés de l’école pour non payement des frais de scolarité. La situation devenant de plus en plus alarmante, Mme M. avait sollicité et obtenu un crédit de $350 qu’elle avait promptement remboursé sans incident. Elle fait d’une bonne gestionnaire et mérite d’être financièrement soutenue pour accroître ses activités.

Le crédit de $ 900 qu’elle demande va servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des produits d’alimentation générale. Ce faisant, elle pourra augmenter ses revenus pour assurer le bien-être de ses enfants et de sa famille.

loans.use: buying and selling of general food products

loans.name: Janab

texts.en: J. is 36 years old and married with three children aged 17, 13 and 8. She sells household goods. Her husband, Uci, does not have fixed income. She could earn $15/day, but the profit is only  $2.50/day. She very much needs to get a $50 loan to make her shop complete and sustainable. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Preparing and selling cooked food

loans.name: Adévi

texts.en:
A young woman of 22 years, Miss Adévi N. is a student in her second-to-last year of high school. Brilliant at school and very entrepreneurial in her own small business, she comes from a very poor family where hunger and misery are daily occurrences. Determined to go far with her studies, Miss N. hast taken charge at school as well as at home. Her very elderly parents no longer have the energy necessary to support her. She learned from her mother the business of preparing coconut oil, which she has mastered perfectly. The sole source of income for her family, coconut oil is highly consumed throughout the area and needs financial means to render it profitable, especially during June and July, when market demand is significant. At the beginning of her summer vacation and hence the time of intense coconut oil-preparing activity, Miss N. wants to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $550 to buy a coconut farm at a good price, which she will exploit when the time comes. This will avoid the usual material-related shortages that take place after this time.

By putting her time to good use in producing enough oil, thanks to this loan, Miss N. will be able to ensure her return to school next year and will allow her parents to survive.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Jeune fille de 22 ans, Mlle N. Adévi est élève en classe de première. Brillante à l’école et très entreprenante dans son petit commerce, elle est issue d’une famille très pauvre où la faim et la misère sont au quotidien. Déterminée à aller loin dans ses études, Mlle N. depuis trois ans se prend en charge aussi bien à l’école qu’à la maison. Ses parents très vieux n’ont plus l’énergie nécessaire pour la supporter. Elle a appris auprès de sa mère, l’activité de préparation d’huile de coco qu’elle maîtrise parfaitement. Seule source de revenu de sa famille, l’huile de coco est très consommée dans la préfecture et nécessite des moyens financiers pour la rentabiliser surtout à partir des mois de juin et juillet où la demande devient très importante sur le marché. A l’orée des grandes vacances et donc de la période d’intense activité de préparation d’huile de coco, Mlle N. a voulu miser gros afin d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires. Elle sollicite un crédit de $550 pour acheter d’ores et déjà une cocoterais à un bon prix, qu’elle exploitera au moment venu ; ceci pour éviter les tracasseries habituelles liées à la rareté de cette matière première après cette période.

En mettant son temps à profit à produire suffisamment d’huile grâce à ce crédit, Mlle N. pourra assurer la rentrée prochaine des classes et toute l’année scolaire et permettre à ses parents de survivre.

loans.use: To buy a coconut farm

loans.name: Salima

texts.ru:
When the life conditions became completely unbearable, Salima went to sell on a market. This was 6 years ago. For the last several years, Salima’s husband has been away working as a seasonal laborer in Russia. He earns very little. The irregular money transfers that he sends are not enough to pay for necessities. Salima has 3 children. One of her daughters is mentally retarded and sits at home. Salima tries anything that might bring extra income. She specializes in sale of dried fruits (apricots and prunes). During the summer, when melons and watermelons appear on the market, Salima switches to sell them. Salima’s older daughter helps her mother to sell. Over the 5 months of being a MicroInvest borrower, Salima demonstrated that MicroInvest loans made a noticeable difference in her business. Salima plans to continue her relationship with MicroInvest, as the loans she receives help her sustain her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Когда условия жизни Салимы стали совсем невыносимыми она вышла на базар торговать. Это произошло 6 лет назад. Ее муж уже несколько лет в России на заработках, но зарабатывает очень мало. Деньги высылает нерегулярно, и присланных не хватает на жизнь. У Салимы 3 детей, одна из дочерей умственно отсталая в развитии, и сидит дома. Салима старается заниматься всем тем что приносит прибыль. Основная направленность – это продажа сухофруктов (чернослив, абрикосы). В летний сезон, когда на базаре появляются арбузы и дыни Салима, переходит на их продажу. В торговле ей помогает ее старшая дочь. Кредитуется 5 месяцев и за это время займы Микроинвест внесли заметный вклад в ее бизнес. Салима и дальше собирается сотрудничать с Микроинвест, так как займы помогают ей поддержать ее бизнес.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto is 29 years old. He has a lot of projects and dreams that go into the future. Humberto wanted to start a family with a woman he thought will grow old with him. But, unfortunately, life played him a trick. Soon after their union she died. And he was left alone, with his unfulfilled dreams.

He fell into depression for some time, but Humberto realized that there was a strong reason to live and keep going: Hipólita, his little sister, who needed his support and love and lives with him.

Humberto sells -door to door- nutritional supplements from Tien, a well known Peruvian brand. He wishes to widen the variety of products he offers to increase his sales. So he is asking for a loan of US$ 325. This amount will be invested in more Tien products to be sold. The increased income would help him support his sister and his parents. He would repay it in 6 months. A little help from you will go a long way.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Humberto de 29 años de edad es un joven soñador con innumerables planes para el futuro decidió formar su propia familia al lado de la mujer que él creía que lo acompañaría siempre, pero desafortunadamente el destino le jugó una mala pasada, al poco tiempo de convivir ella perdió la vida, dejándolo sólo y con todos sus planes y sueños por cumplir.

Sumido en una inmensa depresión se dio cuenta que aún tenia una razón por la cuál seguir luchando en este mundo. Su hermanita menor Hipólita, a quién apoya moral y económicamente en el seno de su hogar. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de suplementos nutricionales de la prestigiosa marca peruana TIEN en forma ambulatoria; su deseo es aumentar el monto de su capital con el fin de ofrecer mayor variedad para la optimización de sus ventas, para esto solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares dinero que invertirá y le permitirá generar mayores ingresos para apoyar económicamente además de su hermanita a sus padres, él promete hacer la devolución del préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses.Humberto nos necesita, ayudémoslo a salir adelante junto a su familia.

loans.use: Buying a larger variety of products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary C. is 45 years old and is married with 7 children.  She lives in Benin City, Nigeria where she sells cassava products.  That means, she processes cassava into our local food called "satana" or "fufu" and sells it to people living in her community.  She has been in this business since 1986 and is currently a LAPO member.  She is requesting a loan of $800 to enable her to buy more cassava, which she will process into local food.

loans.use: To buy more cassava to process and sell.

loans.name: Pum

texts.en: Pum C., age 38, works with her husband selling fish at the market, earning about $4 per day.  They have four children, two who are employed at a garment factory making about $70 per month each, one who works in Thailand earning about $100 a month, and one who is a student.  She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to purchase a fishing boat with a motor for fishing and to buy piglets and feed to breed pigs for additional income.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat and pigs to breed.

loans.name: Elikram

texts.en:
Elikram B. is an auto mechanic in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He is married and has five children.

Elikram B. has been working as a mechanic for the last 15 years. Elikram has successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. He has proved to be one of their valued and trusted customers. He is currently looking for additional funding of $1,200 so that he can invest in purchasing more modern tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more tools for his business

loans.name: Mercedes Concepción

texts.es:
Mercedes P. is originally from the Sauce municipality in Leon, and she dedicates herself to teaching in a small school in the village. Everyday she walks a long distance to arrive at the school. Despite the difficult economic situation she is going through, she always conveys an excellent spirit to her students.

Mercedes currently finds herself in an urgent situation to invest in the reconstruction of her house. Due to the fact that her teaching job does not allow her to obtain a sufficient income, she seeks support through other means.

For this reason Mercedes approaches Ceprodel for assistance with loans. These loans will be useful in the reconstruction of her home, providing a better way of life for her two young children who greatly deserve this.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Mercedes P. es una dama originaria del municipio del Sauce en León y se dedica a la docencia en un pequeño colegio del pueblo. Día a día camina un largo trecho para llegar a este colegio y a pesar de la difícil situación económica que atraviesa siempre transmite un espíritu de superación para sus alumnos.

La situación que atraviesa la señora Mercedes es la urgencia de invertir en la reconstrucción de su casa por el hecho de que el trabajo de docencia no le permite obtener estos ingresos por lo que se ve obligada a buscar apoyo por otros medios.

Por tal razón es que la señora Mercedes acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con los créditos que por cierto le han sido de mucha utilidad en la reconstrucción de su casa para así brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a sus dos pequeños hijos que tanto se lo merecen.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the reconstruction of her home

loans.name: Wanyange Lake K B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Christine M.. She is currently in the business of selling used clothing and is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Chirsitne is 22 years old and is married with a husband who is a builder for work. She has 3 children ranging from age 5 months to 4 years old. Each week, Christine makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to meet the basic needs of her family. Christine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more sacks of charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Christine is joined in her small group by Fatuma N., Hasifah N., Prossy A., and Hellen A.. Fatuma N. has a business in clothing sales and wants to boost business. Hasifah N. is currently operating a tailoring business and wants a loan to purchase a bicycle and more fabric. Prossy A. operates a business selling beer and wants to add more stock. Hellen A. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to add more capital.

loans.use: To increase clothing purchases

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr:
Mr. N. is a tree grower who has a lot of experience in buying and selling flowers and more specifically dwarf baobabs.

These plants are destined for the landscaping of green spaces and are more often put to use by innkeepers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur N. est abroculteur qui a une grande experience dans l'achat et la vente de fleurs et plus particulierement des baobabs nains.

Ces plantes sont destinées à l'aménagement des espaces verts et plus souvent utilisées par les hoteliers.

loans.use: Commerce in dwarf baobabs

loans.name: Asunta Desideria

texts.es:
Asunta is 64 years old and she is a clerk at the Civil Registry and she runs her own notary. She has a 25 year old son who is currently attending University.

The only income she earns is through the work she does at the public notary, where she has worked for more than 12 years. The demande for her services is currently in an elevated level.

The loan she is requestnig is to renovate her home. This is the third loan that Asunta has requested from Agrocapital and she has demonstrated great diligence in meeting her payments. Asunta is responsible and punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Asunta de 64 años de edad, en oficial de registro Civil y actualmente tiene su notaría. Tiene un hijo de 25 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando en la Universidad. El único ingreso que pericbe es por su trabajo en la notaría de fe pública y tiene una experiencia de más de 12 años en este negocio. La competencia es de nivel medio pero la demanda por este tipo de servicios también es elevada. La presente solicitud la utilizará para realizar mejoras en su vivienda. Este es el tercer crédito de Asunta en Agrocapital y durante el tiempo de relación con la institución demostró un excelente cumplimiento de pagos, Asunta es una persona responsable y puntual.

loans.use: To renovate her home.

loans.name: Umurzok

texts.en:
Umurzok K. has only been a client of MicroInvest since 2008, but he has already proven himself to be a successful borrower. Thanks to his previous loan he was able to buy a pedigreed bull. Now he has 2 cows and one bull.

Mr. K. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $925 US for 8 months to build a new barn.

loans.use: To build a new barn

loans.name: Julián

texts.es:
For many years, Julián has been in the business of selling charcoal wholesale. His daily routine is to go to the market to sell and to deliver his clients' orders. Señor Julián is 43 year old and is the father of six marvelous and very caring children. He, with his wife, Roslava, who always supports him in everything, want to educate, love, and care for their children in good and bad. As always, señor Julián aspires to be a charcoal exporter on the national level. However, to realize this dream, he needs money. For the time being, he asks for this loan to increase the capital of his business and to buy a motorcycle to transport charcoal where his clients request it. Let's support this father who, with strength and dedication, continues working arduously for the prosperity of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Julián se constituyó en el negocio de la venta de carbón al por mayor desde hace mucho tiempo, su rutina diaria es de ir cada día al mercado para vender y entregar los pedidos de sus clientes. El señor Julián tiene 43 años y es padre de 6 hijos maravillosos y súper cariñosos, él junto a su esposa Rosalva, quién siempre la apoya en todo, ellos desean educar, amar y querer a sus hijos en lo bueno y lo malo. Desde siempre el señor Julián aspira con ser un exportador a nivel nacional de carbón, sin embargo para la realización de este sueño, necesita dinero, por el momento el solicita este préstamo para aumentar el capital de su negocio y comprar un motocarro para transportar el carbón donde sus clientes lo pidan. Apoyemos a este padre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por la prosperidad de su familia.

loans.use: Increase his charcoal sale business and acquire a motorcycle to transport charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to produce fried dishes for her customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary H. is a 44 year old widow and mother of four children. From the income she's earned from her business, Mary has been able to support all her children in completing high school.

She is a petty trader who sells vegetables and fruit in the local market and she enjoys selling goods. Mary has good customer care and because of that many customers buy from her stand. However, she buys her supplies on credit at relatively high prices due to lack of adequate working capital.

With this loan, she wants to purchase supplies of vegetables, salt, and fruit in bulk to better serve her customers. She belongs to the community group called Progress Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, salt, and fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Msiba

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 58-year-old Msiba S. from Dar es Salaam. She is a widowed woman with four children between the ages of 19 and 27 years old; additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because his parents do not take care of him. Msiba has been running a café business since 1993. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all-local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. Msiba's business is doing well. She works at the business for four hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Msiba currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 350 USD in order to renovate her café and to purchase additional cooking oil, wheat flour and maize flour. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Msiba thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To renovate her cafe and to purchase supplies in bulk

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single mother with five children living in Musang, just outside Bamenda, Cameroon. Her restaurant, "Mami Sha," has been operating for a number of years and she has regular customers. She is going to use the loan to buy maize, beans, rice, groundnut oil, salt, firewood, palm oil, and other spices. She has also acquired a good site for her business. She purchases some of her supplies from the "bush" or rural areas in order to get the best prices and increase her profits.

She plans to contribute 50,000 CFA ($100 USD) of her own personal savings to ensure the success of her business plan. This is Margaret's fourth loan from GHAPE, and she has been a member since 2004. The profits from this loan will be used to educate Margaret's children. She also hopes to purchase a plot of land and build a home for her family on that plot. Her profits will also be used to ensure her family eats well, stays healthy and dresses well. She would like to increase their standard of living.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, rice, oil, magi, salt, firewood, palm oil, egusi, pots and flasks, groundnut oil

loans.name: Dédé Nina

texts.en:
Dédé Nina K. was born around 1939 in Cotonou. She is a widowed mother of 7 educated children who have all left the home. She started out selling fabric in Dantokpa Market but afterwards she got her own boutique in her neighborhood where she sells food, bath products, and a little bit of everything. Her parents are deceased and her father was an architect and her mother a reseller. She has had her business for 30 years and she will use this loan to buy assorted products.

Dame K. Dédé Nina est vers 1939 à Cotonou elle est veuve et mère de 07 enfants tous scolarisés et dans la vie active. Elle a commencé par la vente des pagnes dans le grand marché de tokpa mais après gère sa propre boutique en son domicile où ele vendait des divers, des vivres, des produits de toillettes bref un peu de tout. Ses parents sont deccédés et le père était un architecte et la mère de qui elle tenait était revendeuse. Elle exerce cette activité depuis une trentaine d'année et la demande de ses clients étant plus forte elle a sollicité son 4eme crédit pour s'approvisionner.

loans.use: 2 bags of Rice, 2 milkboxes, Preserves, Detergents, Bathroom products

loans.name: Escolastica

texts.en:
When Escolastica took her first loan from FSMA, she had just started a small business of selling used clothing in her neighborhood. She had a hankering to operate a fruit and vegetable stand, as her clothing business was not profitable. With patience, hard work and sacrifice, Escolastica was able to reach this goal and she says that she feels proud and happy that she’d been able to use her loan wisely. Paying to educate her two children is now less stressful for her, although she still needs to increase her income to cover the household expenses.

With this second loan, Escolastica will purchase a large variety of fruits to add to her inventory. She hopes that her business will allow her to buy a small house someday.

loans.use: Purchase fresh fruits to keep operating her business.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos, D. 45 años D. edad es casada hace 30 años, tiene 9 hijos, D. los cuales 3 (los menores) viven con ella en su casa propia. Hace 30 años que llegaron a la selva en busca D. trabajo, jamás pensaron quedarse en ese lugar y mucho menos adquirir un terreno donD. hizo su casa y el resto D. las extensiones las han convertido en un lugar apropiado para cortar y trozar árboles convirtiéndolos en madera para obras, y finalmente con calaminas hizo un cerco destinado para almacenar las maderas. El trabajo D. Santos y su esposo consiste en trozar la madera en pulgadas D. 2, 3 y 4, D. ancho y D. largo D. 3 metros con 40 centímetros, una vez que tiene acumulada la madera Santos la ofrecer a las carpinterías, generalmente, en la mayoría D. las veces trabajan a pedido. Santos es la que administra la contabilidad del negocio y su esposo es el encargado D. traer los árboles y convertirlos en madera, D. ese modo vienen trabajando más D. 12 años, actividad que le es rentable que les permite sostener a su familia. Además, en horas D. la tarD. Santos prepara chicharrones (cerdo) D. 35 a 40 porciones que venD. a 1.50 y 2 soles, con esto lleva cerca D. 6 años, y también le es muy rentable, mientras que se dedica a la venta D. chicharrones va acumulando las maderas para hacerlas secar, y D. ese modo cotizar a un precio mayor que las húmedas; ya que los carpinteros buscan las secas para que cuando fabriquen sus muebles no se doblen. Este es su 5to préstamo consecutivo que viene recibiendo Santos D. MFP, ha pagado sin dificultades sus cuotas, y asimismo se compromete a seguir trabajando con su banco comunal como lo hay venido haciendo hasta ahora. El dinero solicitado es para la compra D. árboles para empezar a trozarlos, y D. ese modo tener capital en madera e ir vendiéndola D. acuerdo a los requerimientos.
texts.en:
Santos, age 45, has been married for 30 years. She has nine children; the three youngest live with her in the home she owns. Thirty years ago, they went to the rainforest looking for work, never thinking of staying there, much less of buying land where they would make their home and convert the rest of the buildings into an area where trees could be cut and split, to convert them into lumber for woodworking. She also maD. a zinc fence in order to store the lumber. Santos and her husband work splitting the wood into 2, 3, and 4-inch width timbers which are 3.40 metres long. Once they have a good stock of lumber, Santos offers it to carpenters although they usually work to order. Santos is the bookkeeper for the business and her husband is in charge of bringing the trees and turning them into lumber; they have been doing this work for more than 12 years as it is a profitable business allowing them to support their family. In addition, Santos prepares between 35 to 40 portions of pork cracklings in the afternoons, which she sells for 1.50 to 2 soles. She has been doing so for roughly six years; this too is very profitable, as while she is selling the cracklings, she gathers the wood to dry it so that they can ask for a higher price than if the wood were still humid: carpenters always look for dry lumber when they make furniture as it will not warp. This is Santos' fifth consecutive loan from MFP: she has always maD. her payments without difficulty and is committed to continue working with her community bank as she has done until now. The loan will be used to buy trees for splitting, so that she will have equity in the lumber and have it ready for sale when her clients need it.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy trees for splitting and resale.
